ASV_Original: And the ark of Jehovah was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
ASV_Paraphrased: seven months ago, the ark of Jehovah was in the country of the Philistines.
BBE_Original: Now the ark of the Lord was in the country of the Philistines for seven months.

ASV_Original: And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, What shall we do with the ark of Jehovah? show us wherewith we shall send it to its place.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Philistians called the priests and the diviners, and they asked, What will we do with the ark of God?
BBE_Original: And the Philistines sent for the priests and those who were wise in secret arts, and said to them, What are we to do with the ark of the Lord? How are we to send it away to its place?

ASV_Original: And they said, If ye send away the ark of the God of Israel, send it not empty; but by all means return him a trespass-offering: then ye shall be healed, and it shall be known to you why his hand is not removed from you.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you leave the ark of God, send it back, but by all means, return him to the altar:
BBE_Original: And they said, If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it without an offering, but send him a sin-offering with it: then you will have peace again, and it will be clear to you why the weight of his hand has not been lifted from you.

ASV_Original: Then said they, What shall be the trespass-offering which we shall return to him? And they said, Five golden tumors, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.
ASV_Paraphrased: and they said, What will the offering be to the Lord of the Philistines?
BBE_Original: Then they said, What sin-offering are we to send to him? And they said, Five gold images of the growths caused by your disease and five gold mice, one for every lord of the Philistines: for the same disease came on you and on your lords.

ASV_Original: Wherefore ye shall make images of your tumors, and images of your mice that mar the land; and ye shall give glory unto the God of Israel: peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will make images of your tumor, and images of your mice that will destroy the land; and you will be honored by God's name: Peradventure he will be lifted from you, and from the gods.
BBE_Original: So make images of the growths caused by your disease and of the mice which are damaging your land; and give glory to the God of Israel: it may be that the weight of his hand will be lifted from you and from your gods and from your land.

ASV_Original: Wherefore then do ye harden your hearts, as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When he had wrought wonderfully among them, did they not let the people go, and they departed?
ASV_Paraphrased: then the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts, and the people fled?
BBE_Original: Why do you make your hearts hard, like the hearts of Pharaoh and the Egyptians? When he had made sport of them, did they not let the people go, and they went away?

ASV_Original: Now therefore take and prepare you a new cart, and two milch kine, on which there hath come no yoke; and tie the kine to the cart, and bring their calves home from them;
ASV_Paraphrased: then take the cart, and the two-pound kine, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and the cart, and
BBE_Original: So now, take and make ready a new cart, and two cows which have never come under the yoke, and have the cows yoked to the cart, and take their young ones away from them:

ASV_Original: and take the ark of Jehovah, and lay it upon the cart; and put the jewels of gold, which ye return him for a trespass-offering, in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away, that it may go.
ASV_Paraphrased: take the ark of Jehovah, and lay it on the cart; and take the gold, which you will return him to the altar; and send him away, that he may be taken away.
BBE_Original: And put the ark of the Lord on the cart, and the gold images which you are sending as a sin-offering in a chest by its side; and send it away so that it may go.

ASV_Original: And see; if it goeth up by the way of its own border to Beth-shemesh, then he hath done us this great evil: but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that smote us; it was a chance that happened to us.
ASV_Paraphrased: if he goes to Beth-shemesh, then he's done us a great evil; but if not, then we'll know it's not his hand.
BBE_Original: If it goes by the land of Israel to Beth-shemesh, then this great evil is his work; but if not, then we may be certain that the evil was not his doing, but was the working of chance.

ASV_Original: And the men did so, and took two milch kine, and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home;
ASV_Paraphrased: they took two milch kine, tied to the cart, and shut up in the house;
BBE_Original: And the men did so; they took two cows, yoking them to the cart and shutting up their young ones in their living-place:

ASV_Original: and they put the ark of Jehovah upon the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their tumors.
ASV_Paraphrased: they put the cart on the cart, the cart with the gold and the gold-colored mice, the gold-colored mice, the gold-colored mice.
BBE_Original: And they put the ark of the Lord on the cart and the chest with the gold images.

ASV_Original: And the kine took the straight way by the way to Beth-shemesh; they went along the highway, lowing as they went, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them unto the border of Beth-shemesh.
ASV_Paraphrased: the kine turned to Beth-shemesh, and they rode down the road, and they turned to the left, not to the right.
BBE_Original: And the cows took the straight way, by the road to Beth-shemesh; they went by the highway, not turning to the right or to the left, and the sound of their voices was clear on the road; and the lords of the Philistines went after them as far as the edge of Beth-shemesh.

ASV_Original: And they of Beth-shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley; and they lifted up their eyes, and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.
ASV_Paraphrased: they saw the ark, and they were happy to see it, and they looked up, and they saw the ark, and they were happy to see it.
BBE_Original: And the people of Beth-shemesh were cutting their grain in the valley, and lifting up their eyes they saw the ark and were full of joy when they saw it.

ASV_Original: And the cart came into the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite, and stood there, where there was a great stone: and they clave the wood of the cart, and offered up the kine for a burnt-offering unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the cart was taken to Joshua's Beth-shemite, and stood in the field, where there was a great stone: and they took the cart to the fire.
BBE_Original: And the cart came into the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite, and came to a stop there by a great stone: and cutting up the wood of the cart they made a burned offering of the cows to the Lord.

ASV_Original: And the Levites took down the ark of Jehovah, and the coffer that was with it, wherein the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth-shemesh offered burnt-offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the men of Beth-shemesh, who were with the ark, took the gold and the gold coffer, and put them on the great stone.
BBE_Original: Then the Levites took down the ark of the Lord and the chest in which were the gold images, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth-shemesh made burned offerings and gave worship that day before the Lord.

ASV_Original: And when the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.
ASV_Paraphrased: the same day, the five rulers of the Philistians saw him.
BBE_Original: And the five lords of the Philistines, having seen it, went back to Ekron the same day.

ASV_Original: And these are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass-offering unto Jehovah: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;
ASV_Paraphrased: for Ashdod, for Gaza, for Ashkelon, for Gath, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Gath, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for Ekron, for
BBE_Original: Now these are the gold images which the Philistines sent as a sin-offering to the Lord; one for Ashdod, one for Gaza, one for Ashkelon, one for Gath, one for Ekron;

ASV_Original: and the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both of fortified cities and of country villages, even unto the great stone, whereon they set down the ark of Jehovah, which stone remaineth unto this day in the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite.
ASV_Paraphrased: according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines, both in fortified cities and in the countryside, even to the great stone, where they built the ark of God, the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines.
BBE_Original: And the gold mice, one for every town of the Philistines, the property of the five lords, walled towns as well as country places: and the great stone where they put the ark of the Lord is still in the field of Joshua the Beth-shemite to this day.

ASV_Original: And he smote of the men of Beth-shemesh, because they had looked into the ark of Jehovah, he smote of the people seventy men, and fifty thousand men; and the people mourned, because Jehovah had smitten the people with a great slaughter.
ASV_Paraphrased: he struck the men of Beth-shemesh, because they looked into the ark of Jehovah, and he struck seventy men and fifty thousand people.
BBE_Original: But the Lord sent destruction on seventy men of the people of Beth-shemesh for looking into the ark of the Lord; and great was the sorrow of the people for the destruction which the Lord had sent on them.

ASV_Original: And the men of Beth-shemesh said, Who is able to stand before Jehovah, this holy God? and to whom shall he go up from us?
ASV_Paraphrased: who can stand before God's holy God?
BBE_Original: And the men of Beth-shemesh said, Who is able to keep his place before the Lord, this holy God? and to whom may he go from us?

ASV_Original: And they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kiriath-jearim, saying, The Philistines have brought back the ark of Jehovah; come ye down, and fetch it up to you.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Philistians brought the ark of Jehovah to Kiriath-jearim, and they sent messengers to the inhabitants of the city.
BBE_Original: And they sent men to the people living in Kiriath-jearim, saying, The Philistines have sent back the ark of the Lord; come and take it up to your country.

ASV_Original: They that trust in Jehovah Are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: the ones who trust in God are like Mount Zion, which can't be moved, but will remain forever.
BBE_Original: <A Song of the going up.> Those whose hope is in the Lord are like the mountain of Zion, which may not be moved, but keeps its place for ever.

ASV_Original: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, So Jehovah is round about his people From this time forth and for evermore.
ASV_Paraphrased: from now on and forevermore, the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so that the people of God are round about them.
BBE_Original: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, so the Lord is round about his people, from this time and for ever.

ASV_Original: For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; That the righteous put not forth their hands unto iniquity.
ASV_Paraphrased: the righteous will not be able to rest on the lot of the righteous; that the righteous will not be able to offend.
BBE_Original: For the rod of sinners will not be resting on the heritage of the upright; so that the upright may not put out their hands to evil.

ASV_Original: Do good, O Jehovah, unto those that are good, And to them that are upright in their hearts.
ASV_Paraphrased: good, O Jehovah, to those who are good, and to those who are good.
BBE_Original: Do good, O Lord, to those who are good, and to those who are upright in heart.

ASV_Original: But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, Jehovah will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel.
ASV_Paraphrased: for such as turn to their crooked ways, God will lead them to the workers of sin.
BBE_Original: But as for such as are turned out of the straight way, the Lord will take them away with the workers of evil. Let peace be on Israel.

ASV_Original: And Agrippa said unto Paul, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth his hand, and made his defence:
ASV_Paraphrased: then Agrippa said, Thou can speak for yourself. Then Paul raised his hand and defended himself:
BBE_Original: And Agrippa said to Paul, You may put your cause before us. Then Paul, stretching out his hand, made his answer, saying:

ASV_Original: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, that I am to make my defence before thee this day touching all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews:
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm happy to defend myself, Agrippa, for the sake of the Jews, who accuse me of everything I'm accused of today:
BBE_Original: In my opinion I am happy, King Agrippa, to be able to give my answer before you today to all these things which the Jews say against me:

ASV_Original: especially because thou art expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
ASV_Paraphrased: because I beg you to listen to me patiently, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you know, you
BBE_Original: The more so, because you are expert in all questions to do with the Jews and their ways: so I make my request to you to give me a hearing to the end.

ASV_Original: My manner of life then from my youth up, which was from the beginning among mine own nation and at Jerusalem, know all the Jews;
ASV_Paraphrased: I know all Jews from my youth up to Jerusalem, and from the beginning of my nation.
BBE_Original: All the Jews have knowledge of my way of life from my early years, as it was from the start among my nation, and at Jerusalem;

ASV_Original: having knowledge of me from the first, if they be willing to testify, that after the straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
ASV_Paraphrased: if they want to testify, they will tell me the first thing they know about me, if they can.
BBE_Original: And they are able to say, if they would give witness, that I was living as a Pharisee, in that division of our religion which is most regular in the keeping of the law.

ASV_Original: And now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers;
ASV_Paraphrased: now I'm here to judge the promise of God's promise to our fathers.
BBE_Original: And now I am here to be judged because of the hope given by God's word to our fathers;

ASV_Original: unto which promise our twelve tribes, earnestly serving God night and day, hope to attain. And concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, O king!
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm accused of the Jews, king, of the promise of the twelve tribes.
BBE_Original: For the effecting of which our twelve tribes have been working and waiting night and day with all their hearts. And in connection with this hope I am attacked by the Jews, O king!

ASV_Original: Why is it judged incredible with you, if God doth raise the dead?
ASV_Paraphrased: if God's dead, is it amazing to you?
BBE_Original: Why, in your opinion, is it outside belief for God to make the dead come to life again?

ASV_Original: I verily thought with myself that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
ASV_Paraphrased: I thought of many things that were contrary to the name of Jesus Christ.
BBE_Original: For I, truly, was of the opinion that it was right for me to do a number of things against the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

ASV_Original: And this I also did in Jerusalem: and I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests, and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've done it in Jerusalem, and I've also taken many of the saints to prison, and when they were killed, I voted against them.
BBE_Original: And this I did in Jerusalem: and numbers of the saints I put in prison, having had authority given to me from the chief priests, and when they were put to death, I gave my decision against them.

ASV_Original: And punishing them oftentimes in all the synagogues, I strove to make them blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.
ASV_Paraphrased: I tried to punish them often in all the synagogues, and I was often angry with them, and I was often angry with them abroad.
BBE_Original: And I gave them punishment frequently, in all the Synagogues, forcing them to say things against God; and burning with passion against them, I went after them even into far-away towns.

ASV_Original: Whereupon as I journeyed to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests,
ASV_Paraphrased: as I'm going to Damascus with the authority and authority of the priests, I'm going to Damascus.
BBE_Original: Then, when I was journeying to Damascus with the authority and orders of the chief priests,

ASV_Original: at midday, O king, I saw on the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them that journeyed with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: as I walked, I saw a light from the sky, shining round about me and the others, and I was amazed by the light.
BBE_Original: In the middle of the day, on the road I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, shining round me and those who were journeying with me.

ASV_Original: And when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying unto me in the Hebrew language, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the goad.
ASV_Paraphrased: Saul, why persecut me? It's hard for you to kick me on the ground.
BBE_Original: And when we had all gone down on the earth, a voice came to me, saying in the Hebrew language, Saul, Saul, why are you attacking me so cruelly? It is hard for you to go against the impulse which is driving you.

ASV_Original: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Lord said, I'm Jesus, you're the one who's persecuting me.
BBE_Original: And I said, Who are you, Lord? And the Lord said, I am Jesus, whom you are attacking.

ASV_Original: But arise, and stand upon thy feet: for to this end have I appeared unto thee, to appoint thee a minister and a witness both of the things wherein thou hast seen me, and of the things wherein I will appear unto thee;
ASV_Paraphrased: I have appeared to you, and I have appointed you a minister and a witness to what you saw me and what I will show you.
BBE_Original: But get up on your feet: for I have come to you for this purpose, to make you a servant and a witness of the things in which you have seen me, and of those in which you will see me;

ASV_Original: delivering thee from the people, and from the Gentiles, unto whom I send thee,
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll give you to the people, and the Gentiles I'll send you.
BBE_Original: And I will keep you safe from the people, and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you,

ASV_Original: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among them that are sanctified by faith in me.
ASV_Paraphrased: to open their eyes, so that they may turn to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may be forgiven and blessed.
BBE_Original: To make their eyes open, turning them from the dark to the light, and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may have forgiveness of sins and a heritage among those who are made holy by faith in me.

ASV_Original: Wherefore, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:
ASV_Paraphrased: I did not disobey the heavenly vision, O Agrippa, I have not been disobedient to the heavenly vision.
BBE_Original: So, then, King Agrippa, I did not go against the vision from heaven;

ASV_Original: but declared both to them of Damascus first, and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judaea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were both declared by Damascus, and at Jerusalem, and throughout the country of Judaea, and also to the gentiles, to repent and turn to God, and they would be worthy of repentance.
BBE_Original: But I went about, first to those in Damascus and Jerusalem, and through all the country of Judaea, and then to the Gentiles, preaching a change of heart, so that they, being turned to God, might give, in their works, the fruits of a changed heart.

ASV_Original: For this cause the Jews seized me in the temple, and assayed to kill me.
ASV_Paraphrased: they took me to the temple, and they tried to kill me.
BBE_Original: For this reason, the Jews took me in the Temple, and made an attempt to put me to death.

ASV_Original: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand unto this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses did say should come;
ASV_Paraphrased: I have therefore testified to the small and great, saying nothing but what the prophet and the prophet had said should be;
BBE_Original: And so, by God's help, I am here today, witnessing to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would come about;

ASV_Original: how that the Christ must suffer, and how that he first by the resurrection of the dead should proclaim light both to the people and to the Gentiles.
ASV_Paraphrased: how the Lord must suffer, and how he will be proclaimed by the light of the dead to the people and the gentiles.
BBE_Original: That the Christ would go through pain, and being the first to come back from the dead, would give light to the people and to the Gentiles.

ASV_Original: And as he thus made his defence, Festus saith with a loud voice, Paul, thou art mad; thy much learning is turning thee mad.
ASV_Paraphrased: Paul, you're crazy, you've learned too much, you've learned too much.
BBE_Original: And when he made his answer in these words, Festus said in a loud voice, Paul, you are off your head; your great learning has made you unbalanced.

ASV_Original: But Paul saith, I am not mad, most excellent Festus; but speak forth words of truth and soberness.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not crazy, but I'm telling the truth and soberly.
BBE_Original: Then Paul said, I am not off my head, most noble Festus, but my words are true and wise.

ASV_Original: For the king knoweth of these things, unto whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him; for this hath not been done in a corner.
ASV_Paraphrased: for I am convinced that none of these things is hidden from him, for I have not done it in a corner.
BBE_Original: For the king has knowledge of these things, to whom I am talking freely; being certain that all this is common knowledge to him; for it has not been done in secret.

ASV_Original: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.
ASV_Paraphrased: Agrippa, do you believe the prophet?
BBE_Original: King Agrippa, have you faith in the prophets? I am certain that you have.

ASV_Original: And Agrippa said unto Paul, With but little persuasion thou wouldest fain make me a Christian.
ASV_Paraphrased: Agrippa said, with a little persuasion, you would be a Christian.
BBE_Original: And Agrippa said to Paul, A little more and you will be making me a Christian.

ASV_Original: And Paul said, I would to God, that whether with little or with much, not thou only, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except these bonds.
ASV_Paraphrased: except for those bonds, Paul said, I'd like to be like you, except for the bonds.
BBE_Original: And Paul said, It is my prayer to God that, in little or great measure, not only you, but all those hearing me today might be even as I am, but for these chains.

ASV_Original: And the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:
ASV_Paraphrased: the king rose, and the governor, and Bernice, and they sat down.
BBE_Original: And the king and the ruler and Bernice and those who were seated with them got up;

ASV_Original: and when they had withdrawn, they spake one to another, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.
ASV_Paraphrased: they spoke one to the other, and they said, This man's not worth dying or dying.
BBE_Original: And when they had gone away they said to one another, This man has done nothing which might give cause for death or prison.

ASV_Original: And Agrippa said unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Caesar.
ASV_Paraphrased: if he hadn't appealed to Caesar, he might have been released, Agrippa said.
BBE_Original: And Agrippa said to Festus, This man might have been made free, if he had not put his cause before Caesar.

ASV_Original: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Lord Jesus Christ, the Holy Spirit, and the brother of Timothy, the Lord's brother.
BBE_Original: Paul, an Apostle of Jesus Christ, by the purpose of God, and Timothy our brother,

ASV_Original: to the saints and faithful brethren in Christ that are at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.
ASV_Paraphrased: to the saints and faithful of the Colossians: Blessings to you and peace from God.
BBE_Original: To the saints and true brothers in Christ at Colossae: Grace to you and peace from God our Father.

ASV_Original: We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
ASV_Paraphrased: thank God for the Lord's father, who always prays for you,
BBE_Original: We give praise to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, making prayer for you at all times,

ASV_Original: having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which ye have toward all the saints,
ASV_Paraphrased: you have heard of the love you have for all saints, and the love you have for God.
BBE_Original: After hearing of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love which you have for all the saints,

ASV_Original: because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel,
ASV_Paraphrased: the hope that you have in heaven, where you heard the truth of the gospel,
BBE_Original: Through the hope which is in store for you in heaven; knowledge of which was given to you before in the true word of the good news,

ASV_Original: which is come unto you; even as it is also in all the world bearing fruit and increasing, as it doth in you also, since the day ye heard and knew the grace of God in truth;
ASV_Paraphrased: as it is in all the world, and as it is in you, as it is in the world, so it is in you, as it is in the world, and as it is in the world, so it is in you, as it is in the world, and as it is in the world, so it is in you, as it is in the world, and as it is in the world, so it is in the world, and as it is in the
BBE_Original: Which has come to you; and which in all the world is giving fruit and increase, as it has done in you from the day when it came to your ears and you had true knowledge of the grace of God;

ASV_Original: even as ye learned of Epaphras our beloved fellow-servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ on our behalf,
ASV_Paraphrased: as you know, Epaphras our beloved friend, who is a faithful minister of God, is a friend of yours.
BBE_Original: As it was given to you by Epaphras, our well-loved helper, who is a true servant of Christ for us,

ASV_Original: who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.
ASV_Paraphrased: in the spirit, he declared his love for us.
BBE_Original: And who, himself, made clear to us your love in the Spirit.

ASV_Original: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray and make request for you, that ye may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
ASV_Paraphrased: because we have not ceased to pray and ask you to be filled with knowledge of his will, we have not ceased to pray and ask you to understand him.
BBE_Original: For this reason, we, from the day when we had word of it, keep on in prayer for you, that you may be full of the knowledge of his purpose, with all wisdom and experience of the Spirit,

ASV_Original: to walk worthily of the Lord unto all pleasing, bearing fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
ASV_Paraphrased: to be worthy of the Lord's good, to be worthy of the Lord's good, to be worthy of the Lord's good;
BBE_Original: Living uprightly in the approval of the Lord, giving fruit in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;

ASV_Original: strengthened with all power, according to the might of his glory, unto all patience and longsuffering with joy;
ASV_Paraphrased: to all patience and longsuffering with joy, strengthened by all power, to all patience and longsuffering;
BBE_Original: Full of strength in the measure of the great power of his glory, so that you may undergo all troubles with joy;

ASV_Original: giving thanks unto the Father, who made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light;
ASV_Paraphrased: thanks to the Father, who gave us the opportunity to share the inheritance of the saints in light;
BBE_Original: Giving praise to the Father who has given us a part in the heritage of the saints in light;

ASV_Original: who delivered us out of the power of darkness, and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love;
ASV_Paraphrased: the power of darkness, and the power of love, gave us the power to be released from the darkness;
BBE_Original: Who has made us free from the power of evil and given us a place in the kingdom of the Son of his love;

ASV_Original: in whom we have our redemption, the forgiveness of our sins:
ASV_Paraphrased: the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins, the forgiveness of sins:
BBE_Original: In whom we have our salvation, the forgiveness of sins:

ASV_Original: who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation;
ASV_Paraphrased: the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation;
BBE_Original: Who is the image of the unseen God coming into existence before all living things;

ASV_Original: for in him were all things created, in the heavens and upon the earth, things visible and things invisible, whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers; all things have been created through him, and unto him;
ASV_Paraphrased: everything was created in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether on the throne or the ground, everything was created by him.
BBE_Original: For by him all things were made, in heaven and on earth, things seen and things unseen, authorities, lords, rulers, and powers; all things were made by him and for him;

ASV_Original: and he is before all things, and in him all things consist.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's all about everything, and everything is in him.
BBE_Original: He is before all things, and in him all things have being.

ASV_Original: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead; that in all things he might have the preeminence.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's the head of the body, the church: the firstborn of the dead.
BBE_Original: And he is the head of the body, the church: the starting point of all things, the first to come again from the dead; so that in all things he might have the chief place.

ASV_Original: For it was the good pleasure of the Father that in him should all the fulness dwell;
ASV_Paraphrased: the joy of the father was that he should be full of joy;
BBE_Original: For God in full measure was pleased to be in him;

ASV_Original: and through him to reconcile all things unto himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross; through him, I say, whether things upon the earth, or things in the heavens.
ASV_Paraphrased: I mean, if you're on the ground, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or in the sky, or
BBE_Original: Through him uniting all things with himself, having made peace through the blood of his cross; through him, I say, uniting all things which are on earth or in heaven.

ASV_Original: And you, being in time past alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil works,
ASV_Paraphrased: you, who have been in the past, enemies and enemies in your mind,
BBE_Original: And you, who in the past were cut off and at war with God in your minds through evil works, he has now made one

ASV_Original: yet now hath he reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without blemish and unreproveable before him:
ASV_Paraphrased: he has now taken his body to his death, and he has taken his soul to his soul, and he has not yet found a way to be holy and without blemish.
BBE_Original: In the body of his flesh through death, so that you might be holy and without sin and free from all evil before him:

ASV_Original: if so be that ye continue in the faith, grounded and stedfast, and not moved away from the hope of the gospel which ye heard, which was preached in all creation under heaven; whereof I Paul was made a minister.
ASV_Paraphrased: I Paul was a minister of the gospel, and I have been a minister of the gospel since the beginning of the world.
BBE_Original: If you keep yourselves safely based in the faith, not moved from the hope of the good news which came to you, and which was given to every living being under heaven; of which I, Paul, was made a servant.

ASV_Original: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake, which is the church;
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm glad to be able to suffer for your sake, and I'm filling up the things that are missing from the body of Christ for the sake of the church;
BBE_Original: Now I have joy in my pain because of you, and in my flesh I undergo whatever is still needed to make the sorrows of Christ complete, for the salvation of his body, the church;

ASV_Original: whereof I was made a minister, according to the dispensation of God which was given me to you-ward, to fulfil the word of God,
ASV_Paraphrased: I've been appointed a minister, according to God's word, to fulfill the word of God.
BBE_Original: Of which I became a servant by the purpose of God which was given to me for you, to give effect to the word of God,

ASV_Original: even the mystery which hath been hid for ages and generations: but now hath it been manifested to his saints,
ASV_Paraphrased: the mystery of the ages and generations of secrecy: but now he has revealed it to his saints.
BBE_Original: The secret which has been kept from all times and generations, but has now been made clear to his saints,

ASV_Original: to whom God was pleased to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:
ASV_Paraphrased: the glory of the glory of the mystery of the glory of the gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:
BBE_Original: To whom God was pleased to give knowledge of the wealth of the glory of this secret among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory:

ASV_Original: whom we proclaim, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ;
ASV_Paraphrased: we will teach every man and every man in all wisdom, so that we may be perfect in Christ;
BBE_Original: Whom we are preaching; guiding and teaching every man in all wisdom, so that every man may be complete in Christ;

ASV_Original: whereunto I labor also, striving according to his working, which worketh in me mightily.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm working hard, trying to do my job, which I'm very happy to do.
BBE_Original: And for this purpose I am working, using all my strength by the help of his power which is working in me strongly.

ASV_Original: Then Job answered and said,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I don't have any more." Said Job.
BBE_Original: And Job made answer and said,

ASV_Original: Oh that my vexation were but weighed, And all my calamity laid in the balances!
ASV_Paraphrased: I only weighed my troubles, and all my misfortune was balanced!
BBE_Original: If only my passion might be measured, and put into the scales against my trouble!

ASV_Original: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas: Therefore have my words been rash.
ASV_Paraphrased: I was rash in my words, therefore I was rash in my words.
BBE_Original: For then its weight would be more than the sand of the seas: because of this my words have been uncontrolled.

ASV_Original: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, The poison whereof my spirit drinketh up: The terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
ASV_Paraphrased: the arrows of the Almighty are in my soul, the poison that I drink: The horror of God is in my soul.
BBE_Original: For the arrows of the Ruler of all are present with me, and their poison goes deep into my spirit: his army of fears is put in order against me.

ASV_Original: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? Or loweth the ox over his fodder?
ASV_Paraphrased: when he's got grass, he's gonna scream, or he'll be low?
BBE_Original: Does the ass of the fields give out his voice when he has grass? or does the ox make sounds over his food?

ASV_Original: Can that which hath no savor be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
ASV_Paraphrased: is there any taste in the white of the egg?
BBE_Original: Will a man take food which has no taste without salt? or is there any taste in the soft substance of purslain?

ASV_Original: My soul refuseth to touch them; They are as loathsome food to me.
ASV_Paraphrased: they are loathsome to me as loathsome food.
BBE_Original: My soul has no desire for such things, they are as disease in my food.

ASV_Original: Oh that I might have my request; And that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
ASV_Paraphrased: I'd like to ask God for something I'd like to ask God for!
BBE_Original: If only I might have an answer to my prayer, and God would give me my desire!

ASV_Original: Even that it would please God to crush me; That he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
ASV_Paraphrased: that he would let me go, and he would cut me off!
BBE_Original: If only he would be pleased to put an end to me; and would let loose his hand, so that I might be cut off!

ASV_Original: And be it still my consolation, Yea, let me exult in pain that spareth not, That I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm glad I didn't deny the Holy One's words, that I didn't deny the Holy One's words.
BBE_Original: So I would still have comfort, and I would have joy in the pains of death, for I have not been false to the words of the Holy One.

ASV_Original: What is my strength, that I should wait? And what is mine end, that I should be patient?
ASV_Paraphrased: what strength do I have, and what strength do I have to wait?
BBE_Original: Have I strength to go on waiting, or have I any end to be looking forward to?

ASV_Original: Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of brass?
ASV_Paraphrased: is my strength the strength of the stone? Or the metal?
BBE_Original: Is my strength the strength of stones, or is my flesh brass?

ASV_Original: Is it not that I have no help in me, And that wisdom is driven quite from me?
ASV_Paraphrased: isn't it true that I'm not helping me, and that wisdom is driven by me?
BBE_Original: I have no help in myself, and wisdom is completely gone from me.

ASV_Original: To him that is ready to faint kindness should be showed from his friend; Even to him that forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
ASV_Paraphrased: he should show his friend kindness to him, even to him who would not be afraid of God.
BBE_Original: He whose heart is shut against his friend has given up the fear of the Ruler of all.

ASV_Original: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, As the channel of brooks that pass away;
ASV_Paraphrased: brothers have cheated as a brook, as the channel of brooks that are dying;
BBE_Original: My friends have been false like a stream, like streams in the valleys which come to an end:

ASV_Original: Which are black by reason of the ice, And wherein the snow hideth itself:
ASV_Paraphrased: because the ice is black, and the snow is black, and the snow is black.
BBE_Original: Which are dark because of the ice, and the snow falling into them;

ASV_Original: What time they wax warm, they vanish; When it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
ASV_Paraphrased: when it's hot, they melt, and when it's hot, they melt.
BBE_Original: Under the burning sun they are cut off, and come to nothing because of the heat.

ASV_Original: The caravans that travel by the way of them turn aside; They go up into the waste, and perish.
ASV_Paraphrased: the caravans that travel by the way of them are turning away; they go to the waste.
BBE_Original: The camel-trains go out of their way; they go up into the waste and come to destruction.

ASV_Original: The caravans of Tema looked, The companies of Sheba waited for them.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Tema caravan was waiting for them, the Sheba's company waiting.
BBE_Original: The camel-trains of Tema were searching with care, the bands of Sheba were waiting for them:

ASV_Original: They were put to shame because they had hoped; They came thither, and were confounded.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were ashamed of themselves, because they hoped; they came, and they were confused.
BBE_Original: They were put to shame because of their hope; they came and their hope was gone.

ASV_Original: For now ye are nothing; Ye see a terror, and are afraid.
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't see anything, but fear, and you're afraid.
BBE_Original: So have you now become to me; you see my sad condition and are in fear.

ASV_Original: Did I say, Give unto me? Or, Offer a present for me of your substance?
ASV_Paraphrased: or, give me your substance?
BBE_Original: Did I say, Give me something? or, Make a payment for me out of your wealth?

ASV_Original: Or, Deliver me from the adversary's hand? Or, Redeem me from the hand of the oppressors?
ASV_Paraphrased: or, Redeem me from the hands of the oppressors?
BBE_Original: Or, Get me out of the power of my hater? or, Give money so that I may be free from the power of the cruel ones?

ASV_Original: Teach me, and I will hold my peace; And cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll teach you, and I'll be quiet, and I'll understand what I've done wrong.
BBE_Original: Give me teaching and I will be quiet; and make me see my error.

ASV_Original: How forcible are words of uprightness! But your reproof, what doth it reprove?
ASV_Paraphrased: what is your reproof, what is it to be reproved?
BBE_Original: How pleasing are upright words! but what force is there in your arguments?

ASV_Original: Do ye think to reprove words, Seeing that the speeches of one that is desperate are as wind?
ASV_Paraphrased: do you think you're gonna apologize for the words, seeing that the speech of a desperate man is as wind?
BBE_Original: My words may seem wrong to you, but the words of him who has no hope are for the wind.

ASV_Original: Yea, ye would cast lots upon the fatherless, And make merchandise of your friend.
ASV_Paraphrased: you'd be a lot of money for your fatherless, and you'd make your friend's goods.
BBE_Original: Truly, you are such as would give up the child of a dead man to his creditors, and would make a profit out of your friend.

ASV_Original: Now therefore be pleased to look upon me; For surely I shall not lie to your face.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm sure you'll be happy to look at me, for I'm not lying to you.
BBE_Original: Now then, let your eyes be turned to me, for truly I will not say what is false to your face.

ASV_Original: Return, I pray you, let there be no injustice; Yea, return again, my cause is righteous.
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you, please don't make any mistakes, my cause is good.
BBE_Original: Let your minds be changed, and do not have an evil opinion of me; yes, be changed, for my righteousness is still in me.

ASV_Original: Is there injustice on my tongue? Cannot my taste discern mischievous things?
ASV_Paraphrased: I don't know if I can detect any bad taste in my tongue?
BBE_Original: Is there evil in my tongue? is not the cause of my trouble clear to me?

ASV_Original: And I said, Hear, I pray you, ye heads of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel: is it not for you to know justice?
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm asking you, Jacob, and the rulers of the house of Israel, is it not for you to know justice?
BBE_Original: And I said, Give ear, now, you heads of Jacob and rulers of the people of Israel: is it not for you to have knowledge of what is right?

ASV_Original: ye who hate the good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones;
ASV_Paraphrased: they hate the good, love the bad; they're plucking their skin off them, and their bones from their bones.
BBE_Original: You who are haters of good and lovers of evil, pulling off their skin from them and their flesh from their bones;

ASV_Original: who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them, and break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.
ASV_Paraphrased: and as meat in the caldron, and as meat in the caldron, and as meat in the caldron, and as meat in the caldron.
BBE_Original: Like meat they take the flesh of my people for their food, skinning them and crushing their bones, yes, cutting them up as if for the pot, like flesh inside the cooking-pot.

ASV_Original: Then shall they cry unto Jehovah, but he will not answer them; yea, he will hide his face from them at that time, according as they have wrought evil in their doings.
ASV_Paraphrased: they will cry to God, but he will not answer them, and he will hide his face from them.
BBE_Original: Then they will be crying to the Lord for help, but he will not give them an answer: yes, he will keep his face veiled from them at that time, because their acts have been evil.

ASV_Original: Thus saith Jehovah concerning the prophets that make my people to err; that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and whoso putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him:
ASV_Paraphrased: "he says, 'Peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace, peace
BBE_Original: This is what the Lord has said about the prophets by whom my people have been turned from the right way; who, biting with their teeth, say, Peace; and if anyone puts nothing in their mouths they make ready for war against him.

ASV_Original: Therefore it shall be night unto you, that ye shall have no vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down upon the prophets, and the day shall be black over them.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will be dark, and the sun will fall, and the prophet will be dark, and the day will be dark.
BBE_Original: For this cause it will be night for you, without a vision; and it will be dark for you, without knowledge of the future; the sun will go down over the prophets, and the day will be black over them.

ASV_Original: And the seers shall be put to shame, and the diviners confounded; yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.
ASV_Paraphrased: the seers will be ashamed, the diviners will be confused, and the whole world will be silent.
BBE_Original: And the seers will be shamed, and the readers of the future will be at a loss, all of them covering their lips; for there is no answer from God.

ASV_Original: But as for me, I am full of power by the Spirit of Jehovah, and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.
ASV_Paraphrased: by the Spirit of God, I'm full of power, and I'm ready to tell Jacob, and Israel, and God, what I've done.
BBE_Original: But I truly am full of the spirit of the Lord, with power of judging and with strength to make clear to Jacob his wrongdoing and to Israel his sin.

ASV_Original: Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel, that abhor justice, and pervert all equity.
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you, Jacob's head, and the head of the House of Israel, that you will not judge, and you will not be fair.
BBE_Original: Then give ear to this, you heads of the children of Jacob, you rulers of the children of Israel, hating what is right, twisting what is straight.

ASV_Original: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.
ASV_Paraphrased: the blood of Zion and Jerusalem will be poured out, and the city will be full of sin.
BBE_Original: They are building up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with evil-doing.

ASV_Original: The heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet they lean upon Jehovah, and say, Is not Jehovah in the midst of us? no evil shall come upon us.
ASV_Paraphrased: but they judge, and the priests, and the prophets, and the ones who pay them, they lean on God, and they say, Is not God in the middle of us?
BBE_Original: Its heads take rewards for judging, and the priests take payment for teaching, and the prophets get silver for reading the future: but still, supporting themselves on the Lord, they say, Is not the Lord among us? no evil will overtake us.

ASV_Original: Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Zion will be plowed, and Jerusalem will be a heap of rubble, and the mountain will be a mountain.
BBE_Original: For this reason, Zion will be ploughed like a field because of you, and Jerusalem will become a mass of broken walls, and the mountain of the house like a high place in the woods.

ASV_Original: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Az
BBE_Original: Now after these things, when Artaxerxes was king of Persia, Ezra, the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,

ASV_Original: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub.
BBE_Original: The son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,

ASV_Original: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth.
BBE_Original: The son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,

ASV_Original: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki.
BBE_Original: The son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,

ASV_Original: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priestâ€”
ASV_Paraphrased: Abishua, Phinehas, Eleazar, Aaron, the chief priest of the people.
BBE_Original: The son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:

ASV_Original: this Ezra went up from Babylon. And he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which Jehovah, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of Jehovah his God upon him.
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezra was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which God, the God of Israel, gave him; and the king granted him all his requests.
BBE_Original: This Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a scribe, expert in the law of Moses which the Lord, the God of Israel, had given: and the king, moved by the Lord his God, gave him whatever he made request for.

ASV_Original: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
ASV_Paraphrased: in the seventh year of Artaxerxes, the seventh year of the reign of the king of Israel, the king of Israel, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews, the king of the Jews
BBE_Original: And some of the children of Israel went up, with some of the priests and the Levites and the music-makers and the door-keepers and the Nethinim, to Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

ASV_Original: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
ASV_Paraphrased: he came to Jerusalem in the seventh month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
BBE_Original: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, in the seventh year of the king's rule.

ASV_Original: For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon; and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he began to go to Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month he was in Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: For, starting his journey from Babylon on the first day of the first month, he came to Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, by the good help of his God.

ASV_Original: For Ezra had set his heart to seek the law of Jehovah, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and ordinances.
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezra was looking for the law of Jehovah, and he wanted to teach in Israel's laws and ordinances.
BBE_Original: For Ezra had given his mind to learning the law of the Lord and doing it, and to teaching his rules and decisions in Israel.

ASV_Original: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of Jehovah, and of his statutes to Israel:
ASV_Paraphrased: this is the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of the commandments of God, and of the laws of the Lord's law.
BBE_Original: Now this is a copy of the letter which King Artaxerxes gave to Ezra, the priest and the scribe, who put into writing the words of the orders of the Lord, and of his rules for Israel:

ASV_Original: Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect and so forth.
ASV_Paraphrased: the king of kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of the kings, the king of
BBE_Original: Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, scribe of the law of the God of heaven, all peace;

ASV_Original: I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and their priests and the Levites, in my realm, that are minded of their own free will to go to Jerusalem, go with thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: I decree that all the people of Israel, and their priests and the Levites, who are interested in Jerusalem, will go with you.
BBE_Original: And now it is my order that all those of the people of Israel, and their priests and Levites in my kingdom, who are ready and have a desire to go to Jerusalem, are to go with you.

ASV_Original: Forasmuch as thou art sent of the king and his seven counsellors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thy hand,
ASV_Paraphrased: as you have been sent by the king and his seven counselors to Jerusalem and Judah, according to the law of God, so you have been sent.
BBE_Original: Because you are sent by the king and his seven wise men, to get knowledge about Judah and Jerusalem, as you are ordered by the law of your God which is in your hand;

ASV_Original: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
ASV_Paraphrased: to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered to God in Jerusalem, the king's house.
BBE_Original: And to take with you the silver and gold freely offered by the king and his wise men to the God of Israel, whose Temple is in Jerusalem,

ASV_Original: and all the silver and gold that thou shalt find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill-offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem;
ASV_Paraphrased: all the silver and gold that you find in the entire province of Babylon, with the willing offering of the people, and the priests, offering to God's house in Jerusalem;
BBE_Original: As well as all the silver and gold which you get from the land of Babylon, together with the offering of the people and of the priests, freely given for the house of their God, which is in Jerusalem:

ASV_Original: therefore thou shalt with all diligence buy with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meal-offerings and their drink-offerings, and shalt offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
ASV_Paraphrased: so you buy the money bullocks, rams, lambs, and their food and drink, and you offer them to the altar of the house of God in Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: So with this money get with care oxen, sheep, and lambs, with their meal offerings and their drink offerings, to be offered on the altar of the house of your God, which is in Jerusalem.

ASV_Original: And whatsoever shall seem good to thee and to thy brethren to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do ye after the will of your God.
ASV_Paraphrased: do what your God will be pleased with, and everything else will be good for you and your brothers.
BBE_Original: And whatever seems right to you and to your brothers to do with the rest of the silver and gold, that do, as may be pleasing to your God.

ASV_Original: And the vessels that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
ASV_Paraphrased: the vessels you give to the house of God, the Lord will take them to Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: And the vessels which have been given to you for the uses of the house of your God, you are to give to the God of Jerusalem.

ASV_Original: And whatsoever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king's treasure-house.
ASV_Paraphrased: all the things you need to give your God, which you will be able to bestow, give them to the king's house.
BBE_Original: And whatever more is needed for the house of your God, and which you may have to give, take it from the king's store-house.

ASV_Original: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers that are beyond the River, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done with all diligence,
ASV_Paraphrased: I, even I, the king of Artaxerxes, the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the
BBE_Original: And I, even I, Artaxerxes the king, now give orders to all keepers of the king's money across the river, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, may have need of from you, is to be done with all care,

ASV_Original: unto a hundred talents of silver, and to a hundred measures of wheat, and to a hundred baths of wine, and to a hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
ASV_Paraphrased: a hundred talents of silver, a hundred measures of wheat, a hundred baths of wine, a hundred baths of oil, and a hundred baths of oil, and no prescription.
BBE_Original: Up to a hundred talents of silver, a hundred measures of grain, a hundred measures of wine, and a hundred measures of oil, and salt without measure.

ASV_Original: Whatsoever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
ASV_Paraphrased: the kingdom of heaven is God's kingdom, and the kingdom of heaven is God's kingdom.
BBE_Original: Whatever is ordered by the God of heaven, let it be done completely for the house of the God of heaven; so that there may not be wrath against the kingdom of the king and his sons.

ASV_Original: Also we certify you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, the singers, porters, Nethinim, or servants of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose tribute, custom, or toll, upon them.
ASV_Paraphrased: we certify that no priest or Levite, no porter, Nethinim, or servant of God shall be subject to the tribute, custom, or toll, of any of them.
BBE_Original: In addition, we make it clear to you, that it will be against the law to put any tax or payment in goods or forced payment on any of the priests or Levites, the music-makers, door-keepers, Nethinim, or any servants of this house of God.

ASV_Original: And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God that is in thy hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people that are beyond the River, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye him that knoweth them not.
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezra, after the wisdom of your God, you appoint magistrates and judges who can judge all the people who know the law of your God.
BBE_Original: And you, Ezra, by the wisdom of your God which is in you, are to put rulers and judges to have authority over all the people across the river who have knowledge of the laws of your God; and you are to give teaching to him who has no knowledge of them.

ASV_Original: And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed upon him with all diligence, whether it be unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
ASV_Paraphrased: if he does not obey the king's law, the king's law, or the king's law, he shall be punished with all diligence, whether he be killed, or imprisoned, or to confiscate the goods, or to banish them.
BBE_Original: And if anyone does not keep the law of your God and the law of the king, take care that punishment is given to him, by death or by driving him from his country or by taking away his goods or by putting him in prison.

ASV_Original: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of our fathers, who hath put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of Jehovah which is in Jerusalem;
ASV_Paraphrased: for the king's heart is full of this, the heart of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the
BBE_Original: Praise be to the Lord, the God of our fathers, who has put such a thing into the heart of the king, to make fair the house of the Lord which is in Jerusalem;

ASV_Original: and hath extended lovingkindness unto me before the king, and his counsellors, and before all the king's mighty princes. And I was strengthened according to the hand of Jehovah my God upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have been strengthened by God's hand, and I have gathered all the king's mighty princes before the king.
BBE_Original: And has given mercy to me before the king and his government and before all the king's great captains. And I was made strong by the hand of the Lord my God which was on me, and I got together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.

ASV_Original: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm a real vine, my father's a husband.
BBE_Original: I am the true vine and my Father is the gardener.

ASV_Original: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit, he taketh it away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he cleanseth it, that it may bear more fruit.
ASV_Paraphrased: he takes the fruit of the fruit, and cleans it, so that it may bear more fruit.
BBE_Original: He takes away every branch in me which has no fruit, and every branch which has fruit he makes clean, so that it may have more fruit.

ASV_Original: Already ye are clean because of the word which I have spoken unto you.
ASV_Paraphrased: you're clean because I told you what I said.
BBE_Original: You are clean, even now, through the teaching which I have given you.

ASV_Original: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; so neither can ye, except ye abide in me.
ASV_Paraphrased: as the branch cannot bear fruit, except it abide in the vine; so neither can you, except you're in me.
BBE_Original: Be in me at all times as I am in you. As the branch is not able to give fruit of itself, if it is not still on the vine, so you are not able to do so if you are not in me.

ASV_Original: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same beareth much fruit: for apart from me ye can do nothing.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm the vine, you're the branches: He who abides in me, I'm the same fruit.
BBE_Original: I am the vine, you are the branches: he who is in me at all times as I am in him, gives much fruit, because without me you are able to do nothing.

ASV_Original: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will be a branch, and he will be burned, and they will burn him, and they will burn him.
BBE_Original: If a man does not keep himself in me, he becomes dead and is cut off like a dry branch; such branches are taken up and put in the fire and burned.

ASV_Original: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask whatsoever ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
ASV_Paraphrased: behold, I will give you what you ask, and you will do what you want.
BBE_Original: If you are in me at all times, and my words are in you, then anything for which you make a request will be done for you.

ASV_Original: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; and so shall ye be my disciples.
ASV_Paraphrased: so you're my father, and I'm your father, and you're my father.
BBE_Original: Here is my Father's glory, in that you give much fruit and so are my true disciples.

ASV_Original: Even as the Father hath loved me, I also have loved you: abide ye in my love.
ASV_Paraphrased: I loved you as a father loved me.
BBE_Original: Even as the Father has given me his love, so I have given my love to you: be ever in my love.

ASV_Original: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will abide by my commandments, and you will love me as I love you.
BBE_Original: If you keep my laws, you will be ever in my love, even as I have kept my Father's laws, and am ever in his love.

ASV_Original: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be made full.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have spoken to you, that you may be happy with me, and that you may be happy with me.
BBE_Original: I have said these things to you so that I may have joy in you and so that your joy may be complete.

ASV_Original: This is my commandment, that ye love one another, even as I have loved you.
ASV_Paraphrased: I command you to love each other as I loved you.
BBE_Original: This is the law I give you: Have love one for another, even as I have love for you.

ASV_Original: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
ASV_Paraphrased: a man who would have given his life for his friends, he doesn't have any more love.
BBE_Original: Greater love has no man than this, that a man gives up his life for his friends.

ASV_Original: Ye are my friends, if ye do the things which I command you.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you do what I'm telling you, my friends, I'll be happy.
BBE_Original: You are my friends, if you do what I give you orders to do.

ASV_Original: No longer do I call you servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I heard from my Father I have made known unto you.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not calling you servants anymore, for the servant doesn't know what his master's doing.
BBE_Original: No longer do I give you the name of servants; because a servant is without knowledge of what his master is doing: I give you the name of friends, because I have given you knowledge of all the things which my Father has said to me.

ASV_Original: Ye did not choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that ye should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should abide: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.
ASV_Paraphrased: I chose you, and I appointed you, so that you might be able to bear fruit, and that your fruit should be yours.
BBE_Original: You did not take me for yourselves, but I took you for myself; and I gave you the work of going about and producing fruit which will be for ever; so that whatever request you make to the Father in my name he may give it to you.

ASV_Original: These things I command you, that ye may love one another.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, you can love each other.
BBE_Original: So this is my law for you: Have love one for another.

ASV_Original: If the world hateth you, ye know that it hath hated me before it hated you.
ASV_Paraphrased: you know, the world hates me, and I hate you.
BBE_Original: If you are hated by the world, keep in mind that I was hated by the world before you.

ASV_Original: If ye were of the world, the world would love its own: but because ye are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
ASV_Paraphrased: the world hates you because you're not from the world, but I chose you out of the world.
BBE_Original: If you were of the world, you would be loved by the world: but because you are not of the world, but I have taken you out of the world, you are hated by the world.

ASV_Original: Remember the word that I said unto you, A servant is not greater than his lord. If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.
ASV_Paraphrased: if they attack me, they will attack me, too, if they have my word.
BBE_Original: Keep in mind the words I said to you, A servant is not greater than his lord. If they were cruel to me, they will be cruel to you; if they kept my words, they will keep yours.

ASV_Original: But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, because they know not him that sent me.
ASV_Paraphrased: for my name's sake, they will do everything for my name.
BBE_Original: They will do all this to you because of my name--because they have no knowledge of him who sent me.

ASV_Original: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no excuse for their sin.
ASV_Paraphrased: they don't have to apologize for their sin, but they don't have to apologize for their sin.
BBE_Original: If I had not come and been their teacher they would have had no sin: but now they have no reason to give for their sin.

ASV_Original: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not gonna be able to do it, my father.
BBE_Original: He who has hate for me has hate for my Father.

ASV_Original: If I had not done among them the works which none other did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.
ASV_Paraphrased: they saw me and my father, and they hated me and my father.
BBE_Original: If I had not done among them the works which no other man ever did, they would have had no sin: but now they have seen, and they have had hate in their hearts for me and my Father.

ASV_Original: But this cometh to pass, that the word may be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.
ASV_Paraphrased: it's going to be, that the word of the law is fulfilled, that they hate me for no reason.
BBE_Original: This comes about so that the writing in their law may be made true, Their hate for me was without cause.

ASV_Original: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall bear witness of me:
ASV_Paraphrased: when the Comforter comes, who will come from the Father, the Spirit of truth, which is from the Father, I will testify to him:
BBE_Original: When the Helper comes, whom I will send to you from the Father even the Spirit of true knowledge who comes from the Father--he will give witness about me;

ASV_Original: and ye also bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
ASV_Paraphrased: you're also testifying, because you've been with me from the beginning.
BBE_Original: And you, in addition, will give witness because you have been with me from the first.

ASV_Original: And after five days the high priest Ananias came down with certain elders, and with an orator, one Tertullus; and they informed the governor against Paul.
ASV_Paraphrased: the High Priest Ananias, with a certain elder, and with a speech, one Tertullus, informed the governor of Paul.
BBE_Original: And after five days, the high priest, Ananias, came with certain of the rulers, and an expert talker, one Tertullus; and they made a statement to Felix against Paul.

ASV_Original: And when he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy much peace, and that by thy providence evils are corrected for this nation,
ASV_Paraphrased: when he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, We're enjoying a lot of peace, and that you're correcting the bad things that happen to us.
BBE_Original: And when he had been sent for, Tertullus, starting his statement, said, Because by you we are living in peace, and through your wisdom wrongs are put right for this nation,

ASV_Original: we accept it in all ways and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thankfulness.
ASV_Paraphrased: Felix, with all thanks, accepts all of them and all places, with all thanks.
BBE_Original: In all things and in all places we are conscious of our great debt to you, most noble Felix.

ASV_Original: But, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I entreat thee to hear us of thy clemency a few words.
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you to tell us a few words of your clemency.
BBE_Original: But, so that I may not make you tired, I make a request to you of your mercy, to give hearing to a short statement.

ASV_Original: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes:
ASV_Paraphrased: we've found a pestilent fellow, a mover of all the Jews in the world, a leader of the Nazarenes:
BBE_Original: For this man, in our opinion, is a cause of trouble, a maker of attacks on the government among Jews through all the empire, and a chief mover in the society of the Nazarenes:

ASV_Original: who moreover assayed to profane the temple: on whom also we laid hold:
ASV_Paraphrased:
in addition, we took hold of the temple: 
in addition, we have taken the temple:
BBE_Original: Who, in addition, was attempting to make the Temple unclean: whom we took,

ASV_Original: from whom thou wilt be able, by examining him thyself, to take knowledge of all these things whereof we accuse him.
ASV_Paraphrased: by examining him yourself, you will be able to find out everything we accuse him of.
BBE_Original: And from whom you will be able, by questioning him yourself, to get knowledge of all the things which we say against him.

ASV_Original: And the Jews also joined in the charge, affirming that these things were so.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Jews also joined the charge, and they said it was true.
BBE_Original: And the Jews were in agreement with his statement, saying that these things were so.

ASV_Original: And when the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, Paul answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I cheerfully make my defence:
ASV_Paraphrased: when the governor asked him to speak, Paul answered, Forasmuch as I know you've been a judge for a long time, I'm glad I'm here to defend you:
BBE_Original: Then when the ruler had given him a sign to make his answer, Paul said, Because I have knowledge that you have been a judge over this nation for a number of years, I am glad to make my answer:

ASV_Original: seeing that thou canst take knowledge that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem:
ASV_Paraphrased: I went to Jerusalem for 12 days, and I didn't know it was more than 12 days since I've been to Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: Seeing that you are able to make certain of the fact that it is not more than twelve days from the time when I came up to Jerusalem for worship;

ASV_Original: and neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man or stirring up a crowd, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city.
