ASV_Paraphrased: they didn't find me in the temple, in the synagogue, or in the city.
BBE_Original: And they have not seen me in argument with any man in the Temple, or working up the feelings of the people, in the Synagogues or in the town:

ASV_Original: Neither can they prove to thee the things whereof they now accuse me.
ASV_Paraphrased: they can't prove anything to you, where they're accusing me of.
BBE_Original: And they are not able to give facts in support of the things which they say against me now.

ASV_Original: But this I confess unto thee, that after the Way which they call a sect, so serve I the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets;
ASV_Paraphrased: I confess to you, after the way they call a sect, I believe everything that is written in the Bible and the Prophets, and everything that is written in the Bible.
BBE_Original: But this I will say openly to you, that I do give worship to the God of our fathers after that Way, which to them is not the true religion: but I have belief in all the things which are in the law and in the books of the prophets:

ASV_Original: having hope toward God, which these also themselves look for, that there shall be a resurrection both of the just and unjust.
ASV_Paraphrased: they hope that God will be pleased with them, and they look for the resurrection of the just and unjust.
BBE_Original: Hoping in God for that which they themselves are looking for, that there will be a coming back from the dead for upright men and wrongdoers.

ASV_Original: Herein I also exercise myself to have a conscience void of offence toward God and men always.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm also exercising my conscience to be free of any offense to God and man.
BBE_Original: And in this, I do my best at all times to have no reason for shame before God or men.

ASV_Original: Now after some years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings:
ASV_Paraphrased: I've been a nation's benefactor for a long time, and I've offered my nation's gifts:
BBE_Original: Now after a number of years I came to give help and offerings to my nation:

ASV_Original: amidst which they found me purified in the temple, with no crowd, nor yet with tumult: but there were certain Jews from Asiaâ€”
ASV_Paraphrased: but there were certain Jews from Asia -
BBE_Original: And having been made clean, I was in the Temple, but not with a great number of people, and not with noise: but there were certain Jews from Asia,

ASV_Original: who ought to have been here before thee, and to make accusation, if they had aught against me.
ASV_Paraphrased: if they have anything against me, they should have accused me before you.
BBE_Original: And it would have been better if they had come here to make a statement, if they have anything against me.

ASV_Original: Or else let these men themselves say what wrong-doing they found when I stood before the council,
ASV_Paraphrased: if they want to tell me what they found, they can tell me what they found.
BBE_Original: Or let these men here present say what wrongdoing was seen in me when I was before the Sanhedrin,

ASV_Original: except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question before you this day.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm being questioned this day by the one who calls me before you, Touching the resurrection of the dead.
BBE_Original: But only this one thing which I said among them in a loud voice, I am this day being judged on the question of the coming back from the dead.

ASV_Original: But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will determine your matter.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Lysias the chief captain arrives, I'll decide what you want, Felix.
BBE_Original: But Felix, who had a more detailed knowledge of the Way, put them off, saying, When Lysias, the chief captain, comes down, I will give attention to your business.

ASV_Original: And he gave order to the centurion that he should be kept in charge, and should have indulgence; and not to forbid any of his friends to minister unto him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he ordered the centurion to be taken care of himself, and he should not be allowed to be served by any of his friends.
BBE_Original: And he gave orders to the captain to keep Paul under his control, and to let him have everything he had need of; and not to keep his friends from coming to see him.

ASV_Original: But after certain days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess, and sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus.
ASV_Paraphrased: Felix and Drusilla came to Paul, and he heard the faith of Jesus Christ for the first time.
BBE_Original: But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla his wife, who was of the Jews by birth, and sent for Paul, and gave hearing to him about faith in Christ Jesus.

ASV_Original: And as he reasoned of righteousness, and self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, Go thy way for this time; and when I have a convenient season, I will call thee unto me.
ASV_Paraphrased: when he thought of righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go
BBE_Original: And while he was talking about righteousness and self-control and the judging which was to come, Felix had great fear and said, Go away for the present, and when the right time comes I will send for you.

ASV_Original: He hoped withal that money would be given him of Paul: wherefore also he sent for him the oftener, and communed with him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he hoped Paul would give him money, and he would also communicate with him.
BBE_Original: For he was hoping that Paul would give him money: so he sent for him more frequently and had talk with him.

ASV_Original: But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus; and desiring to gain favor with the Jews, Felix left Paul in bonds.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Felix was released from Paul's bonds, he sought to gain favor with the Jews, and Felix left Paul in bonds.
BBE_Original: But after two years Porcius Festus took the place of Felix, who, desiring to have the approval of the Jews, kept Paul in chains.

ASV_Original: Then Job answered and said,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I don't have any more." Said Job.
BBE_Original: Then Job made answer and said,

ASV_Original: How hast thou helped him that is without power! How hast thou saved the arm that hath no strength!
ASV_Paraphrased: how did you save his arm that he doesn't have any strength?
BBE_Original: How have you given help to him who has no power! how have you been the salvation of the arm which has no strength!

ASV_Original: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom, And plentifully declared sound knowledge!
ASV_Paraphrased: you advised him to be quiet, and he said he had no wisdom, and he was very clear about it!
BBE_Original: How have you given teaching to him who has no wisdom, and fully made clear true knowledge!

ASV_Original: To whom hast thou uttered words? And whose spirit came forth from thee?
ASV_Paraphrased: who spoke to you? And who's the spirit of yours?
BBE_Original: To whom have your words been said? and whose spirit came out from you?

ASV_Original: They that are deceased tremble Beneath the waters and the inhabitants thereof.
ASV_Paraphrased: the inhabitants of the water tremble beneath the water and the inhabitants of the land.
BBE_Original: The shades in the underworld are shaking; the waters and those living in them.

ASV_Original: Sheol is naked before God, And Abaddon hath no covering.
ASV_Paraphrased: Abaddon is naked before God, and Abaddon's not covered.
BBE_Original: The underworld is uncovered before him, and Destruction has no veil.

ASV_Original: He stretcheth out the north over empty space, And hangeth the earth upon nothing.
ASV_Paraphrased: he pulls the north over the empty space, and he hangs the earth on nothing.
BBE_Original: By his hand the north is stretched out in space, and the earth is hanging on nothing.

ASV_Original: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; And the cloud is not rent under them.
ASV_Paraphrased: the clouds are thick, and the clouds are not broken by them.
BBE_Original: By him the waters are shut up in his thick clouds, and the cloud does not give way under them.

ASV_Original: He incloseth the face of his throne, And spreadeth his cloud upon it.
ASV_Paraphrased: he spread his throne, and the cloud was spread over him.
BBE_Original: By him the face of his high seat is veiled, and his cloud stretched out over it.

ASV_Original: He hath described a boundary upon the face of the waters, Unto the confines of light and darkness.
ASV_Paraphrased: he described the boundary between the light and the darkness, Unto the limits of light and darkness.
BBE_Original: By him a circle is marked out on the face of the waters, to the limits of the light and the dark.

ASV_Original: The pillars of heaven tremble And are astonished at his rebuke.
ASV_Paraphrased: the heavens tremble and tremble with astonishment at his rebuke.
BBE_Original: The pillars of heaven are shaking, and are overcome by his sharp words.

ASV_Original: He stirreth up the sea with his power, And by his understanding he smiteth through Rahab.
ASV_Paraphrased: he stirs the sea with his power, and Rahab is smitten.
BBE_Original: By his power the sea was made quiet; and by his wisdom Rahab was wounded.

ASV_Original: By his Spirit the heavens are garnished; His hand hath pierced the swift serpent.
ASV_Paraphrased: the sky is full of the sky, the sky is full of the sky, the sky is full of the sky.
BBE_Original: By his wind the heavens become bright: by his hand the quickly moving snake was cut through.

ASV_Original: Lo, these are but the outskirts of his ways: And how small a whisper do we hear of him! But the thunder of his power who can understand?
ASV_Paraphrased: but how small a whisper can we hear of him?
BBE_Original: See, these are only the outskirts of his ways; and how small is that which comes to our ears about him! But the thunder of his acts of power is outside all knowledge.

ASV_Original: He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must not enter the assembly of Jehovah, or he will cut his privy member.
BBE_Original: No man whose private parts have been wounded or cut off may come into the meeting of the Lord's people.

ASV_Original: A bastard shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even to the tenth generation shall none of his enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: son of a bitch, no one enters the assembly of Jehovah's tenth generation.
BBE_Original: One whose father and mother are not married may not come into the meeting of the Lord's people, or any of his family to the tenth generation.

ASV_Original: An Ammonite or a Moabite shall not enter into the assembly of Jehovah; even to the tenth generation shall none belonging to them enter into the assembly of Jehovah for ever:
ASV_Paraphrased: no one shall enter the assembly of Jehovah for ever, even to the tenth generation, no one will ever be able to enter the assembly of Jehovah:
BBE_Original: No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their people to the tenth generation may come into the meeting of the Lord's people:

ASV_Original: because they met you not with bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth out of Egypt, and because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: when you came out of Egypt, they hired Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, who cursed you with the water and bread.
BBE_Original: Because they gave you no bread or water on your way, when you came out of Egypt: and they got Balaam, the son of Peor, from Pethor in Aram-naharaim to put curses on you.

ASV_Original: Nevertheless Jehovah thy God would not hearken unto Balaam; but Jehovah thy God turned the curse into a blessing unto thee, because Jehovah thy God loved thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah your God did not like Balaam, but Jehovah your God gave you a blessing.
BBE_Original: But the Lord your God would not give ear to Balaam, but let the curse be changed into a blessing to you, because of his love for you.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt not seek their peace nor their prosperity all thy days for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: you won't be looking for peace or prosperity all your life.
BBE_Original: Do nothing for their peace or well-being for ever.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite; for he is thy brother: thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian; because thou wast a sojourner in his land.
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't have to hate an Edomite, for he's your brother.
BBE_Original: But have no hate for an Edomite, because he is your brother, or for an Egyptian, for you were living in his land.

ASV_Original: The children of the third generation that are born unto them shall enter into the assembly of Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the children of the third generation will enter the assembly of the Lord.
BBE_Original: Their children in the third generation may come into the meeting of the Lord's people.

ASV_Original: When thou goest forth in camp against thine enemies, then thou shalt keep thee from every evil thing.
ASV_Paraphrased: then you'll keep your enemies out of your camp, and you'll be safe.
BBE_Original: When you go out to war and put your tents in position, keep from every evil thing.

ASV_Original: If there be among you any man, that is not clean by reason of that which chanceth him by night, then shall he go abroad out of the camp, he shall not come within the camp:
ASV_Paraphrased: if there's a man among you, he won't be clean by night, so he's not going to the camp.
BBE_Original: If any man among you becomes unclean through anything which has taken place in the night, he is to go out from the tent-circle and keep outside it:

ASV_Original: but it shall be, when evening cometh on, he shall bathe himself in water; and when the sun is down, he shall come within the camp.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the sun goes down, he will go to the camp, and when the sun goes down, he will be in the water.
BBE_Original: But when evening comes near, let him take a bath: and after sundown he may come back to the tents.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou shalt go forth abroad:
ASV_Paraphrased: you'll have a place to go, where you're going to go abroad:
BBE_Original: Let there be a place outside the tent-circle to which you may go;

ASV_Original: and thou shalt have a paddle among thy weapons; and it shall be, when thou sittest down abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee:
ASV_Paraphrased: when you sit down, you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig in, and you'll dig
BBE_Original: And have among your arms a spade; and when you have been to that place, let that which comes from you be covered up with earth:

ASV_Original: for Jehovah thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give up thine enemies before thee; therefore shall thy camp be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in thee, and turn away from thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: your camp shall be holy, that he may not see unclean things in you, and he will not be able to turn away from your camp.
BBE_Original: For the Lord your God is walking among your tents, to keep you safe and to give up into your hands those who are fighting against you; then let your tents be holy, so that he may see no unclean thing among you, and be turned away from you.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt not deliver unto his master a servant that is escaped from his master unto thee:
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't give your master a servant who's escaped from his master.
BBE_Original: Do not give back to his master a servant who has gone in flight from his master and come to you:

ASV_Original: he shall dwell with thee, in the midst of thee, in the place which he shall choose within one of thy gates, where it pleaseth him best: thou shalt not oppress him.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will not oppress him, but he will be happy to be with you, in the place where he chooses to go to, where he likes best: Thou shalt not oppress him.
BBE_Original: Let him go on living among you in whatever place is most pleasing to him: do not be hard on him.

ASV_Original: There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
ASV_Paraphrased: there will be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, not even a sodomite.
BBE_Original: No daughter of Israel is to let herself be used as a loose woman for a strange god, and no son of Israel is to give himself to a man.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt not bring the hire of a harlot, or the wages of a dog, into the house of Jehovah thy God for any vow: for even both these are an abomination unto Jehovah thy God.
ASV_Paraphrased: for even the vow of a whore, a dog, or a dog's wages are not allowed to be taken into the house of God by God's name.
BBE_Original: Do not take into the house of the Lord your God, as an offering for an oath, the price of a loose woman or the money given to one used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods: for these two things are disgusting to the Lord your God.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt not lend upon interest to thy brother; interest of money, interest of victuals, interest of anything that is lent upon interest.
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't lend money to your brother, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest, interest
BBE_Original: Do not take interest from an Israelite on anything, money or food or any other goods, which you let him have:

ASV_Original: Unto a foreigner thou mayest lend upon interest; but unto thy brother thou shalt not lend upon interest, that Jehovah thy God may bless thee in all that thou puttest thy hand unto, in the land whither thou goest in to possess it.
ASV_Paraphrased: you can lend to a stranger, but you can't lend to your brother, that God bless you in the land where you're going to be.
BBE_Original: From men of other nations you may take interest, but not from an Israelite: so that the blessing of the Lord your God may be on everything to which you put your hand, in the land which you are about to take as your heritage.

ASV_Original: When thou shalt vow a vow unto Jehovah thy God, thou shalt not be slack to pay it: for Jehovah thy God will surely require it of thee; and it would be sin in thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will not be able to pay your promise to God, for God's sake will demand it of you.
BBE_Original: When you take an oath to the Lord, do not be slow to give effect to it: for without doubt the Lord your God will make you responsible, and will put it to your account as sin.

ASV_Original: But if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you don't promise, it's not a sin.
BBE_Original: But if you take no oath, there will be no sin.

ASV_Original: That which is gone out of thy lips thou shalt observe and do; according as thou hast vowed unto Jehovah thy God, a freewill-offering, which thou hast promised with thy mouth.
ASV_Paraphrased: as you promised your God, you will observe and do what you promised to do with your mouth.
BBE_Original: Whatever your lips have said, see that you do it; for you gave your word freely to the Lord your God.

ASV_Original: When thou comest into thy neighbor's vineyard, then thou mayest eat of grapes thy fill at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put any in thy vessel.
ASV_Paraphrased: when you come to your neighbour's vineyard, you can eat grapes at your own pleasure, but you won't be able to take any of them.
BBE_Original: When you go into your neighbour's vine-garden, you may take of his grapes at your pleasure, but you may not take them away in your vessel.

ASV_Original: When thou comest into thy neighbor's standing grain, then thou mayest pluck the ears with thy hand; but thou shalt not move a sickle unto thy neighbor's standing grain.
ASV_Paraphrased: when you come to your neighbour's grain, you can pick up your hand, but you won't be able to move a sickle to your neighbour's grain.
BBE_Original: When you go into your neighbour's field, you may take the heads of grain with your hand; but you may not put your blade to his grain.

ASV_Original: And it came to pass, when Jabin king of Hazor heard thereof, that he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,
ASV_Paraphrased: when Jabin king of Hazor heard of it, he sent to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Shimon, and to the king of Shimon, and to the king of Shimon.
BBE_Original: Now Jabin, king of Hazor, hearing of these things, sent to Jobab, king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,

ASV_Original: and to the kings that were on the north, in the hill-country, and in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, and in the lowland, and in the heights of Dor on the west,
ASV_Paraphrased: in the mountains of the north, in the hills of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north, in the mountains of the north,
BBE_Original: And to the kings on the north in the hill-country, and in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, and in the lowland, and in the highlands of Dor on the west,

ASV_Original: to the Canaanite on the east and on the west, and the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the hill-country, and the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebusite, the Jebus
BBE_Original: And to the Canaanites on the east and on the west, and to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the hill-country, and the Hivites under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.

ASV_Original: And they went out, they and all their hosts with them, much people, even as the sand that is upon the sea-shore in multitude, with horses and chariots very many.
ASV_Paraphrased: they came, they and all their hosts, and the sand was everywhere, with horses and chariots, and the people were everywhere.
BBE_Original: And they went out, they and all their armies with them, a great people, in number like the sand on the seaside, with horses and war-carriages in great number.

ASV_Original: And all these kings met together; and they came and encamped together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
ASV_Paraphrased: all the kings met, and they came to the water, and they fought with Israel.
BBE_Original: And all these kings came together, and put their forces in position at the waters of Merom, to make war on Israel.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto Joshua, Be not afraid because of them; for to-morrow at this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: thou shalt hock their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.
ASV_Paraphrased: Joshua said, Be not afraid, for I'll take them all to Israel tomorrow.
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Joshua, Have no fear of them: for tomorrow at this time I will give them all up dead before Israel; you are to have the leg-muscles of their horses cut and their war-carriages burned with fire.

ASV_Original: So Joshua came, and all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly, and fell upon them.
ASV_Paraphrased: all the people of the war, against them by the water, suddenly turned against them, and they fell.
BBE_Original: So Joshua and all the men of war with him came against them suddenly at the waters of Merom, and made an attack on them.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah delivered them into the hand of Israel, and they smote them, and chased them unto great Sidon, and unto Misrephoth-maim, and unto the valley of Mizpeh eastward; and they smote them, until they left them none remaining.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were taken to the hand of Israel, and they were driven to the great Sidon, and to the mountains of Misrephoth-maim, and to the valley of Mizpeh.
BBE_Original: And the Lord gave them up into the hands of Israel, and they overcame them driving them back to great Zidon and to Misrephoth-maim and into the valley of Mizpeh to the east; and they put them all to death, no man got away safely.

ASV_Original: And Joshua did unto them as Jehovah bade him: he hocked their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.
ASV_Paraphrased: Joshua threw his horse and burned his chariot with fire.
BBE_Original: And Joshua did to them as the Lord had said to him; he had the leg-muscles of their horses cut and their war-carriages burned with fire.

ASV_Original: And Joshua turned back at that time, and took Hazor, and smote the king thereof with the sword: for Hazor beforetime was the head of all those kingdoms.
ASV_Paraphrased: Joshua turned, and Hazor turned, and the king of the kingdom was struck by the sword.
BBE_Original: At that time, Joshua went on to take Hazor and put its king to the sword: for in earlier times Hazor was the chief of all those kingdoms.

ASV_Original: And they smote all the souls that were therein with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them; there was none left that breathed: and he burnt Hazor with fire.
ASV_Paraphrased: he struck all the souls that were in the sword, and utterly destroyed them; there was none left to breathe.
BBE_Original: And they put every person in it to death without mercy, giving every living thing up to the curse, and burning Hazor.

ASV_Original: And all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and he smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them; as Moses the servant of Jehovah commanded.
ASV_Paraphrased: Joshua took all the cities of the kings, and all the kings of them, and utterly destroyed them, as Moses commanded.
BBE_Original: And all the towns of these kings, and all the kings, Joshua took, and put them to the sword: he gave them up to the curse, as Moses, the servant of the Lord, had said.

ASV_Original: But as for the cities that stood on their mounds, Israel burned none of them, save Hazor only; that did Joshua burn.
ASV_Paraphrased: as for the cities that stood on the mound, Joshua burned none of them, except Hazor.
BBE_Original: As for the towns made on hills of earth, not one was burned by Israel but Hazor, which was burned by Joshua.

ASV_Original: And all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, the children of Israel took for a prey unto themselves; but every man they smote with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them, neither left they any that breathed.
ASV_Paraphrased: they took the city, the cattle, the children of Israel, and they were prey to themselves, but they were all killed by the sword.
BBE_Original: And all the goods taken from these towns, and their cattle, the children of Israel kept for themselves; but every man they put to death without mercy, till their destruction was complete, and there was no one living.

ASV_Original: As Jehovah commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua: and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that Jehovah commanded Moses.
ASV_Paraphrased: so did Moses command Joshua, and Joshua did not leave anything undone to the Lord.
BBE_Original: As the Lord had given orders to Moses his servant, so Moses gave orders to Joshua, and so Joshua did; every order which the Lord had given to Moses was done.

ASV_Original: So Joshua took all that land, the hill-country, and all the South, and all the land of Goshen, and the lowland, and the Arabah, and the hill-country of Israel, and the lowland of the same;
ASV_Paraphrased: all the land, the hills, the plains, the mountains, the desert, the desert, the mountains, the hills, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the mountains, the
BBE_Original: So Joshua took all that land, the hill-country and all the South, and all the land of Goshen, and the lowland and the Arabah, the hill-country of Israel and its lowland;

ASV_Original: from mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir, even unto Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon under mount Hermon: and all their kings he took, and smote them, and put them to death.
ASV_Paraphrased: he took all the kings, and they were killed, and he killed them all, and he killed them all, and he killed them.
BBE_Original: From Mount Halak, which goes up to Seir, as far as Baal-gad in the valley of Lebanon under Mount Hermon: and all their kings he overcame and put to death.

ASV_Original: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
ASV_Paraphrased: all those kings have fought for a long time.
BBE_Original: For a long time Joshua made war on all those kings.

ASV_Original: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, save the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon: they took all in battle.
ASV_Paraphrased: the city of Jerusalem, which was not a city of peace with the children of Israel, but the Gibeonites: they fought all over the city.
BBE_Original: Not one town made peace with the children of Israel, but only the Hivites of Gibeon: they took them all in war.

ASV_Original: For it was of Jehovah to harden their hearts, to come against Israel in battle, that he might utterly destroy them, that they might have no favor, but that he might destroy them, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
ASV_Paraphrased: that he might destroy them, as God commanded Moses, that he might destroy them, that he might destroy them, as God commanded Moses.
BBE_Original: For the Lord made them strong in heart to go to war against Israel, so that he might give them up to the curse without mercy, and that destruction might come on them, as the Lord had given orders to Moses.

ASV_Original: And Joshua came at that time, and cut off the Anakim from the hill-country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the hill-country of Judah, and from all the hill-country of Israel: Joshua utterly destroyed them with their cities.
ASV_Paraphrased: from the hill country of Judah, from the hill country of Anab, from the hill country of Debir, from the hill country of Anab, from the hill-country of Judah, from the hill-country of Judah.
BBE_Original: And Joshua came at that time and put an end to the Anakim in the hill-country, in Hebron, in Debir, in Anab, and in all the hill-country of Judah and Israel: Joshua gave them and their towns to the curse.

ASV_Original: There was none of the Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
ASV_Paraphrased: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
BBE_Original: Not one of the Anakim was to be seen in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, some were still living.

ASV_Original: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that Jehovah spake unto Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land had rest from war.
ASV_Paraphrased: Joshua took the whole country, according to the words of Moses, and Joshua gave it to Israel according to the division of the tribe.
BBE_Original: So Joshua took all the land, as the Lord had said to Moses; and Joshua gave it to the children of Israel as their heritage, making division of it among them by their tribes. And the land had rest from war.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I have spoken to Moses, and I have spoken to Moses."
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Moses,

ASV_Original: If any one sin, and commit a trespass against Jehovah, and deal falsely with his neighbor in a matter of deposit, or of bargain, or of robbery, or have oppressed his neighbor,
ASV_Paraphrased: any sin, and he will commit a sin against God, and he will be guilty of a sin against his neighbour, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a robbery, or a
BBE_Original: If anyone does wrong, and is untrue to the Lord, acting falsely to his neighbour in connection with something put in his care, or something given for a debt, or has taken away anything by force, or has been cruel to his neighbour,

ASV_Original: or have found that which was lost, and deal falsely therein, and swear to a lie; in any of all these things that a man doeth, sinning therein;
ASV_Paraphrased: in all these things that a man does, sinning in them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie; in all of them, they swear to lie
BBE_Original: Or has taken a false oath about the loss of something which he has come across by chance; if a man has done any of these evil things,

ASV_Original: then it shall be, if he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing which he hath gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was committed to him, or the lost thing which he found,
ASV_Paraphrased: if he has committed a robbery, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or the thing he stole, or
BBE_Original: Causing sin to come on him, then he will have to give back the thing he took by force or got by cruel acts, or the goods which were put in his care or the thing he came on by chance,

ASV_Original: or any thing about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in full, and shall add the fifth part more thereto: unto him to whom it appertaineth shall he give it, in the day of his being found guilty.
ASV_Paraphrased: he shall give him to him, in the day of his discovery, in full, and he shall add the fifth part of the sum: to him who has sworn to it.
BBE_Original: Or anything about which he took a false oath; he will have to give it all back, with the addition of a fifth of its value, to him whose property it is, when he has been judged to be in the wrong.

ASV_Original: And he shall bring his trespass-offering unto Jehovah, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy estimation, for a trespass-offering, unto the priest:
ASV_Paraphrased: according to your estimate, he will bring the ram to the priest, a ram without blemish, according to the priest's estimation.
BBE_Original: Then let him take to the Lord the offering for his wrongdoing; giving to the priest for his offering, a male sheep from the flock, without any mark, of the value fixed by you:

ASV_Original: and the priest shall make atonement for him before Jehovah; and he shall be forgiven concerning whatsoever he doeth so as to be guilty thereby.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall apologize before Jehovah for what he has done, and he will be forgiven.
BBE_Original: And the priest will take away his sin from before the Lord, and he will have forgiveness for whatever crime he has done

ASV_Original: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I have spoken to Moses, and I have spoken to Moses."
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Moses,

ASV_Original: Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt-offering: the burnt-offering shall be on the hearth upon the altar all night unto the morning; and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning thereon.
ASV_Paraphrased: the burnt-out offering is on the altar, the fire is on the altar, the fire is on the altar, the fire is on the altar, the fire is on the altar.
BBE_Original: Give orders to Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law for the burned offering: the offering is to be on the fire-wood on the altar all night till the morning; and the fire of the altar is to be kept burning.

ASV_Original: And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh; and he shall take up the ashes whereto the fire hath consumed the burnt-offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall put on his linen robe, and his linen trousers shall be on his body; and he shall take the ashes from the altar.
BBE_Original: And the priest is to put on his linen robes and his linen trousers, and take up what is over of the offering after it has been burned on the altar, and put it by the side of the altar.

ASV_Original: And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will take off his clothes, and put on another dress, and carry the ashes to the clean place.
BBE_Original: Then having taken off his linen robes and put on other clothing, he is to take it away into a clean place, outside the tent-circle.

ASV_Original: And the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning thereon, it shall not go out; and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning: and he shall lay the burnt-offering in order upon it, and shall burn thereon the fat of the peace-offerings.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall burn the altar with fire, and he shall burn the wood on it every morning: and he shall burn the altar.
BBE_Original: The fire on the altar is to be kept burning; it is never to go out; every morning the priest is to put wood on it, placing the burned offering in order on it, and there the fat of the peace-offering is to be burned.

ASV_Original: Fire shall be kept burning upon the altar continually; it shall not go out.
ASV_Paraphrased: the altar shall be kept burning constantly; it will not be extinguished.
BBE_Original: Let the fire be kept burning on the altar at all times; it is never to go out.

ASV_Original: And this is the law of the meal-offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before Jehovah, before the altar.
ASV_Paraphrased: the sons of Aaron will be offered before the altar before the altar.
BBE_Original: And this is the law for the meal offering: it is to be offered to the Lord before the altar by the sons of Aaron.

ASV_Original: And he shall take up therefrom his handful, of the fine flour of the meal-offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meal-offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savor, as the memorial thereof, unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: he takes a handful of flour and oil, and all the fragrant oil of the meal, and burns it on the altar.
BBE_Original: The priest is to take in his hand some of the meal of the meal offering and of the oil of it, and all the perfume on it, burning it on the altar as a sign, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

ASV_Original: And that which is left thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: it shall be eaten without leaven in a holy place; in the court of the tent of meeting they shall eat it.
ASV_Paraphrased: Aaron and his sons shall eat it in the holy place, in the tent of the meeting.
BBE_Original: And whatever is over Aaron and his sons may have for their food, taking it without leaven in a holy place; in the open space of the Tent of meeting they may take a meal of it.

ASV_Original: It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it as their portion of my offerings made by fire; it is most holy, as the sin-offering, and as the trespass-offering.
ASV_Paraphrased: it is not a leaven, but a part of the offering made by fire, and as a sin-offering.
BBE_Original: It is not to be cooked with leaven. I have given it to them as their part of the offerings made by fire to me; it is most holy, as are the sin-offerings and the offerings for error.

ASV_Original: Every male among the children of Aaron shall eat of it, as his portion for ever throughout your generations, from the offerings of Jehovah made by fire: whosoever toucheth them shall be holy.
ASV_Paraphrased: as a part of the offering of the fire, the men of Aaron will eat it, as a part of the whole of the children of Aaron, from the fire of the Lord's fire: whoever touches them will be holy.
BBE_Original: Every male among the children of Aaron may have it for food; it is their right for ever through all your generations, from the offerings made by fire to the Lord: anyone touching them will be holy.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I have spoken to Moses, and I have spoken to Moses."
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Moses,

ASV_Original: This is the oblation of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto Jehovah in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering perpetually, half of it in the morning, and half thereof in the evening.
ASV_Paraphrased: the tenth part of the ephah of fine flour for the meal, half of it in the form of a cake, is the oblation of Aaron and his sons.
BBE_Original: This is the offering which Aaron and his sons are to make to the Lord on the day when he is made a priest: the tenth part of an ephah of the best meal for a meal offering for ever; half of it in the morning and half in the evening.

ASV_Original: On a baking-pan it shall be made with oil; when it is soaked, thou shalt bring it in: in baken pieces shalt thou offer the meal-offering for a sweet savor unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the oil is soaked, thou shalt bring the meal to the oven; thou shalt bring the meal to the oven with a sweet savor.
BBE_Original: Let it be made with oil on a flat plate; when it is well mixed and cooked, let it be broken and taken in as a meal offering, for a sweet smell to the Lord.

ASV_Original: And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons shall offer it: by a statute for ever it shall be wholly burnt unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest who will be in his place from among his sons shall be offered: It shall be burned by the law of God forever.
BBE_Original: And the same offering is to be given by that one of his sons who takes his place as priest; by an order for ever, all of it is to be burned before the Lord.

ASV_Original: And every meal-offering of the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest's entire offering must be burned: It is not eaten.
BBE_Original: Every meal offering offered for the priest is to be completely burned: nothing of it is to be taken for food.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I have spoken to Moses, and I have spoken to Moses."
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Moses,

ASV_Original: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin-offering: in the place where the burnt-offering is killed shall the sin-offering be killed before Jehovah: it is most holy.
ASV_Paraphrased: Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin-offering: In the place where the burnt-out offering is killed, the sin-offering is killed by God: It is holy.
BBE_Original: Say to Aaron and his sons, This is the law for the sin-offering: the sin-offering is to be put to death before the Lord in the same place as the burned offering; it is most holy.

ASV_Original: The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in a holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tent of meeting.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest who is offering it to sin is eating it in a holy place.
BBE_Original: The priest by whom it is offered for sin, is to take it for his food in a holy place, in the open space of the Tent of meeting.

ASV_Original: Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy; and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in a holy place.
ASV_Paraphrased: anywhere on the body of the body, whether it is blood or blood, is holy; and when blood is sprinkled on the body, it is washed.
BBE_Original: Anyone touching the flesh of it will be holy: and if any of the blood is dropped on any clothing, the thing on which the blood has been dropped is to be washed in a holy place.

ASV_Original: But the earthen vessel wherein it is boiled shall be broken; and if it be boiled in a brazen vessel, it shall be scoured, and rinsed in water.
ASV_Paraphrased: the vessel shall be broken, and if it is cooked in a brass vessel, it must be washed and washed in water.
BBE_Original: But the vessel of earth in which the flesh was cooked is to be broken; or if a brass vessel was used, it is to be rubbed clean and washed out with water.

ASV_Original: Every male among the priests shall eat thereof: it is most holy.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priests shall eat it with the men: It's the most holy thing.
BBE_Original: Every male among the priests may take it for his food: it is most holy.

ASV_Original: And no sin-offering, whereof any of the blood is brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the holy place, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt with fire.
ASV_Paraphrased: it shall be prohibited to eat any sin-offering, which is brought into the tent of the meeting, to make atonement in the holy place.
BBE_Original: No sin-offering, the blood of which is taken into the Tent of meeting, to take away sin in the holy place, may be used for food: it is to be burned with fire.

ASV_Original: And the famine was sore in the land.
ASV_Paraphrased: the famine was bad in the country.
BBE_Original: Now the land was in bitter need of food.

ASV_Original: And it came to pass, when they had eaten up the grain which they had brought out of Egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy us a little food.
ASV_Paraphrased: when they ate the grain they brought from Egypt, their father said, Go on, buy us a little food.
BBE_Original: And when the grain which they had got in Egypt was all used up, their father said to them, Go again and get us a little food.

ASV_Original: And Judah spake unto him, saying, The man did solemnly protest unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said, "Unless your brother is with you, you won't see my face. " He said, "Unless he's with you, you won't see him." He said, "Unless he's with you, you won't see him." He said, "Unless he's with you." He said, "Unless he's with you." He said, "Unless he's with you." He said, "Unless he's with you." He said, "Unless he's
BBE_Original: And Judah said to him, The man said to us with an oath, You are not to come before me again without your brother.

ASV_Original: If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
ASV_Paraphrased: we'll go with our brother, and we'll buy you something:
BBE_Original: If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and get food:

ASV_Original: but if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down; for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you don't send him, we won't be able to see him, except for your brother.
BBE_Original: But if you will not send him, we will not go down: for the man said to us, You are not to come before me if your brother is not with you.

ASV_Original: And Israel said, Wherefore dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
ASV_Paraphrased: then why did you tell the man if you had a brother?
BBE_Original: And Israel said, Why were you so cruel to me as to say to him that you had a brother?

ASV_Original: And they said, The man asked straitly concerning ourselves, and concerning our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: could we in any wise know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
ASV_Paraphrased: we asked him, and he asked, Are you still alive? Can we talk to your father?
BBE_Original: And they said, The man put a number of questions to us about ourselves and our family, saying, Is your father still living? have you another brother? And we had to give him answers; how were we to have any idea that he would say, Come back with your brother?

ASV_Original: And Judah said unto Israel his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said to his father, Send the boy with me, and we'll go. He said, "We'll be fine, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we'll survive, and we
BBE_Original: Then Judah said to Israel, his father, Send the boy with me, and let us be up and going, so that we and you and our little ones may not come to destruction.

ASV_Original: I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not unto thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
ASV_Paraphrased: if I don't bring him to you, and I'm sure he's not yours, then I'm responsible for it: If I'm not with him, then I'm responsible for it.
BBE_Original: Put him into my care and make me responsible for him: if I do not give him safely back to you, let mine be the sin for ever.

ASV_Original: for except we had lingered, surely we had now returned a second time.
ASV_Paraphrased: except we've been here for a second time, we've probably been back.
BBE_Original: Truly, if we had not let the time go by, we might have come back again by now.

ASV_Original: And their father Israel said unto them, If it be so now, do this: take of the choice fruits of the land in your vessels, and carry down the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spicery and myrrh, nuts, and almonds;
ASV_Paraphrased: if so, take the choice fruit of the land, and carry it to the ship, a little bit of honey, a little bit of honey, a little bit of honey, a little bit of honey.
BBE_Original: Then their father Israel said to them, If it has to be so, then do this: take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels to give the man, perfumes and honey and spices and nuts:

ASV_Original: and take double money in your hand; and the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks carry again in your hand; peradventure it was an oversight:
ASV_Paraphrased: the money in your pockets is now in your hands, and you have a double money in your pockets; and the money you gave to the bag is now in your hands.
BBE_Original: And take twice as much money with you; that is to say, take back the money which was put in your bags, for it may have been an error;

ASV_Original: take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
ASV_Paraphrased: come on, brother, and come on, brother, and come on, brother.
BBE_Original: And take your brother and go back to the man:

ASV_Original: and God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may release unto you your other brother and Benjamin. And if I be bereaved of my children, I am bereaved.
ASV_Paraphrased: if I'm not able to have my children, I'm sorry.
BBE_Original: And may God, the Ruler of all, give you mercy before the man, so that he may give you back your other brother and Benjamin. If my children are to be taken from me; there is no help for it.

ASV_Original: And the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and rose up, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
ASV_Paraphrased: and the men took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and they took the money, and
BBE_Original: So they took what their father said for the man, and twice as much money in their hands, and Benjamin, and went on their journey to Egypt, and came before Joseph.

ASV_Original: And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the steward of his house, Bring the men into the house, and slay, and make ready; for the men shall dine with me at noon.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Joseph saw Benjamin, he said, Bring the men to the house, and they'll eat with me at noon.
BBE_Original: And when Joseph saw Benjamin, he said to his chief servant, Take these men into my house, and make ready a meal, for they will take food with me in the middle of the day.

ASV_Original: And the man did as Joseph bade; and the man brought the men to Joseph's house.
ASV_Paraphrased: the man who brought the men to Joseph's house was Joseph.
BBE_Original: And the servant did as Joseph said, and took the men into Joseph's house.

ASV_Original: And the men were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph's house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were afraid, because they were brought to Joseph's house, and they said, because of the money we had taken from the bags at the first time.
BBE_Original: Now the men were full of fear because they had been taken into Joseph's house and they said, It is because of the money which was put back in our bags the first time; he is looking for something against us, so that he may come down on us and take us and our asses for his use.

ASV_Original: And they came near to the steward of Joseph's house, and they spake unto him at the door of the house,
ASV_Paraphrased: they came to the house of Joseph, and they spoke to him at the door.
BBE_Original: So they went up to Joseph's chief servant at the door of the house,

ASV_Original: and said, Oh, my lord, we came indeed down at the first time to buy food:
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, we've been there for the first time to buy food:
BBE_Original: And said, O my lord, we only came down the first time to get food;

ASV_Original: and it came to pass, when we came to the lodging-place, that we opened our sacks, and, behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
ASV_Paraphrased: when we came to the lodge, we opened the bags, and we found that all the money was in the bag, and we were full of money: and we took it again.
BBE_Original: And when we came to our night's resting-place, on opening our bags we saw that every man's money was in the mouth of his bag, all our money in full weight: and we have it with us to give it back;

ASV_Original: And other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food: we know not who put our money in our sacks.
ASV_Paraphrased: we know who put money in our pockets: We don't know who gave us the money.
BBE_Original: As well as more money, with which to get food: we have no idea who put our money in our bags.

ASV_Original: And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out unto them.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said, Peace be with you, don't worry: Your father gave you a treasure in your bags.
BBE_Original: Then the servant said, Peace be with you: have no fear: your God, even the God of your father, has put wealth in your bags for you: I had your money. Then he let Simeon come out to them.

ASV_Original: And the man brought the men into Joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
ASV_Paraphrased: he gave them water and washed their feet, and he gave them a drink.
BBE_Original: And the servant took them into Joseph's house, and gave them water for washing their feet; and he gave their asses food.

ASV_Original: And they made ready the present against Joseph's coming at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were ready to eat the bread Joseph was coming to noon: They heard they were supposed to eat.
BBE_Original: And they got ready the things for Joseph before he came in the middle of the day: for word was given to them that they were to have a meal there.

ASV_Original: And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed down themselves to him to the earth.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Joseph came home, they took the present from him and bowed to him.
BBE_Original: And when Joseph came in, they gave him the things which they had for him, and went down to the earth before him.

ASV_Original: And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?
ASV_Paraphrased: he asked them about their health, and said, Is your father alive?
BBE_Original: And he said, How are you? is your father well, the old man of whom you were talking to me? is he still living?

ASV_Original: And they said, Thy servant our father is well, he is yet alive. And they bowed the head, and made obeisance.
ASV_Paraphrased: they bowed, and the servant of our father was alive.
BBE_Original: And they said, Your servant, our father, is well, he is still living. And they went down on their faces before him.

ASV_Original: And he lifted up his eyes, and saw Benjamin his brother, his mother's son, and said, Is this your youngest brother, of whom ye spake unto me? And he said, God be gracious unto thee, my son.
ASV_Paraphrased: he looked at Benjamin, his brother, his mother's son, and said, Is that your youngest brother, the one you've spoken to me about?
BBE_Original: Then, lifting up his eyes, he saw Benjamin, his brother, his mother's son, and he said, Is this your youngest brother of whom you gave me word? And he said, God be good to you, my son.

ASV_Original: And Joseph made haste; for his heart yearned over his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
ASV_Paraphrased: he hurried, for he was looking for his brother Joseph, and he was crying.
BBE_Original: Then Joseph's heart went out to his brother, and he went quickly into his room, for he was overcome with weeping.

ASV_Original: And he washed his face, and came out; and he refrained himself, and said, Set on bread.
ASV_Paraphrased: he washed his face, and he took off his bread.
BBE_Original: Then, after washing his face, he came out, and controlling his feelings said, Put food before us.

ASV_Original: And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, that did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination unto the Egyptians.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were set up by themselves, and for them, and for the Egyptians, that they might eat with them, by themselves:
BBE_Original: And they put a meal ready for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians who were with him by themselves; because the Egyptians may not take food with the Hebrews, for that would make them unclean.

ASV_Original: And they sat before him, the first-born according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one with another.
ASV_Paraphrased: the men looked at him, the youngest of the firstborn, the youngest of the young.
BBE_Original: And they were all given their seats before him in order of birth, from the oldest to the youngest: so that they were looking at one another in wonder.

ASV_Original: And he took and sent messes unto them from before him: but Benjamin's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with him.
ASV_Paraphrased: Benjamin drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and they drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank, and drank,
BBE_Original: And Joseph sent food to them from his table, but he sent five times as much to Benjamin as to any of the others. And they took wine freely with him.

ASV_Original: And to the angel of the church in Sardis write: These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and thou art dead.
ASV_Paraphrased: I know your name, that you have a name that you will live, and you will be dead.
BBE_Original: And to the angel of the church in Sardis say: These things says he who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars: I have knowledge of your works, that you seem to be living but are dead.

ASV_Original: Be thou watchful, and establish the things that remain, which were ready to die: for I have found no works of thine perfected before my God.
ASV_Paraphrased: watchful, and I found no work of yours perfected before God.
BBE_Original: Be on the watch, and make strong the rest of the things which are near to death; because as judged by me your works have not come up to God's measure.

ASV_Original: Remember therefore how thou hast received and didst hear; and keep it, and repent. If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you don't watch, I'll come as a thief, and you won't know what hour I'll be.
BBE_Original: Keep in mind, then, the teaching which was given to you, and be ruled by it and have a change of heart. If then you do not keep watch, I will come like a thief, and you will have no knowledge of the hour when I will come on you.

ASV_Original: But thou hast a few names in Sardis that did not defile their garments: and they shall walk with me in white; for they are worthy.
ASV_Paraphrased: you have a few names in Sardis that don't stain the white clothes: they're worthy.
BBE_Original: But you have some names in Sardis who have kept clean their robes; and as a reward they will go in white with me.

ASV_Original: He that overcometh shall thus be arrayed in white garments; and I will in no wise blot his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will therefore, in no way, blot his name from the book of life, and I will confess his name before my father, and before the angels.
BBE_Original: He who overcomes will be dressed in white, and I will not take his name from the book of life, and I will give witness to his name before my Father, and before his angels.

ASV_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must hear what the Spirit tells the church.
BBE_Original: He who has ears, let him give ear to what the Spirit says to the churches.

ASV_Original: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth and none shall shut, and that shutteth and none openeth:
ASV_Paraphrased: he writes: He says: He's saying: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He says: He
BBE_Original: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia say: These things says he who is holy, he who is true, he who has the key of David, opening the door so that it may be shut by no one, and shutting it so that it may be open to no one.

ASV_Original: I know thy works (behold, I have set before thee a door opened, which none can shut), that thou hast a little power, and didst keep my word, and didst not deny my name.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have a door open, which none can shut, and I have promised you, and I didn't deny your name.
BBE_Original: I have knowledge of your works (see, I have put before you an open door which may be shut by no one), and that you have a little strength, and have kept my word, and have been true to my name.

ASV_Original: Behold, I give of the synagogue of Satan, of them that say they are Jews, and they are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: look, I'm giving you the synagogue of Satan, the ones who say they're Jews, and they're not, but they're lying.
BBE_Original: See, I will make those of the Synagogue of Satan who say they are Jews, and are not, but say what is false; I will make them come and give worship before your feet, and see my love for you.

ASV_Original: Because thou didst keep the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of trial, that hour which is to come upon the whole world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will also keep you from the hour of trial, that hour when the world will be tested, that hour when the world will be judged.
BBE_Original: Because you have kept my word in quiet strength, I will keep you from the hour of testing which is coming on all the world, to put to the test those who are on earth.

ASV_Original: I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no one take thy crown.
ASV_Paraphrased: quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick, quick,
BBE_Original: I come quickly: keep that which you have, so that no one may take your crown.

ASV_Original: He that overcometh, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go out thence no more: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God, and mine own new name.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll write him a name of God and the name of the city of God, and he'll go away.
BBE_Original: Him who overcomes I will make a pillar in the house of my God, and he will go out no more: and I will put on him the name of my God, and the name of the town of my God, the new Jerusalem, which comes down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.

ASV_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must hear what the Spirit tells the church.
BBE_Original: He who has ears, let him give ear to what the Spirit says to the churches.

ASV_Original: And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write: These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God:
ASV_Paraphrased: the angel of the church in Laodicea writes: This is the word of God, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of creation:
BBE_Original: And to the angel of the church in Laodicea say: These things says the true and certain witness, the head of God's new order:

ASV_Original: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.
ASV_Paraphrased: I know your work, you don't have to be cold or hot.
BBE_Original: I have knowledge of your works, that you are not cold or warm: it would be better if you were cold or warm.

ASV_Original: So because thou art lukewarm, and neither hot nor cold, I will spew thee out of my mouth.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll spit you out of my mouth, and you're not hot or cold.
BBE_Original: So because you are not one thing or the other, I will have no more to do with you.

ASV_Original: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and have gotten riches, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art the wretched one and miserable and poor and blind and naked:
ASV_Paraphrased: you say I'm rich, and I've got money, and I'm rich, and I'm rich, and I don't need anything.
BBE_Original: For you say, I have wealth, and have got together goods and land, and have need of nothing; and you are not conscious of your sad and unhappy condition, that you are poor and blind and without clothing.

ASV_Original: I counsel thee to buy of me gold refined by fire, that thou mayest become rich; and white garments, that thou mayest clothe thyself, and that the shame of thy nakedness be not made manifest; and eyesalve to anoint thine eyes, that thou mayest see.
ASV_Paraphrased: buy me gold, that you can afford to buy me, and that you can look good, and that the shame of your nakedness will not be revealed; and eyesalve to buy gold, that you can be comfortable; and eyesalve to buy gold, that you can be comfortable.
BBE_Original: If you are wise you will get from me gold tested by fire, so that you may have true wealth; and white robes to put on, so that your shame may not be seen; and oil for your eyes, so that you may see.

ASV_Original: As many as I love, I reprove and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
ASV_Paraphrased: I reprove and chastise, and I will be zealous.
BBE_Original: To all those who are dear to me, I give sharp words and punishment: then with all your heart have sorrow for your evil ways.

ASV_Original: Behold, I stand at the door and knock: if any man hear my voice and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: if anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I'll come in and I'll have a good time with him.
BBE_Original: See, I am waiting at the door and giving the sign; if my voice comes to any man's ears and he makes the door open, I will come in to him, and will take food with him and he with me.

ASV_Original: He that overcometh, I will give to him to sit down with me in my throne, as I also overcame, and sat down with my Father in his throne.
ASV_Paraphrased: as I have overcome, I will sit down with my father in the throne, and sit down with my father.
BBE_Original: To him who overcomes I will give a place with me on my high seat, even as I overcame, and am seated with my Father on his high seat.

ASV_Original: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith to the churches.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must hear what the Spirit tells the church.
BBE_Original: He who has ears, let him give ear to what the Spirit says to the churches.

ASV_Original: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the borders of Judaea and beyond the Jordan: and multitudes come together unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
ASV_Paraphrased: he rose and came to the borders of Judaea and beyond the Jordan, and there were crowds of people.
BBE_Original: And he got up, and went into the country of Judaea on the other side of Jordan: and great numbers of people came together to him again; and, as was his way, he gave them teaching.

ASV_Original: And there came unto him Pharisees, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? trying him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he asked him, Is it lawful to leave the woman?
BBE_Original: And Pharisees came to him, testing him with the question, Is it right for a man to put away his wife?

ASV_Original: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?
ASV_Paraphrased: what did Moses tell you?
BBE_Original: And he said to them in answer, What did Moses say you were to do?

ASV_Original: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
ASV_Paraphrased: she said Moses had written a divorce bill, and she was taken away.
BBE_Original: And they said to him, Moses let us give her a statement in writing, and be free from her.

ASV_Original: But Jesus said unto them, For your hardness of heart he wrote you this commandment.
ASV_Paraphrased: he wrote you this commandment for your hardness of heart.
BBE_Original: But Jesus said to them, Because of your hard hearts he gave you this law.

ASV_Original: But from the beginning of the creation, Male and female made he them.
ASV_Paraphrased: they were made by the male and the woman from the beginning.
BBE_Original: But from the first, male and female made he them.

ASV_Original: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife;
ASV_Paraphrased: for this reason, a man leaves his father and mother and will marry his wife;
BBE_Original: For this cause will a man go away from his father and mother, and be joined to his wife;

ASV_Original: and the two shall become one flesh: so that they are no more two, but one flesh.
ASV_Paraphrased: so that they are no longer two, but one body.
BBE_Original: And the two will become one flesh; so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

ASV_Original: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
ASV_Paraphrased: so God joined him, let not man be separated.
BBE_Original: Let not that which has been joined together by God be parted by man.

ASV_Original: And in the house the disciples asked him again of this matter.
ASV_Paraphrased: the disciples asked him again, and he answered them.
BBE_Original: And in the house the disciples put questions to him again about this thing.

ASV_Original: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her:
ASV_Paraphrased: he says, "Whoever leaves his wife, he's cheating on her." He's cheating on his wife.
BBE_Original: And he said to them, Whoever puts away his wife and takes another, is false to his wife;

ASV_Original: and if she herself shall put away her husband, and marry another, she committeth adultery.
ASV_Paraphrased: if she's not married, she's going to be a whore. She's going to be a whore if she marries someone else.
BBE_Original: And if she herself puts away her husband and takes another, she is false to her husband.

ASV_Original: And they were bringing unto him little children, that he should touch them: and the disciples rebuked them.
ASV_Paraphrased: he touched them with little children, so he could touch them: and the disciples rebelled.
BBE_Original: And they took to him little children, so that he might put his hands on them: and the disciples said sharp words to them.

ASV_Original: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me; forbid them not: for to such belongeth the kingdom of God.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said to them, Suffer the little children to come to me, for they belong to God.
BBE_Original: And when Jesus saw it, he was angry, and said to them, Let the little children come to me, and do not keep them away; for of such is the kingdom of God.

ASV_Original: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, whoever doesn't get the kingdom of God as a little kid, he won't be able to enter.
BBE_Original: Truly I say to you, Whoever does not put himself under the kingdom of God like a little child, will not come into it at all.

ASV_Original: And he took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands upon them.
ASV_Paraphrased: he took them in his arms and blessed them, and he held them in his hands.
BBE_Original: And he took them in his arms, and gave them a blessing, putting his hands on them.

ASV_Original: And as he was going forth into the way, there ran one to him, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
ASV_Paraphrased: he asked him, Good Teacher, what will I do to inherit eternal life?
BBE_Original: And while he was going out into the way, a man came running to him, and went down on his knees, saying, Good Master, what have I to do so that I may have eternal life?

ASV_Original: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good save one, even God.
ASV_Paraphrased: why do you call me good?
BBE_Original: And Jesus said to him, Why do you say I am good? no one is good but one, and that is God.

ASV_Original: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not kill, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor thy father and mother.
ASV_Paraphrased: you know, you don't have to kill, don't commit adultery, don't steal, don't lie, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat, don't cheat
BBE_Original: You have knowledge of what is said in the law, Do not put any one to death, Do not be untrue in married life, Do not take what is not yours, Do not give false witness, Do not get money by deceit, Give honour to your father and mother.

ASV_Original: And he said unto him, Teacher, all these things have I observed from my youth.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've seen everything from my youth, Teacher.
BBE_Original: And he said to him, Master, all these laws I have kept from the time when I was young.

ASV_Original: And Jesus looking upon him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus looked at him and said, "What you don't have is what you have, and you'll have treasure in heaven. "
BBE_Original: And Jesus, looking on him and loving him, said, There is one thing needed: go, get money for your goods, and give it to the poor, and you will have wealth in heaven: and come with me.

ASV_Original: But his countenance fell at the saying, and he went away sorrowful: for he was one that had great possessions.
ASV_Paraphrased: he looked sad, and he was one who had a great deal of property.
BBE_Original: But his face became sad at the saying, and he went away sorrowing: for he was one who had much property.

ASV_Original: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
