ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus looked around, and said, How little of the riches of God's kingdom will they be able to enter!
BBE_Original: And Jesus, looking round about, said to his disciples, How hard it is for those who have wealth to come into the kingdom of God!

ASV_Original: And the disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!
ASV_Paraphrased: how hard it is for them to believe that riches will be able to enter the kingdom of God!
BBE_Original: And the disciples were full of wonder at his words. But Jesus said to them again, Children, how hard it is for those who put faith in wealth to come into the kingdom of God!

ASV_Original: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
ASV_Paraphrased: the camel's eye is easier to see than the rich man's eye.
BBE_Original: It is simpler for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a man of wealth to come into the kingdom of God.

ASV_Original: And they were astonished exceedingly, saying unto him, Then who can be saved?
ASV_Paraphrased: they were amazed, and they said, Who's gonna save us?
BBE_Original: And they were greatly surprised, saying to him, Who then may have salvation?

ASV_Original: Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for all things are possible with God.
ASV_Paraphrased: he says, with men, it's impossible, but not with God: Everything can be done with God.
BBE_Original: Jesus, looking on them, said, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for all things are possible with God.

ASV_Original: Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said, Lo, we've all left, and we've all followed you.
BBE_Original: Peter said to him, See, we have given up everything, and come after you.

ASV_Original: Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or lands, for my sake, and for the gospel's sake,
ASV_Paraphrased: for the sake of God, I say, there's no one who's leaving the house, or the brothers, sisters, or mothers, or fathers, or children, or even the land.
BBE_Original: Jesus said, Truly I say to you, There is no man who has given up house, or brothers, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or land, because of me and the good news,

ASV_Original: but he shall receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.
ASV_Paraphrased: now, in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, and in the world, eternal life, will be given to him.
BBE_Original: Who will not get a hundred times as much now in this time, houses, and brothers, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and land--though with great troubles; and, in the world to come, eternal life.

ASV_Original: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.
ASV_Paraphrased: many of them will be the last ones, and the first ones.
BBE_Original: But a great number who are first will be last: and those who are last will be first.

ASV_Original: And they were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going before them: and they were amazed; and they that followed were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were to happen unto him,
ASV_Paraphrased: and he took the twelve, and began to tell them what was going to happen to Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: And they were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going before them: and they were full of wonder; but those who came after him were in fear. And again he took the twelve, and gave them word of the things which were to come on him,

ASV_Original: saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him unto the Gentiles:
ASV_Paraphrased: and the Son of man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death, and they will crucify him to the Jews:
BBE_Original: Saying, See, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man will be given up to the chief priests and the scribes; and they will give an order for his death, and will give him up to the Gentiles:

ASV_Original: and they shall mock him, and shall spit upon him, and shall scourge him, and shall kill him; and after three days he shall rise again.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will be mocked, spit on him, and spit on him, and he will be killed.
BBE_Original: And they will make sport of him, and put shame on him, and give him cruel blows, and will put him to death; and after three days he will come back from the dead.

ASV_Original: And there come near unto him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying unto him, Teacher, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall ask of thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: they said to him, Teacher, we'd like to ask you to do what we want you to do.
BBE_Original: And there came to him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying to him, Master, will you give us whatever may be our request?

ASV_Original: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
ASV_Paraphrased: what do you want me to do for you?
BBE_Original: And he said to them, What would you have me do for you?

ASV_Original: And they said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy glory.
ASV_Paraphrased: Grant us that we may sit down, one on the right and one on the left, in your glory.
BBE_Original: And they said to him, Let us be seated, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your glory.

ASV_Original: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup that I drink? or to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus said, You don't know what you're asking. Can I drink the cup that I drink?
BBE_Original: But Jesus said to them, You have no knowledge of what you are saying. Are you able to take of my cup? or to undergo the baptism which I am to undergo?

ASV_Original: And they said unto him, We are able. And Jesus said unto them, The cup that I drink ye shall drink; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
ASV_Paraphrased: and Jesus said to them, I drink the cup, and you drink the cup, and I'll drink with you.
BBE_Original: And they said to him, We are able. And Jesus said to them, You will take of the cup from which I take; and the baptism which I am about to undergo you will undergo:

ASV_Original: but to sit on my right hand or on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for them for whom it hath been prepared.
ASV_Paraphrased: it is not mine to give, but it's for them who have prepared it.
BBE_Original: But to be seated at my right hand or at my left is not for me to give: but it is for those for whom it has been made ready.

ASV_Original: And when the ten heard it, they began to be moved with indignation concerning James and John.
ASV_Paraphrased: when they heard it, they began to be angry with James and John.
BBE_Original: And hearing this, the ten became very angry with James and John.

ASV_Original: And Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they who are accounted to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them; and their great ones exercise authority over them.
ASV_Paraphrased: he called them, and said to them, They who are considered to be the rulers of the Gentiles, they rule over them.
BBE_Original: And Jesus made them come to him, and said to them, You see that those who are made rulers over the Gentiles are lords over them, and their great ones have authority over them.

ASV_Original: But it is not so among you: but whosoever would become great among you, shall be your minister;
ASV_Paraphrased: but among you, it's not so much about who will be great, but who will be your minister.
BBE_Original: But it is not so among you: but whoever has a desire to become great among you, let him be your servant:

ASV_Original: and whosoever would be first among you, shall be servant of all.
ASV_Paraphrased: whoever's first to be, he will be servant to all.
BBE_Original: And whoever has a desire to be first among you, let him be servant of all.

ASV_Original: For the Son of man also came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
ASV_Paraphrased: he came to be ministered to, but he gave his life to the ransom of many.
BBE_Original: For truly the Son of man did not come to have servants, but to be a servant, and to give his life for the salvation of men.

ASV_Original: And they come to Jericho: and as he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the way side.
ASV_Paraphrased: as he walked away from Jericho, with his disciples and a large crowd, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, sat down.
BBE_Original: And they came to Jericho: and when he was going out of Jericho, with his disciples and a great number of people, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind man, was seated by the wayside, with his hand out for money.

ASV_Original: And when he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
ASV_Paraphrased: he cried, "Jesus, you son of David, I beg you to forgive me." He began to cry, "Jesus, you son of David, I beg you."
BBE_Original: And when it came to his ears that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he gave a cry, and said, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me.

ASV_Original: And many rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was rebuked, but he was more angry, and he cried, Thou son of David, I beg you.
BBE_Original: And some of them, turning in protest, gave him an order to be quiet: but he went on crying out all the more, Son of David, have mercy on me.

ASV_Original: And Jesus stood still, and said, Call ye him. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good cheer: rise, he calleth thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus stood still, and said, Call him. And they called the blind man, saying, Good-bye.
BBE_Original: And Jesus came to a stop and said, Let him come. And crying out to the blind man, they said to him, Be comforted: come, he has sent for you.

ASV_Original: And he, casting away his garment, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
ASV_Paraphrased: he took off his robe and stood up and approached Jesus.
BBE_Original: And he, putting off his coat, got up quickly, and came to Jesus.

ASV_Original: And Jesus answered him, and said, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? And the blind man said unto him, Rabboni, that I may receive my sight.
ASV_Paraphrased: the blind man asked, and Jesus answered, What do you want me to do with you?
BBE_Original: And Jesus said to him, What would you have me do to you? And the blind man said, Master, make me able to see.

ASV_Original: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole. And straightway he received his sight, and followed him in the way.
ASV_Paraphrased: he looked straight into his face, and immediately he turned to him, and his faith was restored.
BBE_Original: And Jesus said to him, Go on your way; your faith has made you well. And straight away he was able to see, and went after him in the way.

ASV_Original: My soul is weary of my life; I will give free course to my complaint; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm tired of my life; I'm tired of my soul.
BBE_Original: My soul is tired of life; I will let my sad thoughts go free in words; my soul will make a bitter outcry.

ASV_Original: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; Show me wherefore thou contendest with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will tell you, God, don't judge me, show me wherefore you're against me.
BBE_Original: I will say to God, Do not put me down as a sinner; make clear to me what you have against me.

ASV_Original: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, That thou shouldest despise the work of thy hands, And shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
ASV_Paraphrased: that you should oppress, that you should despise your hands, and you should be happy with the advice of the devil?
BBE_Original: What profit is it to you to be cruel, to give up the work of your hands, looking kindly on the design of evil-doers?

ASV_Original: Hast thou eyes of flesh? Or seest thou as man seeth?
ASV_Paraphrased: do you see the flesh or the eyes of a man?
BBE_Original: Have you eyes of flesh, or do you see as man sees?

ASV_Original: Are thy days as the days of man, Or thy years as man's days,
ASV_Paraphrased: your days as a man, or your years as a man.
BBE_Original: Are your days as the days of man, or your years like his,

ASV_Original: That thou inquirest after mine iniquity, And searchest after my sin,
ASV_Paraphrased: you ask me about my sins, and I'm looking for my sins.
BBE_Original: That you take note of my sin, searching after my wrongdoing,

ASV_Original: Although thou knowest that I am not wicked, And there is none that can deliver out of thy hand?
ASV_Paraphrased: do you know I'm not evil, and no one can take my hand?
BBE_Original: Though you see that I am not an evil-doer; and there is no one who is able to take a man out of your hands?

ASV_Original: Thy hands have framed me and fashioned me Together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
ASV_Paraphrased: my hands are framed and shaped by my hands; yet you destroy me.
BBE_Original: Your hands made me, and I was formed by you, but then, changing your purpose, you gave me up to destruction.

ASV_Original: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast fashioned me as clay; And wilt thou bring me into dust again?
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you, will you make me like clay?
BBE_Original: O keep in mind that you made me out of earth; and will you send me back again to dust?

ASV_Original: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, And curdled me like cheese?
ASV_Paraphrased: didn't you put me in the milk, and you made me like cheese?
BBE_Original: Was I not drained out like milk, becoming hard like cheese?

ASV_Original: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews.
ASV_Paraphrased: you've made me skin and flesh and bones.
BBE_Original: By you I was clothed with skin and flesh, and joined together with bones and muscles.

ASV_Original: Thou hast granted me life and lovingkindness; And thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
ASV_Paraphrased: you gave me life and love, and your presence has preserved my soul.
BBE_Original: You have been kind to me, and your grace has been with me, and your care has kept my spirit safe.

ASV_Original: Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart; I know that this is with thee:
ASV_Paraphrased: I know it's with you: You hid it in your heart.
BBE_Original: But you kept these things in the secret of your heart; I am certain this was in your thoughts:

ASV_Original: If I sin, then thou markest me, And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
ASV_Paraphrased: then you'll see me, and you won't forgive me for my sins.
BBE_Original: That, if I did wrong, you would take note of it, and would not make me clear from sin:

ASV_Original: If I be wicked, woe unto me; And if I be righteous, yet shall I not lift up my head; Being filled with ignominy, And looking upon mine affliction.
ASV_Paraphrased: if I'm bad, I'm bad, and if I'm good, I'm good.
BBE_Original: That, if I was an evil-doer, the curse would come on me; and if I was upright, my head would not be lifted up, being full of shame and overcome with trouble.

ASV_Original: And if my head exalt itself, thou huntest me as a lion; And again thou showest thyself marvellous upon me.
ASV_Paraphrased: if my head is lifted, you're like a lion, and you're amazing to me.
BBE_Original: And that if there was cause for pride, you would go after me like a lion; and again put out your wonders against me:

ASV_Original: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, And increasest thine indignation upon me: Changes and warfare are with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: you're renewing my witnesses, and you're increasing my anger.
BBE_Original: That you would send new witnesses against me, increasing your wrath against me, and letting loose new armies on me.

ASV_Original: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me.
ASV_Paraphrased: then why did I give up the ghost, and no one saw me?
BBE_Original: Why then did you make me come out of my mother's body? It would have been better for me to have taken my last breath, and for no eye to have seen me,

ASV_Original: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
ASV_Paraphrased: I should have been carried out of the womb to the grave like I didn't even exist.
BBE_Original: And for me to have been as if I had not been; to have been taken from my mother's body straight to my last resting-place.

ASV_Original: Are not my days few? cease then, And let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not going to be a little comforted, so I'll be a little quiet, okay?
BBE_Original: Are not the days of my life small in number? Let your eyes be turned away from me, so that I may have a little pleasure,

ASV_Original: Before I go whence I shall not return, Even to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
ASV_Paraphrased: even to the dark and the dark of death, I will not return.
BBE_Original: Before I go to the place from which I will not come back, to the land where all is dark and black,

ASV_Original: The land dark as midnight, The land of the shadow of death, without any order, And where the light is as midnight.
ASV_Paraphrased: the darkness of the night, the darkness of the night, the darkness of the night, the darkness of the night, the darkness of the night.
BBE_Original: A land of thick dark, without order, where the very light is dark.

ASV_Original: I will extol thee, O Jehovah; for thou hast raised me up, And hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, for you, O Jehovah, I'm glad you raised me up, and I didn't make my enemies happy.
BBE_Original: <A Psalm. A Song at the blessing of the House. Of David.> I will give you praise and honour, O Lord, because through you I have been lifted up; you have not given my haters cause to be glad over me.

ASV_Original: O Jehovah my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, I'm crying, and you saved me.
BBE_Original: O Lord my God, I sent up my cry to you, and you have made me well.

ASV_Original: O Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol; Thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
ASV_Paraphrased: you took my soul from Sheol, and you kept me alive, so I wouldn't go to the grave.
BBE_Original: O Lord, you have made my soul come again from the underworld: you have given me life and kept me from going down among the dead.

ASV_Original: Sing praise unto Jehovah, O ye saints of his, And give thanks to his holy memorial name.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, thank you, my God, for the name of God, for the name of God's name.
BBE_Original: Make songs to the Lord, O you saints of his, and give praise to his holy name.

ASV_Original: For his anger is but for a moment; His favor is for a life-time: Weeping may tarry for the night, But joy cometh in the morning.
ASV_Paraphrased: the anger is only for a moment, but the favor is for a lifetime: It will be a moment, but joy will come in the morning.
BBE_Original: For his wrath is only for a minute; in his grace there is life; weeping may be for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

ASV_Original: As for me, I said in my prosperity, I shall never be moved.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've always said I'm not going to move, and I'm still saying it.
BBE_Original: When things went well for me I said, I will never be moved.

ASV_Original: Thou, Jehovah, of thy favor hadst made my mountain to stand strong: Thou didst hide thy face; I was troubled.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God
BBE_Original: Lord, by your grace you have kept my mountain strong: when your face was turned from me I was troubled.

ASV_Original: I cried to thee, O Jehovah; And unto Jehovah I made supplication:
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you, O God, to help me. I'm crying to you, O God.
BBE_Original: My voice went up to you, O Lord; I made my prayer to the Lord.

ASV_Original: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
ASV_Paraphrased: when I'm in the pit, will the blood be praised?
BBE_Original: What profit is there in my blood if I go down into the underworld? will the dust give you praise, or be a witness to your help?

ASV_Original: Hear, O Jehovah, and have mercy upon me: Jehovah, be thou my helper.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, God, help me, and be my help.
BBE_Original: Give ear to me, O Lord, and have mercy on me: Lord, be my helper.

ASV_Original: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing; Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
ASV_Paraphrased: you took my mourning, and you gave me joy; you took my robe, and I was happy.
BBE_Original: By you my sorrow is turned into dancing; you have taken away my clothing of grief, and given me robes of joy;

ASV_Original: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O Jehovah my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, I'll thank you for my glory, and I won't be silent.
BBE_Original: So that my glory may make songs of praise to you and not be quiet. O Lord my God, I will give you praise for ever.

ASV_Original: The priests the Levites, even all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of Jehovah made by fire, and his inheritance.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priests of the Levites, even the entire tribe of Levi, will not have any part or inheritance with Israel: They will eat the sacrifices of the Lord, and they will inherit the fire.
BBE_Original: The priests, the Levites, that is, all the tribe of Levi, will have no part or heritage with Israel: their food and their heritage will be the offerings of the Lord made by fire.

ASV_Original: And they shall have no inheritance among their brethren: Jehovah is their inheritance, as he hath spoken unto them.
ASV_Paraphrased: they will not inherit the brothers, as he has told them, but they will inherit the brothers.
BBE_Original: And they will have no heritage among their countrymen: the Lord is their heritage, as he has said to them.

ASV_Original: And this shall be the priests' due from the people, from them that offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give unto the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall be paid by the people, whether they offer a sacrifice or ox or sheep, and the priest shall have both shoulders and two faces.
BBE_Original: And this is to be the priests' right: those who make an offering of a sheep or an ox are to give to the priest the top part of the leg and the two sides of the head and the stomach.

ASV_Original: The first-fruits of thy grain, of thy new wine, and of thine oil, and the first of the fleece of thy sheep, shalt thou give him.
ASV_Paraphrased: you give him the grain, the wine, the oil, the first of your sheep.
BBE_Original: And in addition you are to give him the first of your grain and wine and oil, and the first wool cut from your sheep.

ASV_Original: For Jehovah thy God hath chosen him out of all thy tribes, to stand to minister in the name of Jehovah, him and his sons for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah chose him from all your tribes, and he will serve you in the name of God, his sons.
BBE_Original: For he, and his sons after him for ever, have been marked out by the Lord your God from all your tribes, to do the work of priests in the name of the Lord.

ASV_Original: And if a Levite come from any of thy gates out of all Israel, where he sojourneth, and come with all the desire of his soul unto the place which Jehovah shall choose;
ASV_Paraphrased: if any of your gates are from all Israel, where he's going to go, and he wants to go to the place where God chooses, he'll come with all his desire.
BBE_Original: And if a Levite, moved by a strong desire, comes from any town in all Israel where he is living to the place marked out by the Lord;

ASV_Original: then he shall minister in the name of Jehovah his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, who stand there before Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will be a minister of God's name, as all the other Levites do, who stand before God.
BBE_Original: Then he will do the work of a priest in the name of the Lord his God, with all his brothers the Levites who are there before the Lord.

ASV_Original: They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.
ASV_Paraphrased: besides the sale of his property, they have a lot of food, besides the ones that come from the sale.
BBE_Original: His food will be the same as theirs, in addition to what has come to him as the price of his property.

ASV_Original: When thou art come into the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't learn anything after the abominations of the nations you've come to.
BBE_Original: When you have come into the land which the Lord your God is giving you, do not take as your example the disgusting ways of those nations.

ASV_Original: There shall not be found with thee any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, one that useth divination, one that practiseth augury, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer,
ASV_Paraphrased: no one who makes his son or daughter to burn, one who uses magic, or an enchanter, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard, or a wizard,
BBE_Original: Let there not be seen among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter go through the fire, or anyone using secret arts, or a maker of strange sounds, or a reader of signs, or any wonder-worker,

ASV_Original: or a charmer, or a consulter with a familiar spirit, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
ASV_Paraphrased: a charmer, a wizard, a necromancer, or a wizard.
BBE_Original: Or anyone using secret force on people, or putting questions to a spirit, or having secret knowledge, or going to the dead for directions.

ASV_Original: For whosoever doeth these things is an abomination unto Jehovah: and because of these abominations Jehovah thy God doth drive them out from before thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: for whoever does this is an abomination to the Lord, and he will drive them out of the way.
BBE_Original: For all who do such things are disgusting to the Lord; and because of these disgusting things the Lord your God is driving them out before you.

ASV_Original: Thou shalt be perfect with Jehovah thy God.
BBE_Original: You are to be upright in heart before the Lord your God.

ASV_Original: For these nations, that thou shalt dispossess, hearken unto them that practise augury, and unto diviners; but as for thee, Jehovah thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.
ASV_Paraphrased: for these nations, you will be able to do it, but as for you, God has not suffered you to do so.
BBE_Original: For these nations, whose land you are taking, give attention to readers of signs and to those using secret arts: but the Lord your God will not let you do so.

ASV_Original: Jehovah thy God will raise up unto thee a prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall hearken;
ASV_Paraphrased: you will be like me, like your brothers, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like me, like
BBE_Original: The Lord your God will give you a prophet from among your people, like me; you will give ear to him;

ASV_Original: according to all that thou desiredst of Jehovah thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of Jehovah my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I die not.
ASV_Paraphrased: I don't want to hear the voice of God, nor do I want to see the great fire, that I'm not dying.
BBE_Original: In answer to the request you made to the Lord your God in Horeb on the day of the great meeting, when you said, Let not the voice of the Lord my God come to my ears again, and let me not see this great fire any more, or death will overtake me.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto me, They have well said that which they have spoken.
ASV_Paraphrased: they said what they had said, and I was glad to hear it.
BBE_Original: Then the Lord said to me, What they have said is well said.

ASV_Original: I will raise them up a prophet from among their brethren, like unto thee; and I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak unto them all that I shall command him.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will raise them up like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you, like you,
BBE_Original: I will give them a prophet from among themselves, like you, and I will put my words in his mouth, and he will say to them whatever I give him orders to say.

ASV_Original: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will demand it from him who does not listen to my words, and I will demand it from him who does not listen to my name.
BBE_Original: And whoever does not give ear to my words which he will say in my name, will be responsible to me.

ASV_Original: But the prophet, that shall speak a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die.
ASV_Paraphrased: the prophet, the same prophet, who speaks in my name, I have not commanded him to say, or he will speak in the name of another god.
BBE_Original: But the prophet who takes it on himself to say words in my name which I have not given him orders to say, or who says anything in the name of other gods, will come to his death.

ASV_Original: And if thou say in thy heart, How shall we know the word which Jehovah hath not spoken?
ASV_Paraphrased: if you're saying, How do we know the word that Jehovah hasn't spoken?
BBE_Original: And if you say in your hearts, How are we to be certain that the word does not come from the Lord?

ASV_Original: when a prophet speaketh in the name of Jehovah, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the thing which Jehovah hath not spoken: the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously, thou shalt not be afraid of him.
ASV_Paraphrased: if the prophet speaks in the name of God, if it doesn't happen, it's not a matter of God's name, but the prophet's name.
BBE_Original: When a prophet makes a statement in the name of the Lord, if what he says does not take place and his words do not come true, then his word is not the word of the Lord: the words of the prophet were said in the pride of his heart, and you are to have no fear of him.

ASV_Original: And the man knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man with the help of Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: she knew Eve's wife, and she had a baby with her husband, and she said, I've got a guy from God.
BBE_Original: And the man had connection with Eve his wife, and she became with child and gave birth to Cain, and said, I have got a man from the Lord.

ASV_Original: And again she bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
ASV_Paraphrased: Abel was a shepherd, but Cain was a farmer.
BBE_Original: Then again she became with child and gave birth to Abel, his brother. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a farmer.

ASV_Original: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: then, as soon as the time came, the fruit of the ground was brought to the altar of Jehovah.
BBE_Original: And after a time, Cain gave to the Lord an offering of the fruits of the earth.

ASV_Original: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And Jehovah had respect unto Abel and to his offering:
ASV_Paraphrased: Abel, too, took the firstlings of his flock and fat of them. And Jehovah was pleased with Abel's offering.
BBE_Original: And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat. And the Lord was pleased with Abel's offering;

ASV_Original: but unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain was furious, and his face fell.   And he looked at the countenance of the countenance of the countenance.
BBE_Original: But in Cain and his offering he had no pleasure. And Cain was angry and his face became sad.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
ASV_Paraphrased: why are you angry? Why are you angry?
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Cain, Why are you angry? and why is your face sad?

ASV_Original: If thou doest well, shall it not be lifted up? and if thou doest not well, sin coucheth at the door; and unto thee shall be its desire; but do thou rule over it.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you do well, it's not going to be lifted, and if you don't, sin's on the door.
BBE_Original: If you do well, will you not have honour? and if you do wrong, sin is waiting at the door, desiring to have you, but do not let it be your master.

ASV_Original: And Cain told Abel his brother. And it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
ASV_Paraphrased: when they were in the field, Cain rose against Abel, and he killed him.
BBE_Original: And Cain said to his brother, Let us go into the field: and when they were in the field, Cain made an attack on his brother Abel and put him to death.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: am I my brother's keeper?
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain answered, Where's my brother Abel? And he said, I don't know.
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Cain, Where is your brother Abel? And he said, I have no idea: am I my brother's keeper?

ASV_Original: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's crying out from the ground, "What have you done?" He's crying out of the ground, "What did you do?"
BBE_Original: And he said, What have you done? the voice of your brother's blood is crying to me from the earth.

ASV_Original: And now cursed art thou from the ground, which hath opened its mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
ASV_Paraphrased: the blood of your brother's hand is now in your mouth, which is open to your brother's blood.
BBE_Original: And now you are cursed from the earth, whose mouth is open to take your brother's blood from your hand;

ASV_Original: when thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee its strength; a fugitive and a wanderer shalt thou be in the earth.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the land until the ground is dry.
BBE_Original: No longer will the earth give you her fruit as the reward of your work; you will be a wanderer in flight over the earth.

ASV_Original: And Cain said unto Jehovah, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain said, "I'm more than I can bear."
BBE_Original: And Cain said, My punishment is greater than my strength.

ASV_Original: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the ground; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth; and it will come to pass, that whosoever findeth me will slay me.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm out of the ground today, and I'm hiding in the ground, and I'm a fugitive and a vagabond in the world.
BBE_Original: You have sent me out this day from the face of the earth and from before your face; I will be a wanderer in flight over the earth, and whoever sees me will put me to death.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And Jehovah appointed a sign for Cain, lest any finding him should smite him.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah said, therefore, whoever kills Cain, he will be avenged by sevenfold. And he appointed a sign for Cain, so that no one would find him.
BBE_Original: And the Lord said, Truly, if Cain is put to death, seven lives will be taken for his. And the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one might put him to death.

ASV_Original: And Cain went out from the presence of Jehovah, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain went out of the presence of God, and he settled in the east of Eden.
BBE_Original: And Cain went away from before the face of the Lord, and made his living-place in the land of Nod on the east of Eden.

ASV_Original: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain knew his wife, and she had given birth to Enoch, and he built a city, and called the name of the city, Enoch.
BBE_Original: And Cain had connection with his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Enoch: and he made a town, and gave the town the name of Enoch after his son.

ASV_Original: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael; and Mehujael begat Methushael; and Methushael begat Lamech.
ASV_Paraphrased: Enoch was born to Irad, and Irad's son Mehujael; and Mehujael's son Methushael.
BBE_Original: And Enoch had a son Irad: and Irad became the father of Mehujael: and Mehujael became the father of Methushael: and Methushael became the father of Lamech.

ASV_Original: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the name of the one was Adah, the other Zillah.
BBE_Original: And Lamech had two wives; the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

ASV_Original: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents and have cattle.
ASV_Paraphrased: Adah was a father of those who live in tents and have cattle.
BBE_Original: And Adah gave birth to Jabal: he was the father of such as are living in tents and keep cattle.

ASV_Original: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and pipe.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jubal's name was Jubal: He was the father of all the harpists and pipe.
BBE_Original: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all players on instruments of music.

ASV_Original: And Zillah, she also bare Tubal-cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
ASV_Paraphrased: she was also a sister of Naamah, the forger of all brass and iron: and the sister of Naamah was Zillah.
BBE_Original: And Zillah gave birth to Tubal-cain, who is the father of every maker of cutting instruments of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.

ASV_Original: And Lamech said unto his wives: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; Ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: For I have slain a man for wounding me, And a young man for bruising me:
ASV_Paraphrased: Adah and Zillah, hear me, women of Lamech, hearken to my words:
BBE_Original: And Lamech said to his wives, Adah and Zillah, give ear to my voice; you wives of Lamech, give attention to my words, for I would put a man to death for a wound, and a young man for a blow;

ASV_Original: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, Truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
ASV_Paraphrased: Cain will be avenged seven times, Truly Lamech seventy-seven times.
BBE_Original: If seven lives are to be taken as punishment for Cain's death, seventy-seven will be taken for Lamech's.

ASV_Original: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For, said she, God hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel; for Cain slew him.
ASV_Paraphrased: Adam knew his wife again, and she was carrying a son, and she called him Seth: For, she said, God has appointed me a son, not Abel.
BBE_Original: And Adam had connection with his wife again, and she gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name of Seth: for she said, God has given me another seed in place of Abel, whom Cain put to death.

ASV_Original: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enosh. Then began men to call upon the name of Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: then Enosh was born to Seth, and he called him Enosh.
BBE_Original: And Seth had a son, and he gave him the name of Enosh: at this time men first made use of the name of the Lord in worship.

ASV_Original: Now I make known unto you brethren, the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye received, wherein also ye stand,
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, the gospel I've taught you, which you've taken, which you've taken, which you've taken, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took, which you took
BBE_Original: Now I am going to make clear to you, my brothers, what the good news was which I gave to you, and which you took, and on which your faith is based,

ASV_Original: by which also ye are saved, if ye hold fast the word which I preached unto you, except ye believed in vain.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you don't believe me, you'll be saved, if you keep your word.
BBE_Original: By which you have salvation; that is to say, the form in which it was given to you, if it is fixed in your minds, and if your faith in it is not without effect.

ASV_Original: For I delivered unto you first of all that which also I received: that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;
ASV_Paraphrased: I've been telling you the first thing I got: That Jesus died for our sins in the scriptures.
BBE_Original: For I gave to you first of all what was handed down to me, how Christ underwent death for our sins, as it says in the Writings;

ASV_Original: and that he was buried; and that he hath been raised on the third day according to the scriptures;
ASV_Paraphrased: on the third day he was buried; and he was raised on the third day;
BBE_Original: And he was put in the place of the dead; and on the third day he came back from the dead, as it says in the Writings;

ASV_Original: and that he appeared to Cephas; then to the twelve;
ASV_Paraphrased: then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the twelve; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the 12; then to the
BBE_Original: And he was seen by Cephas; then by the twelve;

ASV_Original: then he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain until now, but some are fallen asleep;
ASV_Paraphrased: he appeared in the five hundred brethren, and the majority of them remained asleep, but some fell asleep;
BBE_Original: Then by more than five hundred brothers at the same time, most of whom are still living, but some are sleeping;

ASV_Original: then he appeared to James; then to all the apostles;
ASV_Paraphrased: then he appeared to the whole of the apostles; then to the whole of the church.
BBE_Original: Then he was seen by James; then by all the Apostles.

ASV_Original: and last of all, as to the child untimely born, he appeared to me also.
ASV_Paraphrased: he looked at me with a look that seemed to be the last of all.
BBE_Original: And last of all, as by one whose birth was out of the right time, he was seen by me.

ASV_Original: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not an apostle, but I'm the least of the apostles, so I'm not called an apostle.
BBE_Original: For I am the least of the Apostles, having no right to be named an Apostle, because of my cruel attacks on the church of God.

ASV_Original: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not found vain; but I labored more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm what I am, and God's grace that I've been given, I've worked harder than they've done.
BBE_Original: But by the grace of God, I am what I am: and his grace which was given to me has not been for nothing; for I did more work than all of them; though not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

ASV_Original: Whether then it be I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.
ASV_Paraphrased: then I'm with them, so they believe it, and so they believe it.
BBE_Original: If then it is I who am the preacher, or they, this is our word, and to this you have given your faith.

ASV_Original: Now if Christ is preached that he hath been raised from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?
ASV_Paraphrased: how do you think some of you think there's no resurrection of the dead?
BBE_Original: Now if the good news says that Christ came back from the dead, how do some of you say that there is no coming back from the dead?

ASV_Original: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither hath Christ been raised:
ASV_Paraphrased: if the dead don't rise, neither will the dead.
BBE_Original: But if there is no coming back from the dead, then Christ has not come back from the dead:

ASV_Original: and if Christ hath not been raised, then is our preaching vain, your faith also is vain.
ASV_Paraphrased: if God doesn't come, then we're just wasting our time, your faith is useless.
BBE_Original: And if Christ did not come again from the dead, then our good news and your faith in it are of no effect.

ASV_Original: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we witnessed of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead are not raised.
ASV_Paraphrased: we have seen God raise up the dead, and we have seen the dead rise, if so be that the dead are not raised.
BBE_Original: Yes, and we are seen to be false witnesses of God; because we gave witness of God that by his power Christ came again from the dead: which is not true if there is no coming back from the dead.

ASV_Original: For if the dead are not raised, neither hath Christ been raised:
ASV_Paraphrased: if the dead don't come, neither will the Lord be raised:
BBE_Original: For if it is not possible for the dead to come to life again, then Christ has not come to life again:

ASV_Original: and if Christ hath not been raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.
ASV_Paraphrased: if the Lord doesn't come, your faith is useless; you're still in the sin.
BBE_Original: And if that is so, your faith is of no effect; you are still in your sins.

ASV_Original: Then they also that are fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
ASV_Paraphrased: they fell asleep in the name of God, and they died.
BBE_Original: And, in addition, the dead in Christ have gone to destruction.

ASV_Original: If we have only hoped in Christ in this life, we are of all men most pitiable.
ASV_Paraphrased: we are the most pitiful of all men in this life, hoping for the salvation of God.
BBE_Original: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most unhappy.

ASV_Original: But now hath Christ been raised from the dead, the first-fruits of them that are asleep.
ASV_Paraphrased: the first fruits of the dead are now rising.
BBE_Original: But now Christ has truly come back from the dead, the first-fruits of those who are sleeping.

ASV_Original: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
ASV_Paraphrased: by man's death, the dead came back to life.
BBE_Original: For as by man came death, so by man there is a coming back from the dead.

ASV_Original: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.
ASV_Paraphrased: Adam's death will be the death of all of us, and all of us will be alive.
BBE_Original: For as in Adam death comes to all, so in Christ will all come back to life.

ASV_Original: But each in his own order: Christ the first-fruits; then they that are Christ's, at his coming.
ASV_Paraphrased: Christ's first fruits; then they are Christ's, when they come.
BBE_Original: But every man in his right order: Christ the first-fruits; then those who are Christ's at his coming.

ASV_Original: Then cometh the end, when he shall deliver up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have abolished all rule and all authority and power.
ASV_Paraphrased: when he delivers the kingdom to God, even the Father, when he will have abolished all authority and power.
BBE_Original: Then comes the end, when he will give up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he will have put an end to all rule and to all authority and power.

ASV_Original: For he must reign, till he hath put all his enemies under his feet.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must be ruled until he's got all his enemies under his feet.
BBE_Original: For his rule will go on till he has put all those who are against him under his feet.

ASV_Original: The last enemy that shall be abolished is death.
ASV_Paraphrased: death is the last enemy to be destroyed.
BBE_Original: The last power to come to an end is death.

ASV_Original: For, He put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he saith, All things are put in subjection, it is evident that he is excepted who did subject all things unto him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said, All things are subject to him, but when he says, All things are subject to him, it is clear that he is excluded from the subject.
BBE_Original: For, as it says, He has put all things under his feet. But when he says, All things are put under him, it is clear that it is not said about him who put all things under him.

ASV_Original: And when all things have been subjected unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subjected to him that did subject all things unto him, that God may be all in all.
ASV_Paraphrased: then the Son himself will be subject to the one who has subjected everything to him, that God may be all in all.
BBE_Original: And when all things have been put under him, then will the Son himself be under him who put all things under him, so that God may be all in all.

ASV_Original: Else what shall they do that are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why then are they baptized for them?
ASV_Paraphrased: why are they baptized for the dead? If they don't raise the dead, why are they baptized?
BBE_Original: Again, what will they do who are given baptism for the dead? if the dead do not come back at all, why are people given baptism for them?

ASV_Original: why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?
ASV_Paraphrased: every hour of the day is in danger of being endangered?
BBE_Original: And why are we in danger every hour?

ASV_Original: I protest by that glorying in you, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm dying daily, my brothers, for the glory of God, who is in Christ Jesus.
BBE_Original: Yes, truly, by your pride in me, my brothers in Christ Jesus our Lord, my life is one long death.

ASV_Original: If after the manner of men I fought with beasts at Ephesus, what doth it profit me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for to-morrow we die.
ASV_Paraphrased: if the dead don't come, we'll eat and drink, for tomorrow we'll be dead.
BBE_Original: If, after the way of men, I was fighting with beasts at Ephesus, what profit is it to me? If the dead do not come to life again, let us take our pleasure in feasting, for tomorrow we come to an end.

ASV_Original: Be not deceived: Evil companionships corrupt good morals.
ASV_Paraphrased: don't be fooled: Bad companionship corrupts morality.
BBE_Original: Do not be tricked by false words: evil company does damage to good behaviour.

ASV_Original: Awake to soberness righteously, and sin not; for some have no knowledge of God: I speak this to move you to shame.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling you, I'm telling
BBE_Original: Be awake to righteousness and keep yourselves from sin; for some have no knowledge of God: I say this to put you to shame.

ASV_Original: But some one will say, How are the dead raised? and with what manner of body do they come?
ASV_Paraphrased: how do they raise the dead?...................................... how do they raise the dead?
BBE_Original: But someone will say, How do the dead come back? and with what sort of body do they come?

ASV_Original: Thou foolish one, that which thou thyself sowest is not quickened except it die:
ASV_Paraphrased: you fool, the thing you've done is not quickened, except it's dead.
BBE_Original: Foolish man, it is necessary for the seed which you put into the earth to undergo death in order that it may come to life again:

ASV_Original: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but a bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other kind;
ASV_Paraphrased: you don't sow the body, but the grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain, or grain
BBE_Original: And when you put it into the earth, you do not put in the body which it will be, but only the seed, of grain or some other sort of plant;

ASV_Original: but God giveth it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.
ASV_Paraphrased: God gives each seed a body, and each seed is a body.
BBE_Original: But God gives it a body, as it is pleasing to him, and to every seed its special body.

ASV_Original: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one flesh of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another flesh of birds, and another of fishes.
ASV_Paraphrased: there's a man's body, and a man's body is a man's body, and a man's body is a man's body.
BBE_Original: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one flesh of men, another of beasts, another of birds, and another of fishes.

ASV_Original: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
ASV_Paraphrased: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
BBE_Original: And there are bodies of heaven and bodies of earth, but the glory of the one is different from that of the other.

ASV_Original: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differeth from another star in glory.
ASV_Paraphrased: the sun shines, the moon shines, the stars shine, the other stars shine.
BBE_Original: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for the glory of one star is different from that of another.

ASV_Original: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:
ASV_Paraphrased: it is also the resurrection of the dead, which is corruptible, and raises incorruptible:
BBE_Original: So is it with the coming back from the dead. It is planted in death; it comes again in life:

ASV_Original: it is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
ASV_Paraphrased: it is a shame; it is a shame; it is a shame; it is a shame; it is a shame.
BBE_Original: It is planted in shame; it comes again in glory: feeble when it is planted, it comes again in power:

ASV_Original: it is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.
ASV_Paraphrased: there is a natural body, and there's a spiritual body.
BBE_Original: It is planted a natural body; it comes again as a body of the spirit. If there is a natural body, there is equally a body of the spirit.

ASV_Original: So also it is written, The first man Adam became a living soul. The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.
ASV_Paraphrased: Adam became a living soul, and the last Adam became a living soul.
BBE_Original: And so it is said, The first man Adam was a living soul. The last Adam is a life-giving spirit.

ASV_Original: Howbeit that is not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; then that which is spiritual.
ASV_Paraphrased: but that is not the first thing, but the natural thing; then it's spiritual.
BBE_Original: But that which is natural comes before that which is of the spirit.

ASV_Original: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is of heaven.
ASV_Paraphrased: the first man is on Earth, the second man in heaven.
BBE_Original: The first man is from the earth, and of the earth: the second man is from heaven.

ASV_Original: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
ASV_Paraphrased: and as is the heavenly, so is the heavenly: and as is the earth, so is the earth.
BBE_Original: Those who are of the earth are like the man who was from the earth: and those who are of heaven are like the one from heaven.

ASV_Original: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
ASV_Paraphrased: we will also bear the image of the heavenly, as we have borne the image of the earth.
BBE_Original: And in the same way as we have taken on us the image of the man from the earth, so we will take on us the image of the one from heaven.

ASV_Original: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
ASV_Paraphrased: brothers, the kingdom of God cannot be inherited by blood and flesh.
BBE_Original: Now I say this, my brothers, that it is not possible for flesh and blood to have a part in the kingdom of God; and death may not have a part in life.

ASV_Original: Behold, I tell you a mystery: We all shall not sleep, but we shall all be changed,
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, I'm telling you a secret: We're all going to sleep, but we'll all change.
BBE_Original: See, I am giving you the revelation of a secret: we will not all come to the sleep of death, but we will all be changed.

ASV_Original: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
ASV_Paraphrased: in the last trump, the trumpet sounded, and the dead were raised, and we were changed.
BBE_Original: In a second, in the shutting of an eye, at the sound of the last horn: for at that sound the dead will come again, free for ever from the power of death, and we will be changed.

ASV_Original: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
ASV_Paraphrased: corruption must be put on incorruption, and immortality must be achieved.
BBE_Original: For this body which comes to destruction will be made free from the power of death, and the man who is under the power of death will put on eternal life.

ASV_Original: But when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
ASV_Paraphrased: then the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory, will be fulfilled by the saying, Death is swallowed up in victory.
BBE_Original: But when this has taken place, then that which was said in the Writings will come true, Death is overcome by life.

ASV_Original: O death, where is thy victory? O death, where is thy sting?
ASV_Paraphrased: death, where's your victory? O death, where's your death?
BBE_Original: O death, where is your power? O death, where are your pains?

ASV_Original: The sting of death is sin; and the power of sin is the law:
ASV_Paraphrased: death is sin, and sin is the law.
BBE_Original: The pain of death is sin; and the power of sin is the law:

ASV_Original: but thanks be to God, who giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
ASV_Paraphrased: thanks to God, who gave us the victory over the Lord Jesus Christ.
BBE_Original: But praise be to God who gives us strength to overcome through our Lord Jesus Christ.

ASV_Original: Wherefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labor is not vain in the Lord.
ASV_Paraphrased: forasmuch as you know that your work is not vain, my dear brothers, be steadfast, unyielding, always in the service of God.
BBE_Original: For this cause, my dear brothers, be strong in purpose and unmoved, ever giving yourselves to the work of the Lord, because you are certain that your work is not without effect in the Lord.

ASV_Original: O God, thou art my God; earnestly will I seek thee: My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee, In a dry and weary land, where no water is.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, you're my God, I'm looking for you, my soul is thirsty, my body is tired, and I'm thirsty.
BBE_Original: <A Psalm. Of David. When he was in the waste land of Judah.> O God, you are my God; early will I make my search for you: my soul is dry for need of you, my flesh is wasted with desire for you, as a dry and burning land where no water is;

ASV_Original: So have I looked upon thee in the sanctuary, To see thy power and thy glory.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've seen your power and glory in the sanctuary.
BBE_Original: To see your power and your glory, as I have seen you in the holy place.

ASV_Original: Because thy lovingkindness is better than life, My lips shall praise thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will praise your lovingkindness, My lips will be happy.
BBE_Original: Because your mercy is better than life, my lips will give you praise.

ASV_Original: So will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll bless you when I'm alive: I'll lift my hand in your name.
BBE_Original: So will I go on blessing you all my life, lifting up my hands in your name.

ASV_Original: My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; And my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips;
ASV_Paraphrased: as with marrow and fat, my soul will be satisfied with my mouth;
BBE_Original: My soul will be comforted, as with good food; and my mouth will give you praise with songs of joy;

ASV_Original: When I remember thee upon my bed, And meditate on thee in the night-watches.
ASV_Paraphrased: when I'm on my bed, I'm thinking of you in the night.
BBE_Original: When the memory of you comes to me on my bed, and when I give thought to you in the night-time.

ASV_Original: For thou hast been my help, And in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm glad you're my help, and I'm glad you're in the shadow of your wings.
BBE_Original: Because you have been my help, I will have joy in the shade of your wings.

ASV_Original: My soul followeth hard after thee: Thy right hand upholdeth me.
ASV_Paraphrased: your soul is hard to hold: Your right hand is on me.
BBE_Original: My soul keeps ever near you: your right hand is my support.

ASV_Original: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, Shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
ASV_Paraphrased: those who seek my soul, they will go to the lower world.
BBE_Original: But those whose desire is my soul's destruction will go down to the lower parts of the earth.

ASV_Original: They shall be given over to the power of the sword: They shall be a portion for foxes.
ASV_Paraphrased: they will be given to the sword: They will be the sword of the fox.
BBE_Original: They will be cut off by the sword; they will be food for foxes.

ASV_Original: But the king shall rejoice in God: Every one that sweareth by him shall glory; For the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
ASV_Paraphrased: the king will be happy with God: Every one who is happy to be with him will be happy.
BBE_Original: But the king will have joy in God; everyone who takes an oath by him will have cause for pride; but the false mouth will be stopped.

ASV_Original: My little children, these things write I unto you that ye may not sin. And if any man sin, we have an Advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:
ASV_Paraphrased: if any man sins, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.
BBE_Original: My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may be without sin. And if any man is a sinner, we have a friend and helper with the Father, Jesus Christ, the upright one:

ASV_Original: and he is the propitiation for our sins; and not for ours only, but also for the whole world.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's a propitiation for our sins, not just for us, but for the whole world.
BBE_Original: He is the offering for our sins; and not for ours only, but for all the world.

ASV_Original: And hereby we know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.
ASV_Paraphrased: we know him if we keep his commandments.
BBE_Original: And by this we may be certain that we have knowledge of him, if we keep his laws.

ASV_Original: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him;
ASV_Paraphrased: he says I know him, and I'm not telling him, and the truth is not in him.
BBE_Original: The man who says, I have knowledge of him, and does not keep his laws, is false, and there is nothing true in him:

ASV_Original: but whoso keepeth his word, in him verily hath the love of God been perfected. Hereby we know that we are in him:
ASV_Paraphrased: we know that we're in him: He's got a love for God.
BBE_Original: But in every man who keeps his word, the love of God is made complete. By this we may be certain that we are in him:

ASV_Original: he that saith he abideth in him ought himself also to walk even as he walked.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must walk as he walks, and he must walk as he walks.
BBE_Original: He who says that he is living in him, will do as he did.

ASV_Original: Beloved, no new commandment write I unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning: the old commandment is the word which ye heard.
ASV_Paraphrased: I don't write you a new commandment, but an old commandment that you've heard from the beginning: The old commandment is the word you've heard.
BBE_Original: My loved ones, I do not give you a new law, but an old law which you had from the first; this old law is the word which came to your ears.

ASV_Original: Again, a new commandment write I unto you, which thing is true in him and in you; because the darkness is passing away, and the true light already shineth.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will write you a new commandment, which is true for you and me; because the darkness is fading, and the light is shining.
BBE_Original: Again, I give you a new law, which is true in him and in you; for the night is near its end and the true light is even now shining out.

ASV_Original: He that saith he is in the light and hateth his brother, is in the darkness even until now.
ASV_Paraphrased: he says he's in the light and he's looking at his brother, and he's in the dark.
BBE_Original: He who says that he is in the light, and has hate in his heart for his brother, is still in the dark.

ASV_Original: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is no occasion of stumbling in him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he loves his brother, and he doesn't have to worry about him.
BBE_Original: He who has love for his brother is in the light, and there is no cause of error in him.

ASV_Original: But he that hateth his brother is in the darkness, and walketh in the darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because the darkness hath blinded his eyes.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's in the dark, and he's walking in the dark, and he doesn't know where he's going.
BBE_Original: But he who has hate for his brother is in the dark, walking in the dark with no knowledge of where he is going, unable to see because of the dark.

ASV_Original: I write unto you, my little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.
ASV_Paraphrased: for the sake of your name, my little children, I write you.
BBE_Original: I am writing to you, my children, because you have forgiveness of sins through his name.

ASV_Original: I write unto you, fathers, because ye know him who is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because ye have overcome the evil one. I have written unto you, little children, because ye know the Father.
ASV_Paraphrased: I write to you, young men, because you've overcome the evil one. I've written to you, little kids, because you've overcome the evil one.
BBE_Original: I am writing to you, fathers, because you have knowledge of him who was from the first. I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the Evil One. I have sent a letter to you, children, because you have knowledge of the Father.

ASV_Original: I have written unto you, fathers, because ye know him who is from the beginning. I have written unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the evil one.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have written to you, young men, because you know who's from the beginning.
BBE_Original: I have sent a letter to you, fathers, because you have knowledge of him who was from the first. I have sent a letter to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God is in you, and because you have overcome the Evil One.

ASV_Original: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.
ASV_Paraphrased: if anyone loves the world, he doesn't love the world.
BBE_Original: Have no love for the world or for the things which are in the world. If any man has love for the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

ASV_Original: For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh and the lust of the eyes and the vainglory of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.
ASV_Paraphrased: the lust of the flesh and the lust of the eyes and the glory of life are not of the Father, but of the world.
BBE_Original: Because everything in the world, the desire of the flesh, the desire of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father but of the world.

ASV_Original: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: the world is dying, and the lust is dying, but the one who does it will remain forever.
BBE_Original: And the world and its desires is coming to an end: but he who does God's pleasure is living for ever.

ASV_Original: Little children, it is the last hour: and as ye heard that antichrist cometh, even now have there arisen many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last hour.
ASV_Paraphrased: it's the last hour, and the antichrist is coming, so we know it's the last hour.
BBE_Original: Little children, it is the last hour; and as you were given word that the Antichrist would come, so now a number of Antichrists have come to you; and by this we are certain that it is the last hour.

ASV_Original: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they all are not of us.
ASV_Paraphrased: they came out, but they didn't belong to us, for if they were of us, they would have continued to go.
BBE_Original: They went out from us but they were not of us; if they had been of us they would still be with us: but they went out from us so that it might be made clear that they were not of us.

ASV_Original: And ye have an anointing from the Holy One, and ye know all things.
ASV_Paraphrased: you have a holy one, and you know everything.
BBE_Original: And you have the Spirit from the Holy One and you all have knowledge.

ASV_Original: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and because no lie is of the truth.
ASV_Paraphrased: you know, I didn't write it because you don't know the truth, but because you know it, and I'm not lying.
BBE_Original: I have not sent you this letter because you have no knowledge of what is true, but because you have knowledge, and because that which is false has nothing in common with that which is true.

ASV_Original: Who is the liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ? This is the antichrist, even he that denieth the Father and the Son.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's a liar, but he denies the truth of the Son and the Father.
BBE_Original: Who is false but he who says that Jesus is not the Christ? He is the Antichrist who has no belief in the Father or the Son.

ASV_Original: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father: he that confesseth the Son hath the Father also.
ASV_Paraphrased: whoever denies the Son, he doesn't have the Father. He's got the Father too.
BBE_Original: He who has no belief in the Son has not the Father: he who makes clear his belief in the Son has the Father.

ASV_Original: As for you, let that abide in you which ye heard from the beginning. If that which ye heard from the beginning abide in you, ye also shall abide in the Son, and in the Father.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you hear from the beginning, you will also be in the Son and in the Father.
BBE_Original: But as for you, keep in your hearts the things which were made clear to you from the first. If you keep these things in your hearts you will be kept in the Father and the Son.

ASV_Original: And this is the promise which he promised us, even the life eternal.
ASV_Paraphrased: he promised us the promise of eternal life, even the life eternal.
BBE_Original: And this is the hope which he gave you, even eternal life.

ASV_Original: These things have I written unto you concerning them that would lead you astray.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've written you about things that would lead you astray.
BBE_Original: I am writing these things to you about those whose purpose is that you may be turned out of the true way.

ASV_Original: And as for you, the anointing which ye received of him abideth in you, and ye need not that any one teach you; but as his anointing teacheth you concerning all things, and is true, and is no lie, and even as it taught you, ye abide in him.
ASV_Paraphrased: as for you, the anointing that you have received from him is not to be taught, but as his anointing teacheth you, and it is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is true, and is
BBE_Original: As for you, the Spirit which he gave you is still in you, and you have no need of any teacher; but as his Spirit gives you teaching about all things, and is true and not false, so keep your hearts in him, through the teaching which he has given you.

ASV_Original: And now, my little children, abide in him; that, if he shall be manifested, we may have boldness, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.
ASV_Paraphrased: my little children, if he's shown, don't be ashamed of him, but if he's here, we can be brave, and we won't be ashamed of him.
BBE_Original: And now, my children, keep your hearts in him; so that at his revelation, we may have no fear or shame before him at his coming.

ASV_Original: If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that every one also that doeth righteousness is begotten of him.
ASV_Paraphrased: you know he's righteous, and everyone who does good is his own.
BBE_Original: If you have knowledge that he is upright, it is clear to you that everyone who does righteousness is his offspring.

ASV_Original: Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse saith, And the man who was raised on high saith, The anointed of the God of Jacob, And the sweet psalmist of Israel:
ASV_Paraphrased: the last words of David are, and the man who was raised to heaven, the holy man of Israel, and the sweet psalmist of the nation:
BBE_Original: Now these are the last words of David. David, the son of Jesse, says, the man who was lifted up on high, the man on whom the God of Jacob put the holy oil, the loved one of Israel's songs, says:

ASV_Original: The Spirit of Jehovah spake by me, And his word was upon my tongue.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Spirit of God spoke to me, and I spoke in my tongue.
BBE_Original: The spirit of the Lord had voice through me, his word was on my tongue.

ASV_Original: The God of Israel said, The Rock of Israel spake to me: One that ruleth over men righteously, That ruleth in the fear of God,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Rock of Israel spoke to me: One who rules over men, who's afraid of God, that's the one who's afraid of God.
BBE_Original: The God of Israel said, the word of the Rock of Israel came to me: When an upright king is ruling over men, when he is ruling in the fear of God,

ASV_Original: He shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, A morning without clouds, When the tender grass springeth out of the earth, Through clear shining after rain.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the sun rises, the morning is sunny, the sun is shining, and the grass is growing, and the sun is shining.
BBE_Original: It is as the light of the morning, when the sun comes up, a morning without clouds; making young grass come to life from the earth.

ASV_Original: Verily my house is not so with God; Yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, Ordered in all things, and sure: For it is all my salvation, and all my desire, Although he maketh it not to grow.
ASV_Paraphrased: but God has made me a promise, and I have promised everything, and I'm sure he's done it with me.
BBE_Original: For is not my house so with God? For he has made with me an eternal agreement, ordered in all things and certain: as for all my salvation and all my desire, will he not give it increase?
