ASV_Original: But the ungodly shall be all of them as thorns to be thrust away, Because they cannot be taken with the hand;
ASV_Paraphrased: they will all be as thorns to be cut off, because they cannot be held by the hand;
BBE_Original: But the evil-doers, all of them, will be like thorns to be pushed away, because they may not be gripped in the hand:

ASV_Original: But the man that toucheth them Must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear: And they shall be utterly burned with fire in their place.
ASV_Paraphrased: they must be armed with iron and the spear of a spear: They will burn in the fire.
BBE_Original: But anyone touching them has to be armed with iron and the rod of a spear; and they will be burned with fire, every one of them.

ASV_Original: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite, against eight hundred slain at one time.
ASV_Paraphrased: the names of the great men who were David's: Josheb-basshebeth a Tahchemonite, the chief of the captains; the same was Adino, the Eznite, against the eight hundred.
BBE_Original: These are the names of David's men of war: Ishbaal the Hachmonite, chief of the three; his axe was lifted up against eight hundred put to death at one time.

ASV_Original: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodai the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the Philistines gathered together to battle, the men of Israel were gone, and the men of Israel were gone, and the men of Israel were gone, and the men of Israel were gone.
BBE_Original: After him was Eleazar, the son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three great fighters, who was with David in Pas-dammim when the Philistines came together there for the fight; and when the men of Israel had gone in flight,

ASV_Original: He arose, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto the sword; and Jehovah wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to take spoil.
ASV_Paraphrased: the day of the battle was a great victory, and the people returned to the battle only to be defeated.
BBE_Original: He was with David and went on fighting the Philistines till his hand became tired and stiff from gripping his sword: and that day the Lord gave a great salvation, and the people came back after him only to take the goods of the Philistines.

ASV_Original: And after him was Shammah the son of Agee a Hararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.
ASV_Paraphrased: then Shammah, the son of Agee, was a Hararite, and the people fled from the Philistines.
BBE_Original: After him was Shammah, the son of Ela the Hararite. And the Philistines came together in Lehi, where there was a bit of land full of seed; and the people went in flight from the Philistines.

ASV_Original: But he stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and Jehovah wrought a great victory.
ASV_Paraphrased: he stood in the middle of the plot, defended it, and killed the Philistians; and Jehovah was victorious.
BBE_Original: But he kept his place in the middle of the bit of land, and kept back their attack and overcame the Philistines: and the Lord gave a great salvation.

ASV_Original: And three of the thirty chief men went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
ASV_Paraphrased: the three men who had fallen were taken to the cave of Adullam by the Philistines, and the troops of the Philistians were in the valley of Rephaim.
BBE_Original: And three of the thirty went down at the start of the grain-cutting, and they came to David at the strong place of Adullam; and the band of Philistines had taken up their position in the valley of Rephaim.

ASV_Original: And David was then in the stronghold; and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.
ASV_Paraphrased: then David was in the stronghold, and the Philistians were in Beth-lehem.
BBE_Original: And at that time David had taken cover in the strong place, and an armed force of the Philistines was in Beth-lehem.

ASV_Original: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!
ASV_Paraphrased: I'd like to drink water from Beth-lehem, which is at the gate!
BBE_Original: And David, moved by a strong desire, said, If only someone would give me a drink of water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem, by the doorway into the town!

ASV_Original: And the three mighty men brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the three mighty men, who were in the gate, and the water was flowing out of the well, and David took it, and took it to David:
BBE_Original: And the three men, forcing their way through the Philistine army, got water from the water-hole of Beth-lehem, by the doorway into the town, and took it back to David: but he would not take it, but, draining it out, made an offering of it to the Lord.

ASV_Original: And he said, Be it far from me, O Jehovah, that I should do this: shall I drink the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.
ASV_Paraphrased: then he said, Be it far from me, O Jehovah, that I should have done it: Would I drink the blood of the men who were in danger?
BBE_Original: And he said, Far be it from me, O Lord, to do this; how may I take as my drink the life-blood of men who have put their lives in danger? So he would not take it. These things did the three great men of war.

ASV_Original: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.
ASV_Paraphrased: Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was the leader of the three. He raised his spear and killed them.
BBE_Original: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the thirty. He put to death three hundred with his spear, and he got for himself a name among the thirty.

ASV_Original: Was he not most honorable of the three? therefore he was made their captain: howbeit he attained not unto the first three.
ASV_Paraphrased: however, he was not the best of the three, but he was the captain of the three.
BBE_Original: Was he not the noblest of the thirty? so he was made their captain: but he was not equal to the first three.

ASV_Original: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he slew the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
ASV_Paraphrased: the two sons of Ariel, the sons of a brave man of Kabzeel, killed the lion, and he fell.
BBE_Original: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a fighting man of Kabzeel, had done great acts; he put to death the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down into a hole and put a lion to death in time of snow:

ASV_Original: And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.
ASV_Paraphrased: he killed a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man, a great man,
BBE_Original: And he made an attack on an Egyptian, a tall man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a stick, and pulling the spear out of the hands of the Egyptian, put him to death with that same spear.

ASV_Original: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.
ASV_Paraphrased: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and he had a name among the three great men.
BBE_Original: These were the acts of Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, who had a great name among the thirty men of war.

ASV_Original: He was more honorable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn't get to the first three.
BBE_Original: He was honoured over the rest of the thirty, but he was not equal to the first three. And David put him over the fighting men who kept him safe.

ASV_Original: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,
ASV_Paraphrased: the thirty-six were Joab's brother Elhanan, son of Dolan.
BBE_Original: Asahel, the brother of Joab, was one of the thirty; and Elhanan, the son of Dodai, of Beth-lehem,

ASV_Original: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Harodite, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika, Elika,
BBE_Original: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,

ASV_Original: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
ASV_Paraphrased: Ira the son of Ikesh, the Tekoite, Ira the son of Ikesh.
BBE_Original: Helez the Paltite, Ira, the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,

ASV_Original: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
ASV_Paraphrased: Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunnai, Hushathite, Anathothite, Mebunn
BBE_Original: Abiezer the Anathothite, Sibbecai the Hushathite,

ASV_Original: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Ahohite, the Netophathite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ahohite, the Ah
BBE_Original: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

ASV_Original: Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Baanah, the son of Ribai, the son of Gibeah, the children of Benjamin.
BBE_Original: Heldai, the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai, the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,

ASV_Original: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash.
ASV_Paraphrased: Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash, Gaash
BBE_Original: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the valleys of Gaash,

ASV_Original: Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
ASV_Paraphrased: Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite, Azmaveth the Barhumite
BBE_Original: Abiel the Arbathite, Azmaveth of Bahurim,

ASV_Original: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
ASV_Paraphrased: Jasmine, the daughter of the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
BBE_Original: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, Jashen the Gunite,

ASV_Original: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Hararite, Ahiam, the son of the Ararite, the Ararite.
BBE_Original: Jonathan, the son of Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam, the son of Sharar the Hararite,

ASV_Original: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam, the son of Ahithophel, Gilonite.
BBE_Original: Eliphelet, the son of Ahasbai the Maacathite, Eliam, the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,

ASV_Original: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Arbite, the Ar
BBE_Original: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Archite,

ASV_Original: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
ASV_Paraphrased: the son of Nathan, Bani Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite, the Gadite,
BBE_Original: Igal, the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,

ASV_Original: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armorbearers to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
ASV_Paraphrased: Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the armor of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
BBE_Original: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, who had the care of the arms of Joab, son of Zeruiah,

ASV_Original: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
ASV_Paraphrased: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
BBE_Original: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

ASV_Original: Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Hittite: 30 and seven.
BBE_Original: Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in number.

ASV_Original: When Israel went forth out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language;
ASV_Paraphrased: the house of Jacob from the people of the strange tongue;
BBE_Original: When Israel came out of Egypt, the children of Jacob from a people whose language was strange to them;

ASV_Original: Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
ASV_Paraphrased: he became a refuge, Israel his territory.
BBE_Original: Judah became his holy place, and Israel his kingdom.

ASV_Original: The sea saw it, and fled; The Jordan was driven back.
ASV_Paraphrased: the sea was running, and the Jordan was running away.
BBE_Original: The sea saw it, and went in flight; Jordan was turned back.

ASV_Original: The mountains skipped like rams, The little hills like lambs.
ASV_Paraphrased: the mountains were like rams, the hills like lambs.
BBE_Original: The mountains were jumping like goats, and the little hills like lambs.

ASV_Original: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest? Thou Jordan, that thou turnest back?
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, Jordan, you're turning back, you sea?
BBE_Original: What was wrong with you, O sea, that you went in flight? O Jordan, that you were turned back?

ASV_Original: Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams; Ye little hills, like lambs?
ASV_Paraphrased: the mountains, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills, the hills
BBE_Original: You mountains, why were you jumping like goats, and you little hills like lambs?

ASV_Original: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, At the presence of the God of Jacob,
ASV_Paraphrased: the Lord's presence, the presence of God, the presence of God, the presence of God.
BBE_Original: Be troubled, O earth, before the Lord, before the God of Jacob;

ASV_Original: Who turned the rock into a pool of water, The flint into a fountain of waters.
ASV_Paraphrased: the stone was turned into a pool of water, and the stone was turned into a pool of water.
BBE_Original: Who made the rock into a water-spring, and the hard stone into a fountain.

ASV_Original: Why are times not laid up by the Almighty? And why do not they that know him see his days?
ASV_Paraphrased: why don't they see the days of the Almighty?
BBE_Original: Why are times not stored up by the Ruler of all, and why do those who have knowledge of him not see his days?

ASV_Original: There are that remove the landmarks; They violently take away flocks, and feed them.
ASV_Paraphrased: they remove the landmarks; they're violently removing the flock, and they feed them.
BBE_Original: The landmarks are changed by evil men, they violently take away flocks, together with their keepers.

ASV_Original: They drive away the ass of the fatherless; They take the widow's ox for a pledge.
ASV_Paraphrased: they take the fatherless, the widow's ox, and the promise of the widow.
BBE_Original: They send away the ass of him who has no father, they take the widow's ox for debt.

ASV_Original: They turn the needy out of the way: The poor of the earth all hide themselves.
ASV_Paraphrased: the poor are hiding in the way of the poor: The poor are hiding in the way of the poor.
BBE_Original: The crushed are turned out of the way; all the poor of the earth go into a secret place together.

ASV_Original: Behold, as wild asses in the desert They go forth to their work, seeking diligently for food; The wilderness yieldeth them bread for their children.
ASV_Paraphrased: the desert is full of wild asses, looking for food, and the desert is full of bread for the kids.
BBE_Original: Like asses in the waste land they go out to their work, looking for food with care; from the waste land they get bread for their children.

ASV_Original: They cut their provender in the field; And they glean the vintage of the wicked.
ASV_Paraphrased: they cut the grain in the field; they take the bad.
BBE_Original: They get mixed grain from the field, and they take away the late fruit from the vines of those who have wealth.

ASV_Original: They lie all night naked without clothing, And have no covering in the cold.
ASV_Paraphrased: they're naked all night, they don't have a coat, and they don't have a cover in the cold.
BBE_Original: They take their rest at night without clothing, and have no cover in the cold.

ASV_Original: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, And embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
ASV_Paraphrased: the mountains are wet, the rocks are wet, and they're looking for shelter.
BBE_Original: They are wet with the rain of the mountains, and get into the cracks of the rock for cover.

ASV_Original: There are that pluck the fatherless from the breast, And take a pledge of the poor;
ASV_Paraphrased: take the poor from the breast, and promise to give them a promise;
BBE_Original: The child without a father is forced from its mother's breast, and they take the young children of the poor for debt.

ASV_Original: So that they go about naked without clothing, And being hungry they carry the sheaves.
ASV_Paraphrased: they're naked, hungry, and they carry the sheaves.
BBE_Original: Others go about without clothing, and though they have no food, they get in the grain from the fields.

ASV_Original: They make oil within the walls of these men; They tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
ASV_Paraphrased: they drink oil in the walls of these men; they drink wine and drink.
BBE_Original: Between the lines of olive-trees they make oil; though they have no drink, they are crushing out the grapes.

ASV_Original: From out of the populous city men groan, And the soul of the wounded crieth out: Yet God regardeth not the folly.
ASV_Paraphrased: the people groaned, and the wounded groaned, but God did not care.
BBE_Original: From the town come sounds of pain from those who are near death, and the soul of the wounded is crying out for help; but God does not take note of their prayer.

ASV_Original: These are of them that rebel against the light; They know not the ways thereof, Nor abide in the paths thereof.
ASV_Paraphrased: they know not the ways of the light, nor abide in the path thereof.
BBE_Original: Then there are those who are haters of the light, who have no knowledge of its ways, and do not go in them.

ASV_Original: The murderer riseth with the light; He killeth the poor and needy; And in the night he is as a thief.
ASV_Paraphrased: the killer is rising with the light; he's killing the poor and needy.
BBE_Original: He who is purposing death gets up before day, so that he may put to death the poor and those in need.

ASV_Original: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, Saying, No eye shall see me: And he disguiseth his face.
ASV_Paraphrased: he waits for the twilight, and he says, "No one will see me." He's hiding his face.
BBE_Original: And the man whose desire is for the wife of another is waiting for the evening, saying, No eye will see me; and he puts a cover on his face. And in the night the thief goes about;

ASV_Original: In the dark they dig through houses: They shut themselves up in the day-time; They know not the light.
ASV_Paraphrased: they dig in the dark, they don't know the light.
BBE_Original: In the dark he makes holes in the walls of houses: in the daytime they are shutting themselves up, they have no knowledge of the light.

ASV_Original: For the morning is to all of them as thick darkness; For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.
ASV_Paraphrased: it's all the same for the morning, for they know the horror of the thick darkness.
BBE_Original: For the middle of the night is as morning to them, they are not troubled by the fear of the dark.

ASV_Original: Swiftly they pass away upon the face of the waters; Their portion is cursed in the earth: They turn not into the way of the vineyards.
ASV_Paraphrased: they are quickly passed by the water; their part is cursed in the land: They don't go to the vineyard.
BBE_Original: They go quickly on the face of the waters; their heritage is cursed in the earth; the steps of the crusher of grapes are not turned to their vine-garden.

ASV_Original: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: So doth Sheol those that have sinned.
ASV_Paraphrased: so the snow water is consumed by drought and heat: So it is with those who have sinned.
BBE_Original: Snow waters become dry with the heat: so do sinners go down into the underworld.

ASV_Original: The womb shall forget him; The worm shall feed sweetly on him; He shall be no more remembered; And unrighteousness shall be broken as a tree.
ASV_Paraphrased: the womb will forget him; the worm will be happy to feed him; He will not remember him.
BBE_Original: The public place of his town has no more knowledge of him, and his name has gone from the memory of men: he is rooted up like a dead tree.

ASV_Original: He devoureth the barren that beareth not, And doeth not good to the widow.
ASV_Paraphrased: the barren is not good for the widow, and she doesn't do good to the widow.
BBE_Original: He is not kind to the widow, and he has no pity for her child.

ASV_Original: Yet God preserveth the mighty by his power: He riseth up that hath no assurance of life.
ASV_Paraphrased: God's power is strong, and he will not be able to protect himself.
BBE_Original: But God by his power gives long life to the strong; he gets up again, though he has no hope of life.

ASV_Original: God giveth them to be in security, and they rest thereon; And his eyes are upon their ways.
ASV_Paraphrased: he gives them security, and they rest there; and his eyes are on them.
BBE_Original: He takes away his fear of danger and gives him support; and his eyes are on his ways.

ASV_Original: They are exalted; yet a little while, and they are gone; Yea, they are brought low, they are taken out of the way as all others, And are cut off as the tops of the ears of grain.
ASV_Paraphrased: they are exalted, but they are a little while, and they are gone, and they are taken away as the ears of grain.
BBE_Original: For a short time they are lifted up; then they are gone; they are made low, they are pulled off like fruit, and like the heads of grain they are cut off.

ASV_Original: And if it be not so now, who will prove me a liar, And make my speech nothing worth?
ASV_Paraphrased: who will prove me a liar, and I'm not worth anything?
BBE_Original: And if it is not so, now, who will make it clear that my words are false, and that what I say is of no value?

ASV_Original: Bless Jehovah, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless his holy name.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my soul, and all my soul, bless the name of God.
BBE_Original: <Of David.> Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let everything in me give praise to his holy name.

ASV_Original: Bless Jehovah, O my soul, And forget not all his benefits:
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my soul, forget not all the benefits of God:
BBE_Original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let not all his blessings go from your memory.

ASV_Original: Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; Who healeth all thy diseases;
ASV_Paraphrased: forgive me for all my sins; I have healed them.
BBE_Original: He has forgiveness for all your sins; he takes away all your diseases;

ASV_Original: Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; Who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
ASV_Paraphrased: who will give you lovingkindness and kindness to your life;
BBE_Original: He keeps back your life from destruction, crowning you with mercy and grace.

ASV_Original: Who satisfieth thy desire with good things, So that thy youth is renewed like the eagle.
ASV_Paraphrased: you will be satisfied with good things, so that your youth will be rejuvenated like the eagle.
BBE_Original: He makes your mouth full of good things, so that your strength is made new again like the eagle's.

ASV_Original: Jehovah executeth righteous acts, And judgments for all that are oppressed.
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezekiel's righteous deeds, and the judgments of all who suffer.
BBE_Original: The Lord gives decisions in righteousness for all who are in trouble.

ASV_Original: He made known his ways unto Moses, His doings unto the children of Israel.
ASV_Paraphrased: he told Moses, the way he was doing it to the children of Israel.
BBE_Original: He gave knowledge of his way to Moses, and made his acts clear to the children of Israel.

ASV_Original: Jehovah is merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness.
ASV_Paraphrased: he is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and generous in love.
BBE_Original: The Lord is kind and full of pity, not quickly made angry, but ever ready to have mercy.

ASV_Original: He will not always chide; Neither will he keep his anger for ever.
ASV_Paraphrased: he won't always be angry, but he won't be able to keep his anger.
BBE_Original: His feeling will no longer be bitter; he will not keep his wrath for ever.

ASV_Original: He hath not dealt with us after our sins, Nor rewarded us after our iniquities.
ASV_Paraphrased: he hasn't dealt with us after our sins, nor has he rewarded us for our sins.
BBE_Original: He has not given us the punishment for our sins, or the reward of our wrongdoing.

ASV_Original: For as the heavens are high above the earth, So great is his lovingkindness toward them that fear him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he loves them so much that he fears him, as the sky is high above the ground.
BBE_Original: For as the heaven is high over the earth, so great is his mercy to his worshippers.

ASV_Original: As far as the east is from the west, So far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
ASV_Paraphrased: so far as the east is from the west, we have removed our sins from them.
BBE_Original: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he put our sins from us.

ASV_Original: Like as a father pitieth his children, So Jehovah pitieth them that fear him.
ASV_Paraphrased: as a father's father, he's afraid of his children, so Jehovah is afraid of them.
BBE_Original: As a father has pity on his children, so the Lord has pity on his worshippers.

ASV_Original: For he knoweth our frame; He remembereth that we are dust.
ASV_Paraphrased: he knows our frame, he remembers we're dust.
BBE_Original: For he has knowledge of our feeble frame; he sees that we are only dust.

ASV_Original: As for man, his days are as grass; As a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's a grass, like a flower in the field, so he's like a flower.
BBE_Original: As for man, his days are as grass: his beautiful growth is like the flower of the field.

ASV_Original: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; And the place thereof shall know it no more.
ASV_Paraphrased: the wind is blowing over him, and he's gone; and the place will be no more.
BBE_Original: The wind goes over it and it is gone; and its place sees it no longer.

ASV_Original: But the lovingkindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, And his righteousness unto children's children;
ASV_Paraphrased: for the love of God is eternal, and the love of the children of God is eternal.
BBE_Original: But the mercy of the Lord is eternal for his worshippers, and their children's children will see his righteousness;

ASV_Original: To such as keep his covenant, And to those that remember his precepts to do them.
ASV_Paraphrased: to those who remember the commandments, to do them.
BBE_Original: If they keep his agreement, and have his laws in mind to do them.

ASV_Original: Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens; And his kingdom ruleth over all.
ASV_Paraphrased: Ezekiah's throne is in the sky; and his kingdom is over all.
BBE_Original: The Lord has made ready his high seat in the heavens; his kingdom is ruling over all.

ASV_Original: Bless Jehovah, ye his angels, That are mighty in strength, that fulfil his word, Hearkening unto the voice of his word.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, the angels, the mighty ones, the ones who fulfill the word, they're listening to the voice of God.
BBE_Original: Give praise to the Lord, you his angels, who are great in strength, doing his orders, and waiting for his voice.

ASV_Original: Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts, Ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, all his hosts, the ministers of his, who are pleased with him.
BBE_Original: Give praise to the Lord, all you his armies; and you his servants who do his pleasure.

ASV_Original: Bless Jehovah, all ye his works, In all places of his dominion: Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
ASV_Paraphrased: for God's sake, all his works, all over the kingdom: Bless God, my soul.
BBE_Original: Give praise to the Lord, all his works, in all places under his rule: give praise to the Lord, O my soul.

ASV_Original: And Bezalel and Oholiab shall work, and every wise-hearted man, in whom Jehovah hath put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that Jehovah hath commanded.
ASV_Paraphrased: all wise men, who know how to work, will be able to do all the work for the service of the shrine, according to all that God has commanded them.
BBE_Original: So let Bezalel and Oholiab get to work, with every wise-hearted man to whom the Lord has given wisdom and knowledge, to do whatever is necessary for the ordering of the holy place, as the Lord has given orders.

ASV_Original: And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart Jehovah had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it:
ASV_Paraphrased: Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise man, who was in his heart, who was stirred by the desire to do it, even every one who was interested in him.
BBE_Original: Then Moses sent for Bezalel and Oholiab, and for all the wise-hearted men to whom the Lord had given wisdom, even everyone who was moved by the impulse of his heart to come and take part in the work:

ASV_Original: and they received of Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, wherewith to make it. And they brought yet unto him freewill-offerings every morning.
ASV_Paraphrased: they brought the children of Israel's gifts to the service of the sanctuary, and they gave them to Moses. And they gave them to Moses every morning.
BBE_Original: And they took from Moses all the offerings which the children of Israel had given for the building of the holy place. And still they went on giving him more free offerings every morning.

ASV_Original: And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they wrought;
ASV_Paraphrased: all the wise men who had worked in the temple, they all came out of the work they had done;
BBE_Original: Then the wise men, who were doing all the work of the holy place, came from their work;

ASV_Original: and they spake unto Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which Jehovah commanded to make.
ASV_Paraphrased: they said, the people are much more than enough for the service of the work God has commanded them to do.
BBE_Original: And said to Moses, The people are giving much more than is needed for the work which the Lord has given us orders to do.

ASV_Original: And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
ASV_Paraphrased: the people were ordered to stop working, and Moses commanded them to announce that no one should work for the offering of the shrine. So the people were ordered to stop working.
BBE_Original: So Moses made an order and had it given out through all the tents, saying, Let no man or woman make any more offerings for the holy place. So the people were kept from giving more.

ASV_Original: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
ASV_Paraphrased: it was enough to make everything, and too much.
BBE_Original: For the material they had was enough and more than enough for all the work which had to be done.

ASV_Original: And all the wise-hearted men among them that wrought the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim, the work of the skilful workman, Bezalel made them.
ASV_Paraphrased: the work of the wise men who made the work was ten curtains; blue, purple, purple, scarlet, and red, with cherubs, the work of the skilled.
BBE_Original: Then all the expert workmen among them made the House with its ten curtains; of the best linen, blue and purple and red, they made them, with winged ones worked by expert designers.

ASV_Original: The length of each curtain was eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains had one measure.
ASV_Paraphrased: the length of the curtain was eight and twenty cubits, and the width of the curtain was four cubits.
BBE_Original: Every curtain was twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

ASV_Original: And he coupled five curtains one to another: and the other five curtains he coupled one to another.
ASV_Paraphrased: he put five curtains together, and the other five were put together.
BBE_Original: And five curtains were joined together, and the other five curtains were joined together.

ASV_Original: And he made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling.
ASV_Paraphrased: in the edge of the curtain from the selvedge, he made a blue loop on the edge of the curtain: similarly he made a blue loop on the edge of the curtain.
BBE_Original: And they put twists of blue cord on the edge of the outside curtain of the first group, and in the same way on the outside curtain of the second group.

ASV_Original: Fifty loops made he in the one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling: the loops were opposite one to another.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was in the second coupling, and the loop was opposite the other.  50 times he was in the curtain, and 50 times he was in the edge of the curtain.
BBE_Original: Fifty twists on the one curtain and fifty on the edge of the curtain of the other group; the twists being opposite to one another.

ASV_Original: And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was one.
ASV_Paraphrased: he took a gold ring and put it on the other side of the curtain, and the tabernacle was one.
BBE_Original: And they made fifty hooks of gold, joining the curtains one to another with the hooks; and so the House was made.

ASV_Original: And he made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made a goat's hair curtain for the tent: 11 curtains.
BBE_Original: And they made curtains of goats' hair for the tent; eleven curtains were made.

ASV_Original: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain: the eleven curtains had one measure.
ASV_Paraphrased: the length of the curtain was thirty cubits, and the width of the curtain was four cubits.
BBE_Original: Every curtain was thirty cubits long and four cubits wide, all of the same measure.

ASV_Original: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
ASV_Paraphrased: he put five curtains together, and six together.
BBE_Original: Five curtains were joined together to make one group, and six curtains were joined together to make the other group.

ASV_Original: And he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made fifty passes on the edge of the curtain that was closest to the coupling, and fifty passes on the edge of the curtain that was closest to the second coupling.
BBE_Original: And they put fifty twists of cord on the edge of the outside curtain of the first group, and fifty twists on the edge of the outside curtain of the second group,

ASV_Original: And he made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
ASV_Paraphrased: he tied the tent together with brass, so that it might be one.
BBE_Original: And fifty hooks of brass for joining them together to make the tent.

ASV_Original: And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.
ASV_Paraphrased: he covered the tent with red-brown skin, and a cover of seal-covered skin.
BBE_Original: And they made a cover of sheepskins coloured red, to go over the tent, and a cover of leather over that.

ASV_Original: And he made the boards for the tabernacle, of acacia wood, standing up.
ASV_Paraphrased: he stood up and took the tabernacle's board.
BBE_Original: And for the uprights of the House they made boards of hard wood.

ASV_Original: Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
ASV_Paraphrased: the length of the board was a cubit and a half, and the width of the board was a cubit.
BBE_Original: The boards were ten cubits long and one cubit and a half wide.

ASV_Original: Each board had two tenons, joined one to another: thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made a pair of tenons, joined them together, and so he was all over the tabernacle.
BBE_Original: Every board had two tongues fixed into it; all the boards were made in this way.

ASV_Original: And he made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward;
ASV_Paraphrased: twenty boards for the south side of the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side;
BBE_Original: They made twenty boards for the south side of the House:

ASV_Original: and he made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made forty-two silver sockets under twenty boards; two under the first board, two under the second board, and two under the next board.
BBE_Original: And for these twenty boards, forty silver bases, two bases under every board, to take its tongues.

ASV_Original: And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,
ASV_Paraphrased: he made twenty boards on the north side of the tabernacle.
BBE_Original: And for the second side of the House, on the north, they made twenty boards,

ASV_Original: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
ASV_Paraphrased: two silver sockets under the table, two silver sockets under the table, two silver sockets under the table.
BBE_Original: With their forty silver bases, two bases for every board.

ASV_Original: And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
ASV_Paraphrased: six boards were made for the west part of the tabernacle.
BBE_Original: And for the west side of the House, at the back, they made six boards,

ASV_Original: And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was on the corner of the tabernacle in the back.
BBE_Original: And two boards for the angles at the back.

ASV_Original: And they were double beneath; and in like manner they were entire unto the top thereof unto one ring: thus he did to both of them in the two corners.
ASV_Paraphrased: in the two corners he was double beneath; and in the same way he was in the middle of the top of the two.
BBE_Original: These were joined together at the base and at the top to one ring, so forming the two angles.

ASV_Original: And there were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.
ASV_Paraphrased: there were eight boards, and the silver sockets were on each board.
BBE_Original: So there were eight boards with sixteen bases of silver, two bases under every board.

ASV_Original: And he made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
ASV_Paraphrased: five for the tabernacle's side, five for the tabernacle's side.
BBE_Original: And they made rods of hard wood; five for the boards on one side of the House,

ASV_Original: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
ASV_Paraphrased: five bars for the other side of the tabernacle, five bars for the tabernacle, and five bars for the tabernacle.
BBE_Original: And five for the boards on the other side of the House, and five for the boards at the back, on the west.

ASV_Original: And he made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other.
ASV_Paraphrased: he passed through the middle bar, passing through the two bars.
BBE_Original: The middle rod was made to go right through the rings of all the boards from one end to the other.

ASV_Original: And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
ASV_Paraphrased: he put gold on the gold, and the gold on the gold.
BBE_Original: All the boards were plated with gold, and the rings through which the rods went were of gold, and the rods were plated with gold.

ASV_Original: And he made the veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim, the work of the skilful workman, made he it.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made a blue, purple, scarlet, and fine-knit fabric with cherubs, the work of a skilled craftsman.
BBE_Original: And he made the veil of the best linen, blue and purple and red, worked with winged ones designed by expert workmen.

ASV_Original: And he made thereunto four pillars of acacia, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
ASV_Paraphrased: he made four pillars of acacia, and he put gold on them; and he put gold on the four sockets.
BBE_Original: And they made four pillars for it of hard wood plated with gold: they had hooks of gold and four silver bases.

ASV_Original: And he made a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer;
ASV_Paraphrased: the blue, purple, and scarlet fabric was woven by the embroidery, and the fine linen was woven by the embroidery;
BBE_Original: And they made a curtain for the door of the tent, of the best linen with needlework of blue and purple and red;

ASV_Original: and the five pillars of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold; and their five sockets were of brass.
ASV_Paraphrased: he had a gold-colored hook on the five pillars, and the brass was on the brass.
BBE_Original: And five pillars for the curtain, with their hooks; the heads of the pillars were of gold and they were circled with bands of gold; and their five bases were of brass.

ASV_Original: (in the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and besieged it;
ASV_Paraphrased: in the ninth year of the reign of Nebuchadrezzar, he attacked Jerusalem and besieged it; Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his troops.
BBE_Original: And it came about, that when Jerusalem was taken, (in the ninth year of Zedekiah, king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, with all his army, came against Jerusalem, shutting it in on every side;

ASV_Original: in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city),
ASV_Paraphrased: the city was breached by the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the fourth month of the month, the ninth day of the month.
BBE_Original: In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the town was broken into:)

ASV_Original: that all the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate, to wit, Nergal-sharezer, Samgar-nebo, Sarsechim, Rab-saris, Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, with all the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.
ASV_Paraphrased: the king of Babylon came in, sat down in the middle gate, and Nergal-sharezer, Sarsechim, Rab-saris, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal-sharezer, Nergal
BBE_Original: All the captains of the king of Babylon came in and took their places in the middle doorway of the town, Nergal-shar-ezer, ruler of Sin-magir, the Rabmag, and Nebushazban, the Rab-saris, and all the captains of the king of Babylon.

ASV_Original: And it came to pass that, when Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, then they fled, and went forth out of the city by night, by the way of the king's garden, through the gate betwixt the two walls; and he went out toward the Arabah.
ASV_Paraphrased: they fled, and the king of Judah and all the men of the army fled, and they fled into the king's garden, through the gate.
BBE_Original: And when Zedekiah, king of Judah, and all the men of war saw it, they went in flight from the town by night, by the way of the king's garden, through the doorway between the two walls: and they went out by the Arabah.

ASV_Original: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment upon him.
ASV_Paraphrased: they took him to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he was taken to the plains of Jericho by the army of the Chaldans.
BBE_Original: But the Chaldaean army went after them and overtook Zedekiah in the lowlands of Jericho: and they made him a prisoner and took him up to Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, to Riblah in the land of Hamath, to be judged by him.

ASV_Original: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes: also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah, and the king of Babylon killed all the nobles of Judah.
BBE_Original: Then the king of Babylon put the sons of Zedekiah to death before his eyes in Riblah: and the king of Babylon put to death all the great men of Judah.

ASV_Original: Moreover he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
ASV_Paraphrased: he bound him with ropes and carried him to Babylon.
BBE_Original: And more than this, he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and had him put in chains to take him away to Babylon.

ASV_Original: And the Chaldeans burned the king's house, and the houses of the people, with fire, and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Chaldeans burned the king's house and the houses of the people.
BBE_Original: And the Chaldaeans put the king's house on fire, as well as the houses of the people, and had the walls of Jerusalem broken down.

ASV_Original: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the residue of the people that remained in the city, the deserters also that fell away to him, and the residue of the people that remained.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guards, took the captives to Babylon, the rest of the people who remained in Babylon.
BBE_Original: Then Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, took away to Babylon as prisoners, all the rest of the workmen who were still in the town, as well as those who had given themselves up to him, and all the rest of the people.

ASV_Original: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, that had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.
ASV_Paraphrased: the poor of the people, Nebuzaradan, who had nothing, left the poor of the people, and the fields and vineyards were left.
BBE_Original: But Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, let the poorest of the people, who had nothing whatever, go on living in the land of Judah, and gave them vine-gardens and fields at the same time.

ASV_Original: Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon has taken charge of Jeremiah Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guards.
BBE_Original: Now Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, gave orders about Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, saying,

ASV_Original: Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will tell you what he will tell you, and he will do it well, but he will do it to you as he would have done to you.
BBE_Original: Take him and keep an eye on him and see that no evil comes to him; but do with him whatever he says to you.

ASV_Original: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushazban, Rab-saris, and Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon;
ASV_Paraphrased: Nebuzaradan, Nebushazban, and Nergal-sharezer, Rab-mag, and all the king's officers; Nebuzaradan, Nebushazban, and Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebushazban, Nebush
BBE_Original: So Nebuzaradan, the captain of the armed men, sent Nebushazban, the Rab-saris, and Nergal-shar-ezer, the Rabmag, and all the chief captains of the king of Babylon,

ASV_Original: they sent, and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should carry him home. So he dwelt among the people.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was taken to Gedaliah's house, and he took him to Shaphan's son Ahikam, who took him to his house.
BBE_Original: And they sent and took Jeremiah out of the place of the watchmen, and gave him into the care of Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to take him to his house: so he was living among the people.

ASV_Original: Now the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah, while he was shut up in the court of the guard, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: when he was in the guard, he heard the word of God, and said,
BBE_Original: Now the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the place of the armed watchmen, saying,

ASV_Original: Go, and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil, and not for good; and they shall be accomplished before thee in that day.
ASV_Paraphrased: so say the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I'm going to do it in this city, and not for good.
BBE_Original: Go and say to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: See, my words will come true for this town, for evil and not for good: they will come about before your eyes on that day.

ASV_Original: But I will deliver thee in that day, saith Jehovah; and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll give you the day of the Lord, and you won't be given to the men you're afraid of.
BBE_Original: But I will keep you safe on that day, says the Lord: you will not be given into the hands of the men you are fearing.

ASV_Original: For I will surely save thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee; because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll save you, and you won't be killed by the sword, but you'll be prey to me, because you're trusting me.
BBE_Original: For I will certainly let you go free, and you will not be put to the sword, but your life will be given to you out of the hands of your attackers: because you have put your faith in me, says the Lord.

ASV_Original: I am a rose of Sharon, A lily of the valleys.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valley.
BBE_Original: I am a rose of Sharon, a flower of the valleys.

ASV_Original: As a lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.
ASV_Paraphrased: love among the daughters is like a lily among thorns.
BBE_Original: As the lily-flower among the thorns of the waste, so is my love among the daughters.

ASV_Original: As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, So is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.
ASV_Paraphrased: I was delighted with the fruit of my beloved, and the apple tree was a pleasant place for me.
BBE_Original: As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, so is my loved one among the sons. I took my rest under his shade with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

ASV_Original: He brought me to the banqueting-house, And his banner over me was love.
ASV_Paraphrased: he brought me to the banquet, and his banner was love.
BBE_Original: He took me to the house of wine, and his flag over me was love.

ASV_Original: Stay ye me with raisins, refresh me with apples; For I am sick from love.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm sick of love, so I'm going to have to go to the raisins.
BBE_Original: Make me strong with wine-cakes, let me be comforted with apples; I am overcome with love.

ASV_Original: His left hand is under my head, And his right hand doth embrace me.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's holding my left hand and my right hand.
BBE_Original: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand is round about me.

ASV_Original: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, or by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, Until he please.
ASV_Paraphrased: oh, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God, my God,
BBE_Original: I say to you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes of the field, do not let love be moved till it is ready.

ASV_Original: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh, Leaping upon the mountains, Skipping upon the hills.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's coming, he's jumping, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding, he's skidding,
BBE_Original: The voice of my loved one! See, he comes dancing on the mountains, stepping quickly on the hills.

ASV_Original: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: Behold, he standeth behind our wall; He looketh in at the windows; He glanceth through the lattice.
ASV_Paraphrased: love is like a roe or a young hart: He's looking in the window, he's looking in the window.
BBE_Original: My loved one is like a roe; see, he is on the other side of our wall, he is looking in at the windows, letting himself be seen through the spaces.

ASV_Original: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
ASV_Paraphrased: my darling, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear, my dear
BBE_Original: My loved one said to me, Get up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

ASV_Original: For, lo, the winter is past; The rain is over and gone;
ASV_Paraphrased: the winter is over, the rain is gone, the snow is gone.
BBE_Original: For, see, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

ASV_Original: The flowers appear on the earth; The time of the singing of birds is come, And the voice of the turtle-dove is heard in our land;
ASV_Paraphrased: the birds are singing in the sky, and the turtle-dove is heard in the country;
BBE_Original: The flowers are come on the earth; the time of cutting the vines is come, and the voice of the dove is sounding in our land;

ASV_Original: The fig-tree ripeneth her green figs, And the vines are in blossom; They give forth their fragrance. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
ASV_Paraphrased: the fig-tree is ripening, and the vines are flowering; they give off their fragrance.
BBE_Original: The fig-tree puts out her green fruit and the vines with their young fruit give a good smell. Get up from your bed, my beautiful one, and come away.

ASV_Original: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, In the covert of the steep place, Let me see thy countenance, Let me hear thy voice; For sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll see your face, I'll see your face, I'll see your face, I'll see your face, I'll see your face, I'll see your face, I'll see your face.
BBE_Original: O my dove, you are in the holes of the mountain sides, in the cracks of the high hills; let me see your face, let your voice come to my ears; for sweet is your voice, and your face is fair.

ASV_Original: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, That spoil the vineyards; For our vineyards are in blossom.
ASV_Paraphrased: the foxes, the little foxes, the ones who destroy the vineyards, for our vineyards are blooming.
BBE_Original: Take for us the foxes, the little foxes, which do damage to the vines; our vines have young grapes.

ASV_Original: My beloved is mine, and I am his: He feedeth his flock among the lilies.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm his, and I'm his: He's feeding his flock in the lilies.
BBE_Original: My loved one is mine, and I am his: he takes his food among the flowers.

ASV_Original: Until the day be cool, and the shadows flee away, Turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart Upon the mountains of Bether.
ASV_Paraphrased: turn, my beloved, and be like a roe or a young horse on the mountains of Bether.
BBE_Original: Till the evening comes, and the sky slowly becomes dark, come, my loved one, and be like a roe on the mountains of Bether.

ASV_Original: Moreover Elihu answered and said,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I'm not going to be able to do it." Elihu said, and then he said, "I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I won't be able to."
BBE_Original: And Elihu made answer and said,

ASV_Original: Hear my words, ye wise men; And give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
ASV_Paraphrased: listen to me, you wise men, and listen to me, you who have knowledge.
BBE_Original: Give ear, you wise, to my words; and you who have knowledge, give attention to me;

ASV_Original: For the ear trieth words, As the palate tasteth food.
ASV_Paraphrased: the ear's tongue is a mouthful of words, as the tongue of the mouth.
BBE_Original: For words are tested by the ear, as food is tasted by the mouth.

ASV_Original: Let us choose for us that which is right: Let us know among ourselves what is good.
ASV_Paraphrased: let's choose what's good for us: Let's choose what's good for us.
BBE_Original: Let us make the decision for ourselves as to what is right; let us have the knowledge among ourselves of what is good.

ASV_Original: For Job hath said, I am righteous, And God hath taken away my right:
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm good, and God took my right away from me:
BBE_Original: For Job has said, I am upright, and it is God who has taken away my right;

ASV_Original: Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar; My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.
ASV_Paraphrased: despite my right, I'm considered a liar, though I'm not guilty of anything.
BBE_Original: Though I am right, still I am in pain; my wound may not be made well, though I have done no wrong.

ASV_Original: What man is like Job, Who drinketh up scoffing like water,
ASV_Paraphrased: who drinks like water, who drinks like water, who drinks like water.
BBE_Original: What man is like Job, a man who freely makes sport of God,

ASV_Original: Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, And walketh with wicked men?
ASV_Paraphrased: he goes to work with the workers of the devil, and he walks with the devil?
BBE_Original: And goes in the company of evil-doers, walking in the way of sinners?

ASV_Original: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing That he should delight himself with God.
ASV_Paraphrased: he says, It's not worth anything to a man to be happy with God.
BBE_Original: For he has said, It is no profit to a man to take delight in God.

ASV_Original: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: Far be it from God, that he should do wickedness, And from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
ASV_Paraphrased: God, if he does evil, and he does it to the Almighty, he's not doing it to God.
BBE_Original: Now then, you wise, take note; you men of knowledge, give ear to me. Let it be far from God to do evil, and from the Ruler of all to do wrong.

ASV_Original: For the work of a man will he render unto him, And cause every man to find according to his ways.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will give him work, and every man will find his way.
BBE_Original: For he gives to every man the reward of his work, and sees that he gets the fruit of his ways.

ASV_Original: Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly, Neither will the Almighty pervert justice.
ASV_Paraphrased: God will not do evil, nor will the Almighty be guilty of justice.
BBE_Original: Truly, God does not do evil, and the Ruler of all is not a false judge.

ASV_Original: Who gave him a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world?
ASV_Paraphrased: who gave him a charge to the earth? Or who's got the world?
BBE_Original: Who put the earth into his care, or made him responsible for the world?

ASV_Original: If he set his heart upon himself, If he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
ASV_Paraphrased: if he's going to take his heart and his soul, if he's going to take his breath.
BBE_Original: If he made his spirit come back to him, taking his breath into himself again,

ASV_Original: All flesh shall perish together, And man shall turn again unto dust.
ASV_Paraphrased: the flesh will be destroyed, the man will be dead.
BBE_Original: All flesh would come to an end together, and man would go back to the dust.

ASV_Original: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: Hearken to the voice of my words.
ASV_Paraphrased: listen, now you know what I'm talking about: Hear my words.
BBE_Original: If you are wise, take note of this; give ear to the voice of my words.

ASV_Original: Shall even one that hateth justice govern? And wilt thou condemn him that is righteous and mighty?â€”
ASV_Paraphrased: shall he be condemned for justice and power? -
BBE_Original: How may a hater of right be a ruler? and will you say that the upright Ruler of all is evil?

ASV_Original: Him that saith to a king, Thou art vile, Or to nobles, Ye are wicked;
ASV_Paraphrased: he says, Thou're a bad guy, or a bad guy, or a bad guy, or a bad guy.
BBE_Original: He who says to a king, You are an evil-doer; and to rulers, You are sinners;

ASV_Original: That respecteth not the persons of princes, Nor regardeth the rich more than the poor; For they all are the work of his hands.
ASV_Paraphrased: they don't care about the prince, nor the rich, but the poor.
BBE_Original: Who has no respect for rulers, and who gives no more attention to those who have wealth than to the poor, for they are all the work of his hands.

ASV_Original: In a moment they die, even at midnight; The people are shaken and pass away, And the mighty are taken away without hand.
ASV_Paraphrased: they die, even at midnight, and the people are gone, and the great are gone without hands.
BBE_Original: Suddenly they come to an end, even in the middle of the night: the blow comes on the men of wealth, and they are gone, and the strong are taken away without the hand of man.

ASV_Original: For his eyes are upon the ways of a man, And he seeth all his goings.
ASV_Paraphrased: he sees the way of a man, and he sees everything that goes on.
BBE_Original: For his eyes are on the ways of a man, and he sees all his steps.

ASV_Original: There is no darkness, nor thick gloom, Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
ASV_Paraphrased: where there is no darkness, nor thick darkness, where the wicked may hide.
BBE_Original: There is no dark place, and no thick cloud, in which the workers of evil may take cover.

ASV_Original: For he needeth not further to consider a man, That he should go before God in judgment.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's not thinking about a man who would be judged before God.
BBE_Original: For he does not give man a fixed time to come before him to be judged.

ASV_Original: He breaketh in pieces mighty men in ways past finding out, And setteth others in their stead.
ASV_Paraphrased: he breaks down the great men, and he sets them up in the place where they can find them.
BBE_Original: He sends the strong to destruction without searching out their cause, and puts others in their place.

ASV_Original: Therefore he taketh knowledge of their works; And he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
ASV_Paraphrased: he knows the work, and he's destroying them in the night, so they're destroyed.
BBE_Original: For he has knowledge of their works, overturning them in the night, so that they are crushed.

ASV_Original: He striketh them as wicked men In the open sight of others;
ASV_Paraphrased: they are evil men in the open view of others;
BBE_Original: The evil-doers are broken by his wrath, he puts his hand on them with force before the eyes of all onlookers.

ASV_Original: Because they turned aside from following him, And would not have regard in any of his ways:
ASV_Paraphrased: they turned away from him, and they didn't look at him in any way:
BBE_Original: Because they did not go after him, and took no note of his ways,

ASV_Original: So that they caused the cry of the poor to come unto him, And he heard the cry of the afflicted.
ASV_Paraphrased: he heard the poor cry, and he heard the suffering.
BBE_Original: So that the cry of the poor might come up to him, and the prayer of those in need come to his ears.

ASV_Original: When he giveth quietness, who then can condemn? And when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? Alike whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a man:
ASV_Paraphrased: when he's quiet, who's gonna be able to see him? And when he's hiding his face, who's gonna see him?

ASV_Original: That the godless man reign not, That there be none to ensnare the people.
ASV_Paraphrased: the godless man doesn't rule, so there's no one to catch the people.

ASV_Original: For hath any said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
ASV_Paraphrased: I will not offend anyone, I have borne the penalty, I will not offend anyone:

ASV_Original: That which I see not teach thou me: If I have done iniquity, I will do it no more?
ASV_Paraphrased: if I've done something wrong, I'll do it no more?

ASV_Original: Shall his recompense be as thou wilt, that thou refusest it? For thou must choose, and not I: Therefore speak what thou knowest.
ASV_Paraphrased: then you must choose, and not I: therefore, speak what you want.

ASV_Original: Men of understanding will say unto me, Yea, every wise man that heareth me:
ASV_Paraphrased: all wise men who hear me will say, Yes, every wise man who hears me:
BBE_Original: Men of knowledge, and all wise men, hearing me, will say,

ASV_Original: Job speaketh without knowledge, And his words are without wisdom.
ASV_Paraphrased: he speaks without knowledge, and his words are without wisdom.
BBE_Original: Job's words do not come from knowledge; they are not the fruit of wisdom.

ASV_Original: Would that Job were tried unto the end, Because of his answering like wicked men.
ASV_Paraphrased: because he answered like a bad man.
BBE_Original: May Job be tested to the end, because his answers have been like those of evil men.

ASV_Original: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin; He clappeth his hands among us, And multiplieth his words against God.
ASV_Paraphrased: he's gonna make us rebel against God, and he's gonna make us say a lot of things against God.
BBE_Original: For in addition to his sin, he is uncontrolled in heart; before our eyes he makes sport of God, increasing his words against him.

ASV_Original: Now concerning things sacrificed to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but love edifieth.
ASV_Paraphrased: we know that we all have knowledge, but love is not.
BBE_Original: Now about things offered to images: we all seem to ourselves to have knowledge. Knowledge gives pride, but love gives true strength.

ASV_Original: If any man thinketh that he knoweth anything, he knoweth not yet as he ought to know;
ASV_Paraphrased: he knows nothing, he doesn't know what he should know, he doesn't know what he should have known.
BBE_Original: If anyone seems to himself to have knowledge, so far he has not the right sort of knowledge about anything;

ASV_Original: but if any man loveth God, the same is known by him.
ASV_Paraphrased: if a man loves God, he knows the same thing.
BBE_Original: But if anyone has love for God, God has knowledge of him.

ASV_Original: Concerning therefore the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that no idol is anything in the world, and that there is no God but one.
ASV_Paraphrased: we know that there is no idol in the world, and that there is no God, but one.
BBE_Original: So, then, as to the question of taking food offered to images, we are certain that an image is nothing in the world, and that there is no God but one.

ASV_Original: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or on earth; as there are gods many, and lords many;
ASV_Paraphrased: but there's a lot of gods, even in heaven and on earth, as there are gods.
BBE_Original: For though there are those who have the name of gods, in heaven or on earth, as there are a number of gods and a number of lords,

ASV_Original: yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we unto him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we through him.
ASV_Paraphrased: there's one God, the Father, the one who's everything, and we're all to him.
BBE_Original: There is for us only one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we are for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we have our being through him.

ASV_Original: Howbeit there is not in all men that knowledge: but some, being used until now to the idol, eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.
ASV_Paraphrased: but there are some who have knowledge, but they are not used to the idol, and their conscience is weak.
BBE_Original: Still, all men have not that knowledge: but some, being used till now to the image, are conscious that they are taking food which has been offered to the image; and because they are not strong in the faith, their minds are troubled.

ASV_Original: But food will not commend us to God: neither, if we eat not, are we the worse; nor, if we eat, are we the better.
ASV_Paraphrased: if we don't eat, we won't be better, or worse.
BBE_Original: But God's approval of us is not based on the food we take: if we do not take it we are no worse for it; and if we take it we are no better.

ASV_Original: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to the weak.
ASV_Paraphrased: be careful not to make any of your freedom a stumbling block to the weak.
BBE_Original: But take care that this power of yours does not give cause for trouble to the feeble.

ASV_Original: For if a man see thee who hast knowledge sitting at meat in an idol's temple, will not his conscience, if he is weak, be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols?
ASV_Paraphrased: if a man sees you sitting in a meat-eating temple, he won't be able to eat anything sacrificed to idols, if he's weak?
BBE_Original: For if a man sees you, who have knowledge, taking food as a guest in the house of an image, will it not give him, if he is feeble, the idea that he may take food offered to images?

ASV_Original: For through thy knowledge he that is weak perisheth, the brother for whose sake Christ died.
ASV_Paraphrased: he who is weak is perishing, the brother who died for his sake.
BBE_Original: And so, through your knowledge, you are the cause of destruction to your brother, for whom Christ underwent death.

ASV_Original: And thus, sinning against the brethren, and wounding their conscience when it is weak, ye sin against Christ.
ASV_Paraphrased: so, when you sin against the brothers, you sin against God's will.
BBE_Original: And in this way, doing evil to the brothers, and causing trouble to those whose faith is feeble, you are sinning against Christ.

ASV_Original: Wherefore, if meat causeth my brother to stumble, I will eat no flesh for evermore, that I cause not my brother to stumble.
ASV_Paraphrased: if meat causes my brother to fall, I'm not gonna eat meat, so I don't cause my brother to fall.
BBE_Original: For this reason, if food is a cause of trouble to my brother, I will give up taking meat for ever, so that I may not be a cause of trouble to my brother.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "I have spoken to Moses, and I have spoken to Moses."
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to Moses,

ASV_Original: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When a man shall accomplish a vow, the persons shall be for Jehovah by thy estimation.
ASV_Paraphrased: when a man makes a promise, he will be for God by your estimation.
BBE_Original: Say to the children of Israel, If a man makes a special oath, you will give your decision as to the value of the persons for the Lord.

ASV_Original: And thy estimation shall be of the male from twenty years old even unto sixty years old, even thy estimation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
ASV_Paraphrased: after the shekel of the sanctuary, the silver will be worth 50 shekels, even after the silver of the sanctuary.
BBE_Original: And you will put the value of a male from twenty years to sixty years old at fifty shekels of silver, by the scale of the holy place.

ASV_Original: And if it be a female, then thy estimation shall be thirty shekels.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it's a woman, then it's 30 shekels.
BBE_Original: And if it is a female, the value will be thirty shekels.

ASV_Original: And if it be from five years old even unto twenty years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it's five years old, then it's twenty, and if it's twenty, then it's ten.
BBE_Original: And if the person is from five to twenty years old, the value will be twenty shekels for a male, and ten for a female.

ASV_Original: And if it be from a month old even unto five years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy estimation shall be three shekels of silver.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it's a month old, then it's a silver coin for the male five shekels, and the woman's worth is three shekels.
BBE_Original: And if the person is from one month to five years old, then the value for a male will be five shekels of silver, and for a female three shekels.

ASV_Original: And if it be from sixty years old and upward; if it be a male, then thy estimation shall be fifteen shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it's a man, then it's worth fifteen shekels, and for the woman, ten shekels.
BBE_Original: And for sixty years old and over, for a male the value will be fifteen shekels, and for a female, ten.

ASV_Original: But if he be poorer than thy estimation, then he shall be set before the priest, and the priest shall value him; according to the ability of him that vowed shall the priest value him.
ASV_Paraphrased: if he's poorer than your estimate, he'll be taken to the priest, and the priest will judge him according to his ability.
BBE_Original: But if he is poorer than the value which you have put on him, then let him be taken to the priest, and the priest will put a value on him, such as it is possible for him to give.

ASV_Original: And if it be a beast, whereof men offer an oblation unto Jehovah, all that any man giveth of such unto Jehovah shall be holy.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it's a monster, where they offer a sacrifice to God, all of them will be holy.
BBE_Original: And if it is a beast of which men make offerings to the Lord, whatever any man gives of such to the Lord will be holy.

ASV_Original: He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy.
ASV_Paraphrased: he must not change the beast, nor change the beast for the beast, and if he does, then both will be holy.
BBE_Original: It may not be changed in any way, a good given for a bad, or a bad for a good; if one beast is changed for another, the two will be holy.

ASV_Original: And if it be any unclean beast, of which they do not offer an oblation unto Jehovah, then he shall set the beast before the priest;
ASV_Paraphrased: if any unclean animal is offered to the priest, then the priest shall set the beast before the priest.
