BBE_Original: And if it is any unclean beast, of which offerings are not made to the Lord, then let him take the beast before the priest;

ASV_Original: and the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad: as thou the priest valuest it, so shall it be.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest will value it, whether good or bad: as you value it, so it will be.
BBE_Original: And let the priest put a value on it, if it is good or bad; whatever value the priest puts on it, so will it be.

ASV_Original: But if he will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part thereof unto thy estimation.
ASV_Paraphrased: then he will add the fifth part to your estimate if he really does.
BBE_Original: But if he has a desire to get it back for himself, let him give a fifth more than your value.

ASV_Original: And when a man shall sanctify his house to be holy unto Jehovah, then the priest shall estimate it, whether it be good or bad: as the priest shall estimate it, so shall it stand.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall estimate the priest's house, whether it is good or bad: as the priest shall estimate it, so shall it be.
BBE_Original: And if a man has given his house as holy to the Lord, then the priest will put a value on it, if it is good or bad; as the priest gives decision so will the value be fixed.

ASV_Original: And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shall be his.
ASV_Paraphrased: then he will add the fifth part of the money to him, and he will be his.
BBE_Original: And if the owner has a desire to get back his house, let him give a fifth more than your value, and it will be his.

ASV_Original: And if a man shall sanctify unto Jehovah part of the field of his possession, then thy estimation shall be according to the sowing thereof: the sowing of a homer of barley shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver.
ASV_Paraphrased: if a man is to be sanctified by the field of his own possession, then the price of barley is 50 shekels of silver.
BBE_Original: And if a man gives to the Lord part of the field which is his property, then let your value be in relation to the seed which is planted in it; a measure of barley grain will be valued at fifty shekels of silver.

ASV_Original: If he sanctify his field from the year of jubilee, according to thy estimation it shall stand.
ASV_Paraphrased: according to your estimate, he will be sanctified by the year of the Jubilee.
BBE_Original: If he gives his field from the year of Jubilee, the value will be fixed by your decision.

ASV_Original: But if he sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon unto him the money according to the years that remain unto the year of jubilee; and an abatement shall be made from thy estimation.
ASV_Paraphrased: if the priest sanctifies the field after the jubilee, then he shall reckon the money according to the years of the year of the jubilee.
BBE_Original: But if he gives his field after the year of Jubilee, the amount of the money will be worked out by the priest in relation to the number of years till the coming year of Jubilee, and the necessary amount will be taken off your value.

ASV_Original: And if he that sanctified the field will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shall be assured to him.
ASV_Paraphrased: if he sanctifies the field, then he will add the fifth part of the money to him, and he will be assured of his reward.
BBE_Original: And if the man who has given the field has a desire to get it back, let him give a fifth more than the price at which it was valued and it will be his.

ASV_Original: And if he will not redeem the field, or if he have sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more:
ASV_Paraphrased: if he doesn't sell the field, or if he sells it to someone else, it's not going to be redeemed:
BBE_Original: But if he has no desire to get it back, or if he has given it for a price to another man, it may not be got back again.

ASV_Original: but the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy unto Jehovah, as a field devoted; the possession thereof shall be the priest's.
ASV_Paraphrased: the field, when it's over, will be holy to God as a field of sacrifice; the possession of it will be the priest.
BBE_Original: But the field, when it becomes free at the year of Jubilee, will be holy to the Lord, as a field given under oath: it will be the property of the priest.

ASV_Original: And if he sanctify unto Jehovah a field which he hath bought, which is not of the field of his possession;
ASV_Paraphrased: if he sanctifies the field he bought, which he didn't own;
BBE_Original: And if a man gives to the Lord a field which he has got for money from another, which is not part of his heritage;

ASV_Original: then the priest shall reckon unto him the worth of thy estimation unto the year of jubilee: and he shall give thine estimation in that day, as a holy thing unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the priest shall reckon the value of your estimation at the year of the Jubilee: and he will give you an estimation of the holy thing that day.
BBE_Original: Then the value fixed by you up to the year of Jubilee will be worked out for him by the priest, and in that day he will give the amount of your value as holy to the Lord.

ASV_Original: In the year of jubilee the field shall return unto him of whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land belongeth.
ASV_Paraphrased: the field shall return to the buyer, even to the one who has the right to the land.
BBE_Original: In the year of Jubilee the field will go back to him from whom he got it, that is, to him whose heritage it was.

ASV_Original: And all thy estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.
ASV_Paraphrased: the shekel of the shrine is the price of the shekel: 20 shekels are the price.
BBE_Original: And let all your values be based on the shekel of the holy place, that is, twenty gerahs to the shekel.

ASV_Original: Only the firstling among beasts, which is made a firstling to Jehovah, no man shall sanctify it; whether it be ox or sheep, it is Jehovah's.
ASV_Paraphrased: no man shall sanctify the firstborn of beasts, which is the firstborn of the Lord.
BBE_Original: But a man may not give by oath to the Lord the first-fruits of cattle which are offered to the Lord: if it is an ox or a sheep it is the Lord's.

ASV_Original: And if it be of an unclean beast, then he shall ransom it according to thine estimation, and shall add unto it the fifth part thereof: or if it be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy estimation.
ASV_Paraphrased: if it be a filthy animal, then he will ransom it to your estimation, and he will add to it the fifth part thereof: or if not, he will sell it to your estimation.
BBE_Original: And if it is an unclean beast, then the owner of it may give money to get it back, in agreement with the value fixed by you, by giving a fifth more; or if it is not taken back, let it be given for money in agreement with your valuing.

ASV_Original: Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote unto Jehovah of all that he hath, whether of man or beast, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: no devoted thing, that a man would give to God, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his own possession, is sold or sold: every devoted thing is holy to God.
BBE_Original: But nothing which a man has given completely to the Lord, out of all his property, of man or beast, or of the land which is his heritage, may be given away or got back in exchange for money; anything completely given is most holy to the Lord.

ASV_Original: No one devoted, that shall be devoted from among men, shall be ransomed; he shall surely be put to death.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will be killed, he will be killed, he will be killed, he will be killed.
BBE_Original: Any man given completely to the Lord may not be got back: he is certainly to be put to death.

ASV_Original: And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land, or of the fruit of the tree, is Jehovah's: it is holy unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah's tithes are all the land, whether the land is fertile or not, or the fruit of the tree.
BBE_Original: And every tenth part of the land, of the seed planted, or of the fruit of trees, is holy to the Lord.

ASV_Original: And if a man will redeem aught of his tithe, he shall add unto it the fifth part thereof.
ASV_Paraphrased: if a man pays his tithe, he will add the fifth part to the tithe.
BBE_Original: And if a man has a desire to get back any of the tenth part which he has given, let him give a fifth more.

ASV_Original: And all the tithe of the herd or the flock, whatsoever passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holy unto Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: the tenth is holy to the Lord, whatever passes under the rod.
BBE_Original: And a tenth part of the herd and of the flock, whatever goes under the rod of the valuer, will be holy to the Lord.

ASV_Original: He shall not search whether it be good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he change it at all, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.
ASV_Paraphrased: he shall not search for good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he changes it, it will be holy.
BBE_Original: He may not make search to see if it is good or bad, or make any changes in it; and if he makes exchange of it for another, the two will be holy; he will not get them back again.

ASV_Original: These are the commandments, which Jehovah commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.
ASV_Paraphrased: these are the commandments of God's children in the mountains of Sinai.
BBE_Original: These are the orders which the Lord gave to Moses for the children of Israel in Mount Sinai.

ASV_Original: Now on the first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, while it was yet dark, unto the tomb, and seeth the stone taken away from the tomb.
ASV_Paraphrased: Mary Magdalene will come to the tomb on the first day of the week, and she will see the stone taken from the tomb.
BBE_Original: Now on the first day of the week, very early, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the place and saw that the stone had been taken away from it.

ASV_Original: She runneth therefore, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we know not where they have laid him.
ASV_Paraphrased: then Simon Peter, and the other disciple who loved Jesus, and he said to them, they took the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they hid him.
BBE_Original: Then she went running to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple who was loved by Jesus, and said to them, They have taken away the Lord out of the place of the dead and we have no knowledge where they have put him.

ASV_Original: Peter therefore went forth, and the other disciple, and they went toward the tomb.
ASV_Paraphrased: then the other disciple, and he went to the tomb.
BBE_Original: So Peter and the other disciple went out to the place of the dead.

ASV_Original: And they ran both together: and the other disciple outran Peter, and came first to the tomb;
ASV_Paraphrased: the other disciple ran away, and the first one to the tomb.
BBE_Original: They went running together, and the other disciple got in front of Peter and came first to the hole in the rock;

ASV_Original: and stooping and looking in, he seeth the linen cloths lying; yet entered he not in.
ASV_Paraphrased: he looked down, and he saw the linen cloths lying; but he did not enter.
BBE_Original: And looking in, he saw the linen bands on the earth; but he did not go in,

ASV_Original: Simon Peter therefore also cometh, following him, and entered into the tomb; and he beholdeth the linen cloths lying,
ASV_Paraphrased: then Peter came in, and he saw the linen cloths lying, and he was surprised.
BBE_Original: Then Simon Peter came after him and went into the hole in the rock; and he saw the linen bands on the earth,

ASV_Original: and the napkin, that was upon his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.
ASV_Paraphrased: the napkin lay on his head, not on the cloth, but on the ground.
BBE_Original: And the cloth, which had been round his head, not with the linen bands but rolled up in a place by itself.

ASV_Original: Then entered in therefore the other disciple also, who came first to the tomb, and he saw, and believed.
ASV_Paraphrased: he entered the tomb, and he saw the other disciple, who came first to the tomb.
BBE_Original: Then the other disciple who came there first went in; and he saw and belief came to him.

ASV_Original: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.
ASV_Paraphrased: they knew that he would be reborn again, but they didn't know the scripture.
BBE_Original: For at that time they had no knowledge that the Writings said that he would have to come again from the dead.

ASV_Original: So the disciples went away again unto their own home.
ASV_Paraphrased: the disciples returned to their homes again.
BBE_Original: So then the disciples went away again to their houses.

ASV_Original: But Mary was standing without at the tomb weeping: so, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb;
ASV_Paraphrased: Mary stood in the tomb, and she looked into the tomb; she wept.
BBE_Original: But Mary was still there outside the hole in the rock, weeping; and while she was weeping and looking into the hole,

ASV_Original: and she beholdeth two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
ASV_Paraphrased: she saw two angels sitting down, one on the head and one on the foot, where Jesus lay.
BBE_Original: She saw two angels in white seated where the body of Jesus had been, one at the head and the other at the feet.

ASV_Original: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.
ASV_Paraphrased: she said, 'Why weep, woman, 'cause they took my Lord and I don't know where they're taking him.
BBE_Original: They said to her, Woman, why are you weeping? She said to them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I have no knowledge where they have put him.

ASV_Original: When she had thus said, she turned herself back, and beholdeth Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.
ASV_Paraphrased: she turned, and she saw Jesus standing, and she knew it wasn't Jesus.
BBE_Original: And then looking round, she saw Jesus there, but had no idea that it was Jesus.

ASV_Original: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou hast borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you have taken him, tell me where you put him, woman, if you're the gardener.
BBE_Original: Jesus said to her, Woman, why are you weeping? who are you looking for? She, taking him for the gardener, said to him, Sir, if you have taken him away from here, say where you have put him and I will take him away.

ASV_Original: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turneth herself, and saith unto him in Hebrew, Rabboni; which is to say, Teacher.
ASV_Paraphrased: he says to her, Mary, and he says it in Hebrew, Rabboni.
BBE_Original: Jesus said to her, Mary! Turning, she said to him in Hebrew, Rabboni! (which is to say, Master).

ASV_Original: Jesus saith to her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended unto the Father: but go unto my brethren, and say to them, I ascend unto my Father and your Father, and my God and your God.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not yet to the Father, but I'm going to my brothers and tell them, I'm going to my father and your father.
BBE_Original: Jesus said to her, Do not put your hand on me, for I have not gone up to the Father: but go to my brothers and say to them, I go up to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.

ASV_Original: Mary Magdalene cometh and telleth the disciples, I have seen the Lord; and that he had said these things unto her.
ASV_Paraphrased: I saw the Lord, and he told me he had told her the things he had told her.
BBE_Original: Mary Magdalene went with the news to the disciples, and said she had seen the Lord and that he had said these things to her.

ASV_Original: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were shut where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus came to the door, and when the Jews were there, he stood in the doorway and said, Peace be with you.
BBE_Original: At evening on that day, the first day of the week, when, for fear of the Jews, the doors were shut where the disciples were, Jesus came among them and said to them, May peace be with you!

ASV_Original: And when he had said this, he showed unto them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad, when they saw the Lord.
ASV_Paraphrased: when they saw the Lord, they were glad, and they took off their hands and hands.
BBE_Original: And when he had said this, he let them see his hands and his side. Then the disciples were glad when they saw the Lord.

ASV_Original: Jesus therefore said to them again, Peace be unto you: as the Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
ASV_Paraphrased: Peace be with you, as the Father sent me, as the Father sent me.
BBE_Original: And Jesus said to them again, May peace be with you! As the Father sent me, even so I now send you.

ASV_Original: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Spirit:
ASV_Paraphrased: when he said this, he breathed into them, and said, Receive the Holy Spirit:
BBE_Original: And when he had said this, breathing on them, he said to them, Let the Holy Spirit come on you:

ASV_Original: whose soever sins ye forgive, they are forgiven unto them; whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.
ASV_Paraphrased: you forgive them, they forgive you, and you retain them.
BBE_Original: Any to whom you give forgiveness, will be made free from their sins; and any from whom you keep back forgiveness, will still be in their sins.

ASV_Original: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Jesus came, Thomas, one of the twelve, was not there.
BBE_Original: Now Thomas, one of the twelve, named Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

ASV_Original: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.
ASV_Paraphrased: except I'm gonna see the prints on his hands, and I'm gonna put my finger in the nail, and I'm gonna put my finger in the nail.
BBE_Original: So the other disciples said to him, We have seen the Lord. But he said to them, If I do not see in his hands the print of the nails and put my finger into the print of the nails, and if I do not put my hand into his side, I will never have belief.

ASV_Original: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus cometh, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus came, and the door was shut, and Thomas stood in the doorway and said, Peace be with you.
BBE_Original: And after eight days, his disciples were again in the house and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were shut, Jesus came, and taking his place in the middle of them, he said, May peace be with you!

ASV_Original: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and see my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and put it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said to Thomas, reach your finger, and look at my hands; and reach your hand, and hold it.
BBE_Original: Then he said to Thomas, Put out your finger, and see my hands; and put your hand here into my side: and be no longer in doubt but have belief.

ASV_Original: Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
ASV_Paraphrased: he answered, my Lord and God.
BBE_Original: And Thomas said in answer, My Lord and my God!

ASV_Original: Jesus saith unto him, Because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
ASV_Paraphrased: he said, 'Because you saw me, you've seen me, and you've believed it.'
BBE_Original: Jesus said to him, Because you have seen me you have belief: a blessing will be on those who have belief though they have not seen me!

ASV_Original: Many other signs therefore did Jesus in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book:
ASV_Paraphrased: the presence of the disciples, which is not written in this book, is therefore Jesus's sign:
BBE_Original: A number of other signs Jesus did before his disciples which are not recorded in this book:

ASV_Original: but these are written, that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye may have life in his name.
ASV_Paraphrased: it's written that you can believe Jesus is the son of God, and you can believe it's true.
BBE_Original: But these are recorded, so that you may have faith that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and so that, having this faith you may have life in his name.

ASV_Original: And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Judaea, because the Jews sought to kill him.
ASV_Paraphrased: when Jesus came to Galilee, he was not going to Judaea, because the Jews wanted to kill him.
BBE_Original: After this, Jesus went from place to place in Galilee. He did not go about in Judaea, because the Jews were looking for a chance to put him to death.

ASV_Original: Now the feast of the Jews, the feast of tabernacles, was at hand.
ASV_Paraphrased: there was a feast of Jews, a feast of tabernacles, and the feast of the tabernacle.
BBE_Original: But the feast of the Jews, the feast of tents, was near.

ASV_Original: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may behold thy works which thou doest.
ASV_Paraphrased: then he said, Depart, and go to Jerusalem, that your disciples may see what you're doing.
BBE_Original: So his brothers said to him, Go away from here into Judaea so that your disciples may see the works which you do.

ASV_Original: For no man doeth anything in secret, and himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou doest these things, manifest thyself to the world.
ASV_Paraphrased: if you do, you'll be known by the world.
BBE_Original: Because no man does things secretly if he has a desire that men may have knowledge of him. If you do these things, let yourself be seen by all men.

ASV_Original: For even his brethren did not believe on him.
ASV_Paraphrased: even his brothers didn't believe him.
BBE_Original: For even his brothers had no belief in him.

ASV_Original: Jesus therefore saith unto them, My time is not yet come; but your time is always ready.
ASV_Paraphrased: he therefore says to them, My time is not yet, but yours is.
BBE_Original: Jesus said to them, My time is still to come, but any time is good for you.

ASV_Original: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that its works are evil.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not gonna hate you, but I'm gonna hate you for it.
BBE_Original: It is not possible for you to be hated by the world; but I am hated by it, because I give witness that what it does is evil.

ASV_Original: Go ye up unto the feast: I go not up unto this feast; because my time is not yet fulfilled.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not going to the feast today, because I don't have time.
BBE_Original: Go you up to the feast: I am not going up now to the feast because my time has not fully come.

ASV_Original: And having said these things unto them, he abode still in Galilee.
ASV_Paraphrased: he remained in Galilee, and he said these things to them.
BBE_Original: Having said these things to them, he still kept in Galilee.

ASV_Original: But when his brethren were gone up unto the feast, then went he also up, not publicly, but as it were in secret.
ASV_Paraphrased: when his brothers were gone, he went to the feast, but he was not publicly known.
BBE_Original: But after his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he went up, not publicly, but in secret.

ASV_Original: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?
ASV_Paraphrased: the Jews then sought him at the feast, and they said, Where's he?
BBE_Original: At the feast the Jews were looking for him and saying, Where is he?

ASV_Original: And there was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him: some said, He is a good man; others said, Not so, but he leadeth the multitude astray.
ASV_Paraphrased: there was a lot of murmuring among the crowd, some said he was a good man, others said he was a fool.
BBE_Original: And there was much discussion about him among the mass of the people. Some said, He is a good man; but others said, No, he is giving people false ideas.

ASV_Original: Yet no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
ASV_Paraphrased: for fear of the Jews, no one spoke openly about him.
BBE_Original: But no man said anything about him openly for fear of the Jews.

ASV_Original: But when it was now the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the feast was over, Jesus went to the temple and taught.
BBE_Original: Now in the middle of the feast Jesus went up to the Temple and was teaching.

ASV_Original: The Jews therefore marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
ASV_Paraphrased: the Jews were amazed, saying, How do you know this man's letters?
BBE_Original: Then the Jews were surprised and said, How has this man got knowledge of books? He has never been to school.

ASV_Original: Jesus therefore answered them, and said, My teaching is not mine, but his that sent me.
ASV_Paraphrased: he answered, "I'm not my teacher, but his teacher. "I'm not his teacher, but his teacher. "
BBE_Original: Jesus gave them this answer: It is not my teaching, but his who sent me.

ASV_Original: If any man willeth to do his will, he shall know of the teaching, whether it is of God, or whether I speak from myself.
ASV_Paraphrased: any man who wishes to do his will, he will know what I mean, whether I'm talking about God or myself.
BBE_Original: If any man is ready to do God's pleasure he will have knowledge of the teaching and of where it comes from--from God or from myself.

ASV_Original: He that speaketh from himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh the glory of him that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he speaks from himself, seeking glory, but he's not interested in the glory of the one who sent him.
BBE_Original: The man whose words come from himself is looking for glory for himself, but he who is looking for the glory of him who sent him--that man is true and there is no evil in him.

ASV_Original: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you doeth the law? Why seek ye to kill me?
ASV_Paraphrased: why do you want to kill me?  Why don't you want to kill me?
BBE_Original: Did not Moses give you the law? Even so, not one of you keeps the law. Why have you a desire to put me to death?

ASV_Original: The multitude answered, Thou hast a demon: who seeketh to kill thee?
ASV_Paraphrased: the crowd answered, you have a demon: He's looking for you to kill you?
BBE_Original: The people said in answer, You have an evil spirit: who has any desire to put you to death?

ASV_Original: Jesus answered and said unto them, I did one work, and ye all marvel because thereof.
ASV_Paraphrased: I've done one job, and you're all surprised because of it.
BBE_Original: This was the answer of Jesus: I have done one work and you are all surprised at it.

ASV_Original: Moses hath given you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers); and on the sabbath ye circumcise a man.
ASV_Paraphrased: you have a circumcision on the Sabbath, not Moses, but your father.
BBE_Original: Moses gave you circumcision--not that it comes from Moses, but from the fathers--and even on the Sabbath you give a child circumcision.

ASV_Original: If a man receiveth circumcision on the sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken; are ye wroth with me, because I made a man every whit whole on the sabbath?
ASV_Paraphrased: you're upset because I made a man of a man on the Sabbath, and the law of Moses is not broken?
BBE_Original: If a child is given circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, why are you angry with me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?

ASV_Original: Judge not according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
ASV_Paraphrased: according to appearance, but according to the judgment of the judge.
BBE_Original: Let not your decisions be based on what you see, but on righteousness.

ASV_Original: Some therefore of them of Jerusalem said, Is not this he whom they seek to kill?
ASV_Paraphrased: they therefore sought to kill him, he said, Is he not the one they seek?
BBE_Original: Then some of the people of Jerusalem said, Is not this the man whose death is desired?

ASV_Original: And lo, he speaketh openly, and they say nothing unto him. Can it be that the rulers indeed know that this is the Christ?
ASV_Paraphrased: he's speaking openly, and they don't tell him anything. Can they really know it's the Lord?
BBE_Original: And here he is talking openly and they say nothing to him! Is it possible that the rulers have knowledge that this is truly the Christ?

ASV_Original: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when the Christ cometh, no one knoweth whence he is.
ASV_Paraphrased: but when the Lord comes, no one knows where he is.
BBE_Original: However, it is clear to us where this man comes from: but when the Christ comes no one will have knowledge where he comes from.

ASV_Original: Jesus therefore cried in the temple, teaching and saying, Ye both know me, and know whence I am; and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.
ASV_Paraphrased: he cried in the temple, and he taught and said, Ye know me, and you know where I'm from, and I'm not from myself, but he's from me.
BBE_Original: Then, when he was teaching in the Temple, Jesus said with a loud voice, You have knowledge of me and you have knowledge of where I come from; and I have not come of myself; but there is One who has sent me; he is true, but you have no knowledge of him.

ASV_Original: I know him; because I am from him, and he sent me.
ASV_Paraphrased: he sent me to him, and I'm from him.
BBE_Original: I have knowledge of him because I came from him and he sent me.

ASV_Original: They sought therefore to take him: and no man laid his hand on him, because his hour was not yet come.
ASV_Paraphrased: he therefore sought to take him: and no man was touching him, because he was not yet.
BBE_Original: Then they had a desire to take him: but no man put hands on him because his hour was still to come.

ASV_Original: But of the multitude many believed on him; and they said, When the Christ shall come, will he do more signs than those which this man hath done?
ASV_Paraphrased: many believed him, and they said, When the Lord comes, he will do more miracles than the man did?
BBE_Original: And numbers of the people had belief in him, and they said, When the Christ comes will he do more signs than this man has done?

ASV_Original: The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him; and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to take him.
ASV_Paraphrased: the Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring, and the Pharisees sent a messenger to take him.
BBE_Original: This discussion of the people came to the ears of the Pharisees; and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent servants to take him.

ASV_Original: Jesus therefore said, Yet a little while am I with you, and I go unto him that sent me.
ASV_Paraphrased: then I'll go with you, and I'll go to the one who sent me.
BBE_Original: Then Jesus said, I will be with you a little longer and then I go to him who sent me.

ASV_Original: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, ye cannot come.
ASV_Paraphrased: you'll find me, and you won't find me: and where I'm at, you can't find me.
BBE_Original: You will be looking for me, and you will not see me: and where I am you may not come.

ASV_Original: The Jews therefore said among themselves, Whither will this man go that we shall not find him? will he go unto the Dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks?
ASV_Paraphrased: so the Jews said, What will the man do to the Greeks? Will he go to the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
BBE_Original: So the Jews said among themselves, To what place is he going where we will not see him? will he go to the Jews living among the Greeks and become the teacher of the Greeks?

ASV_Original: What is this word that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me; and where I am, ye cannot come?
ASV_Paraphrased: you're looking for me, and you won't find me, and where I'm going, you can't find me?
BBE_Original: What is this saying of his, You will be looking for me and will not see me, and where I am you may not come?

ASV_Original: Now on the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me and drink.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jesus stood and cried, "If anyone wants to drink, come to me and drink. "
BBE_Original: On the last day, the great day of the feast, Jesus got up and said in a loud voice, If any man is in need of drink let him come to me and I will give it to him.

ASV_Original: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, from within him shall flow rivers of living water.
ASV_Paraphrased: the river of living water flows out of him, as the Bible says.
BBE_Original: He who has faith in me, out of his body, as the Writings have said, will come rivers of living water.

ASV_Original: But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believed on him were to receive: for the Spirit was not yet given; because Jesus was not yet glorified.
ASV_Paraphrased: he spoke of the Spirit, which they believed to be the Spirit of God: for the Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet known.
BBE_Original: This he said of the Spirit which would be given to those who had faith in him: the Spirit had not been given then, because the glory of Jesus was still to come.

ASV_Original: Some of the multitude therefore, when they heard these words, said, This is of a truth the prophet.
ASV_Paraphrased: they said, This is true, the prophet is true.
BBE_Original: When these words came to their ears, some of the people said, This is certainly the prophet.

ASV_Original: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, What, doth the Christ come out of Galilee?
ASV_Paraphrased: but some said, What, is the Christ coming from Galilee?
BBE_Original: Others said, This is the Christ. But others said, Not so; will the Christ come from Galilee?

ASV_Original: Hath not the scripture said that the Christ cometh of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?
ASV_Paraphrased: the Bible says the Lord will come from David's village, the village where David was born?
BBE_Original: Do not the Writings say that the Christ comes of the seed of David and from Beth-lehem, the little town where David was?

ASV_Original: So there arose a division in the multitude because of him.
ASV_Paraphrased: there was a division among the crowd because of him.
BBE_Original: So there was a division among the people because of him.

ASV_Original: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.
ASV_Paraphrased: he was taken by some of them, but no one touched him.
BBE_Original: And some of them had a desire to take him; but no man put hands on him.

ASV_Original: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why did ye not bring him?
ASV_Paraphrased: they answered, Why didn't you bring him to the priests and the Pharisees?
BBE_Original: Then the servants went back to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, Why have you not got him with you?

ASV_Original: The officers answered, Never man so spake.
ASV_Paraphrased: the officers answered, never mind what they were saying.
BBE_Original: The servants made answer, No man ever said things like this man.

ASV_Original: The Pharisees therefore answered them, Are ye also led astray?
ASV_Paraphrased: the Pharisees answered, Are you also deceived?
BBE_Original: Then the Pharisees said to them, Have you, like the others, been given false ideas?

ASV_Original: Hath any of the rulers believed on him, or of the Pharisees?
ASV_Paraphrased: did the Pharisees believe in him or the Pharisees believe in him?
BBE_Original: Have any of the rulers belief in him, or any one of the Pharisees?

ASV_Original: But this multitude that knoweth not the law are accursed.
ASV_Paraphrased: the multitude who don't know the law are cursed.
BBE_Original: But these people who have no knowledge of the law are cursed.

ASV_Original: Nicodemus saith unto them (he that came to him before, being one of them),
ASV_Paraphrased: he said to them (he who came before him),
BBE_Original: Nicodemus--he who had come to Jesus before, being himself one of them--said to them,

ASV_Original: Doth our law judge a man, except it first hear from himself and know what he doeth?
ASV_Paraphrased: if he hears himself and knows what he's doing, he'll be a judge, but he'll know what he's doing?
BBE_Original: Is a man judged by our law before it has given him a hearing and has knowledge of what he has done?

ASV_Original: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and see that out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.
ASV_Paraphrased: look, he's not a prophet from Galilee, is he?
BBE_Original: This was their answer: And do you come from Galilee? Make search and you will see that no prophet comes out of Galilee.

ASV_Original: [And they went every man unto his own house:
ASV_Paraphrased: they took all the men to their houses:
BBE_Original: [And every man went to his house;

ASV_Original: The word that came to Jeremiah from Jehovah, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: "Jehovah's word came to Jeremiah, saying, "Jehovah's word came to Jeremiah."
BBE_Original: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,

ASV_Original: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
ASV_Paraphrased: hear the words of the Covenant, and tell the people of Jerusalem and the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
BBE_Original: Give ear to the words of this agreement, and say to the men of Judah and to the people of Jerusalem,

ASV_Original: and say thou unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man that heareth not the words of this covenant,
ASV_Paraphrased: so says the Lord of Israel: Cursed be the man who doesn't hear the word of the Covenant,
BBE_Original: The Lord, the God of Israel, has said, Let that man be cursed who does not give ear to the words of this agreement,

ASV_Original: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God;
ASV_Paraphrased: I've told you, Obey my voice, and do what I command you, according to what I've told you: so will you be my father.
BBE_Original: To the order which I gave your fathers on the day when I took them out of the land of Egypt, out of the oven of iron, saying, Give ear to my voice, and do all the orders I have given you: so you will be my people, and I will be your God:

ASV_Original: that I may establish the oath which I sware unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day. Then answered I, and said, Amen, O Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: then I answered, and said, "Yes, O God, I swear to your father's promise to give him a country flowing with milk and honey."
BBE_Original: So that I may give effect to the oath which I made to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey as at this day. And I said in answer, So be it, O Lord.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
ASV_Paraphrased: I heard the words of the Covenant, and I heard them in the streets of Jerusalem, and I heard them in the streets of Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to me, Give out these words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Give ear to the words of this agreement and do them.

ASV_Original: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
ASV_Paraphrased: even as I was raised from the land of Egypt, I was protesting, even as I was protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
BBE_Original: For I gave certain witness to your fathers on the day when I took them up out of the land of Egypt, and even to this day, getting up early and witnessing and saying, Give ear to my voice.

ASV_Original: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the stubbornness of their evil heart: therefore I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did them not.
ASV_Paraphrased: they did not obey, nor did they listen, but they were stubborn, and I gave them all the words of the Covenant I commanded them to do, but they did not.
BBE_Original: But they gave no attention and did not give ear, but they went on, every man in the pride of his evil heart: so I sent on them all the curses in this agreement, which I gave them orders to keep, but they did not.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah said, "There's a conspiracy among the people of Judah and the people of Jerusalem.
BBE_Original: And the Lord said to me, There is an evil design at work among the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem.

ASV_Original: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words; and they are gone after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
ASV_Paraphrased: they have turned to the sins of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words, and they have gone to serve other gods: the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
BBE_Original: They are turned back to the sins of their fathers, who would not give ear to my words; they have gone after other gods and become their servants: the people of Israel and the people of Judah have not kept the agreement which I made with their fathers.

ASV_Original: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and they shall cry unto me, but I will not hearken unto them.
ASV_Paraphrased: and he will bring them to me, but I will not listen to them, for they will be bad, and they will be afraid of me.
BBE_Original: So the Lord has said, I will send evil on them, which they will not be able to get away from; and they will send up a cry for help to me, but I will not give ear to them.

ASV_Original: Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry unto the gods unto which they offer incense: but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
ASV_Paraphrased: the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will be crying to the gods of the gods they offer incense.
BBE_Original: Then the towns of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go crying for help to the gods to whom they have been burning perfumes: but they will give them no salvation in the time of their trouble.

ASV_Original: For according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
ASV_Paraphrased: according to the number of your cities, O Judah, and the number of the streets of Jerusalem, you have built altars to the shame of the thing, even altars to burn incense to Baal.
BBE_Original: For the number of your gods is as the number of your towns, O Judah; and for every street in Jerusalem you have put up altars to the Baal for burning perfumes to the Baal.

ASV_Original: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me because of their trouble.
ASV_Paraphrased: don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't worry about them, don't
BBE_Original: And as for you, make no prayers for this people, send up no cry or prayer for them: for I will not give ear to their cry in the time of their trouble.

ASV_Original: What hath my beloved to do in my house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
ASV_Paraphrased: when you do bad, you're happy to do it to my house, and the holy body is gone?
BBE_Original: About Judah. What have you to do in my house? is it your thought that oaths and holy flesh will get you out of your trouble? will you make yourself safe in this way?

ASV_Original: Jehovah called thy name, A green olive-tree, fair with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
ASV_Paraphrased: he called your name, a green olive tree, a good-sized fruit, with a great noise.
BBE_Original: You had been named by the Lord, A branching olive-tree, fair with beautiful fruit: with the noise of a great rushing he has put it on fire and its branches are broken.

ASV_Original: For Jehovah of hosts, who planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have wrought for themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense unto Baal.
ASV_Paraphrased: because of the evil of the house of Israel and the house of Judah, which they have done to provoke me, they have spoken against me with a bad word.
BBE_Original: For the Lord of armies, by whom you were planted, has given his decision for evil against you, because of the evil which the people of Israel and the people of Judah have done, In moving me to wrath by offering perfumes to the Baal.

ASV_Original: And Jehovah gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it: then thou showedst me their doings.
ASV_Paraphrased: then I knew it, and I knew it: Then you showed me the way.
BBE_Original: And the Lord gave me knowledge of it and I saw it: then you made clear to me their doings.

ASV_Original: But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm like a gentle lamb that's going to be killed, and I don't know if they've got any devices to destroy me, saying, Let's destroy the tree with the fruit.
BBE_Original: But I was like a gentle lamb taken to be put to death; I had no thought that they were designing evil against me, saying, Come and let us make trouble his food, cutting him off from the land of the living, so that there may be no more memory of his name.

ASV_Original: But, O Jehovah of hosts, who judgest righteously, who triest the heart and the mind, I shall see thy vengeance on them; for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have revealed my cause to you, O Jehovah, who judgest with his heart and soul, I will punish you.
BBE_Original: But, O Lord of armies, judging in righteousness, testing the thoughts and the heart, let me see your punishment come on them: for I have put my cause before you.

ASV_Original: Therefore thus saith Jehovah concerning the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of Jehovah, that thou die not by our hand;
ASV_Paraphrased: so the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, say, Thou don't want to be killed by God, that you don't die by God's hand;
BBE_Original: So this is what the Lord of armies has said about the men of Anathoth who have made designs against your life, saying, You are not to be a prophet in the name of the Lord, or death will overtake you by our hands:

ASV_Original: therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;
ASV_Paraphrased: so the young men die by the sword, their sons and daughters die of hunger; so I will punish them.
BBE_Original: So the Lord of armies has said, See, I will send punishment on them: the young men will be put to the sword; their sons and their daughters will come to death through need of food:

ASV_Original: and there shall be no remnant unto them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will destroy the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visit, for I will destroy them.
BBE_Original: Not one of them will keep his life, for I will send evil on the men of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.

ASV_Original: And the lot came out for the children of Joseph from the Jordan at Jericho, at the waters of Jericho on the east, even the wilderness, going up from Jericho through the hill-country to Beth-el;
ASV_Paraphrased: the children of Joseph from the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the Jordan River, the
BBE_Original: And the limit of the land marked out for the children of Joseph went out from Jordan at Jericho, at the waters of Jericho on the east, in the waste land, going up from Jericho through the hill-country to Beth-el;

ASV_Original: and it went out from Beth-el to Luz, and passed along unto the border of the Archites to Ataroth;
ASV_Paraphrased: from Beth-el to Luz, and then to the border of the Archites, he passed to Ataroth;
BBE_Original: And it goes out from Beth-el to Luz, and on as far as the limit of the Archites to Ataroth;

ASV_Original: and it went down westward to the border of the Japhletites, unto the border of Beth-horon the nether, even unto Gezer; and the goings out thereof were at the sea.
ASV_Paraphrased: the nethermost, even to Gezer, was a sea.
BBE_Original: And it goes down to the west to the limit of the Japhletites, to the limit of Beth-horon the lower, as far as Gezer; ending at the sea.

ASV_Original: And the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their inheritance.
ASV_Paraphrased: the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim took their inheritance.
BBE_Original: And the children of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, took their heritage.

ASV_Original: And the border of the children of Ephraim according to their families was thus: the border of their inheritance eastward was Ataroth-addar, unto Beth-horon the upper;
ASV_Paraphrased: the border of the children of Ephraim was thus: Ataroth-addar, Beth-horon's upper;
BBE_Original: And the limit of the land of the children of Ephraim by their families was marked out in this way: the limit of their heritage to the east was Ataroth-addar, to Beth-horon the higher;

ASV_Original: and the border went out westward at Michmethath on the north; and the border turned about eastward unto Taanath-shiloh, and passed along it on the east of Janoah;
ASV_Paraphrased: the border was westward, and the border was turning east to Taanath-shiloh, and the border was moving east to the east.
BBE_Original: The line goes out to the west at Michmethath on the north; then turning to the east to Taanath-shiloh, going past it on the east of Janoah;

ASV_Original: and it went down from Janoah to Ataroth, and to Naarah, and reached unto Jericho, and went out at the Jordan.
ASV_Paraphrased: from Janoah to Ataroth, and from Naarah to Jericho, and from Jericho to the Jordan.
BBE_Original: And from Janoah down to Ataroth, and to Naarah, and touching Jericho, it goes on to Jordan.

ASV_Original: From Tappuah the border went along westward to the brook of Kanah; and the goings out thereof were at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim according to their families;
ASV_Paraphrased: the tribe of the children of Ephraim, according to their families, is the inheritance of the tribe.
BBE_Original: From Tappuah the line goes on to the west to the river of Kanah; ending at the sea. This is the heritage of the children of Ephraim by their families;

ASV_Original: together with the cities which were set apart for the children of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.
ASV_Paraphrased: the cities of the children of Ephraim, the children of Manasseh, all the cities where the children of Manasseh lived.
BBE_Original: Together with the towns marked out for the children of Ephraim in the heritage of Manasseh, all the towns with their unwalled places.

ASV_Original: And they drove not out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer: but the Canaanites dwell in the midst of Ephraim unto this day, and are become servants to do taskwork.
ASV_Paraphrased: they didn't drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, but the Canaanites who live in the area today.
BBE_Original: And the Canaanites who were living in Gezer were not forced out; but the Canaanites have been living among Ephraim, to this day, as servants, doing forced work.

ASV_Original: Brethren, even if a man be overtaken in any trespass, ye who are spiritual, restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness; looking to thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
ASV_Paraphrased: brothers, even if a man is caught in a breach, you who are spiritual, you will restore him to a spirit of gentleness; you will not be tempted.
BBE_Original: Brothers, if a man is taken in any wrongdoing, you who are of the Spirit will put such a one right in a spirit of love; keeping watch on yourself, for fear that you yourself may be tested.

ASV_Original: Bear ye one another's burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
ASV_Paraphrased: you'll be burdened by others, and you'll fulfill the law of God.
BBE_Original: Take on yourselves one another's troubles, and so keep the law of Christ.

ASV_Original: For if a man thinketh himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.
ASV_Paraphrased: if a man thinks he's something when he's nothing, he's deceiving himself.
BBE_Original: For if a man has an idea that he is something when he is nothing, he is tricked by himself.

ASV_Original: But let each man prove his own work, and then shall he have his glorying in regard of himself alone, and not of his neighbor.
ASV_Paraphrased: then he will be able to show his own work, and then he will be proud of himself, not of his neighbour.
BBE_Original: But let every man make test of his work, and then will his cause for glory be in himself only, and not in his neighbour.

ASV_Original: For each man shall bear his own burden.
ASV_Paraphrased: each man is responsible for his own burden.
BBE_Original: Because every man is responsible for his part of the work.

ASV_Original: But let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.
ASV_Paraphrased: let him be taught in the word that he is good to teach him.
BBE_Original: But let him who gets teaching in the word give a part in all good things to his teacher.

ASV_Original: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
ASV_Paraphrased: God is not mocked, for what a man does, he will reap.
BBE_Original: Be not tricked; God is not made sport of: for whatever seed a man puts in, that will he get back as grain.

ASV_Original: For he that soweth unto his own flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth unto the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap eternal life.
ASV_Paraphrased: he will reap the corruption of his own body, but he will reap the eternal life of the Spirit.
BBE_Original: Because he who puts in the seed of the flesh will of the flesh get the reward of death; but he who puts in the seed of the Spirit will of the Spirit get the reward of eternal life.

ASV_Original: And let us not be weary in well-doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
ASV_Paraphrased: let us not be weary of good: We will reap if we don't.
BBE_Original: And let us not get tired of well-doing; for at the right time we will get in the grain, if we do not give way to weariness.

ASV_Original: So then, as we have opportunity, let us work that which is good toward all men, and especially toward them that are of the household of the faith.
ASV_Paraphrased: then, as we have opportunities, let's work together to do what's good for everyone, especially for those who live in the faith.
BBE_Original: So then, as we have the chance, let us do good to all men, and specially to those who are of the family of the faith.

ASV_Original: See with how large letters I write unto you with mine own hand.
ASV_Paraphrased: with my own hand, I write letters to you.
BBE_Original: See the size of the handwriting which I myself have made use of in writing to you.

ASV_Original: As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh, they compel you to be circumcised; only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.
ASV_Paraphrased: they force you to be circumcised, so that they don't have to be punished for the cross of Christ.
BBE_Original: Those who have the desire to seem important in the flesh, put force on you to undergo circumcision; only that they may not be attacked because of the cross of Christ.

ASV_Original: For not even they who receive circumcision do themselves keep the law; but they desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.
ASV_Paraphrased: but they don't want to keep the law, but they want to be circumcised, so they can show you their glory.
BBE_Original: Because even those who undergo circumcision do not themselves keep the law; but they would have you undergo circumcision, so that they may have glory in your flesh.

ASV_Original: But far be it from me to glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world hath been crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm not going to glory in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, for the world's crucifixion, and I for the world.
BBE_Original: But far be it from me to have glory in anything, but only in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which this world has come to an end on the cross for me, and I for it.

ASV_Original: For neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
ASV_Paraphrased: it's not circumcision, but a new creature.
BBE_Original: For having circumcision is nothing, and not having circumcision is nothing, but only a new order of existence.

ASV_Original: And as many as shall walk by this rule, peace be upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
ASV_Paraphrased: they will walk by this rule, and they will be blessed, and they will be blessed by God.
BBE_Original: And on all who are guided by this rule be peace and mercy, and on the Israel of God.

ASV_Original: Henceforth let no man trouble me; for I bear branded on my body the marks of Jesus.
ASV_Paraphrased: so I'm not going to be bothered by anyone, for I have Jesus's marks on my body.
BBE_Original: From this time on let no man be a trouble to me; because my body is marked with the marks of Jesus.

ASV_Original: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren. Amen.
ASV_Paraphrased: blessed be the spirit of our Lord Jesus Christ, my brothers.
BBE_Original: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers. So be it.

ASV_Original: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of Jehovah, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: the same year, in the fourth year of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fifth month, he was the son of Azzur, the prophet.
BBE_Original: And it came about in that year, when Zedekiah first became king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah, the son of Azzur the prophet, who came from Gibeon, said to Jeremiah in the house of the Lord, before the priests and all the people,

ASV_Original: Thus speaketh Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon, the God of Israel.
BBE_Original: These are the words of the Lord of armies, the God of Israel: By me the yoke of the king of Babylon has been broken.

ASV_Original: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of Jehovah's house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried to Babylon:
ASV_Paraphrased: I'll bring all the ships of the house of Jehovah, Nebuchadnezzar's king of Babylon, to Babylon in two years, and I'll take them to Babylon:
BBE_Original: In the space of two years I will send back into this place all the vessels of the Lord's house which Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, took away from this place to Babylon:

ASV_Original: and I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went to Babylon, saith Jehovah; for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
ASV_Paraphrased: I will bring the king of Judah, the son of Jehoiakim, with all the captives of Judah, to Babylon, for I will break the yoke of the king.
BBE_Original: And I will let Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, come back to this place, with all the prisoners of Judah who went to Babylon, says the Lord: for I will have the yoke of the king of Babylon broken.

ASV_Original: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of Jehovah,
ASV_Paraphrased: the prophet Hananiah, in the presence of the priests and the people, stood in front of the prophet Jeremiah.
BBE_Original: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, before the priests and all the people who had come into the house of the Lord,

ASV_Original: even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: Jehovah do so; Jehovah perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of Jehovah's house, and all them of the captivity, from Babylon unto this place.
ASV_Paraphrased: Jehovah, do you hear, the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!" And the prophet Jeremiah said, "Amen!"
BBE_Original: The prophet Jeremiah said, So be it: may the Lord do so: may the Lord give effect to the words which you have said, and let the vessels of the Lord's house, and all the people who have been taken away, come back from Babylon to this place.

ASV_Original: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people:
ASV_Paraphrased: I'm telling you now, in your ears and in the ears of all the people, this word:
BBE_Original: But still, give ear to this word which I am saying to you and to all the people:

ASV_Original: The prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.
ASV_Paraphrased: many countries, great kingdoms, and great cities, and many pestilence, and pestilence, were prophesied about, and many of them were prophesied.
BBE_Original: The prophets, who were before me and before you, from early times gave word to a number of countries and great kingdoms about war and destruction and disease.

ASV_Original: The prophet that prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that Jehovah hath truly sent him.
ASV_Paraphrased: when the prophet is known, the prophet will be known, that Jehovah has really sent him.
BBE_Original: The prophet whose words are of peace, when his words come true, will be seen to be a prophet whom the Lord has sent.

ASV_Original: Then Hananiah the prophet took the bar from off the prophet Jeremiah's neck, and brake it.
ASV_Paraphrased: Hananiah took the bar from the prophet Jeremiah's neck and stopped.
BBE_Original: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and it was broken by his hands.

ASV_Original: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon within two full years from off the neck of all the nations. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
ASV_Paraphrased: as the Lord said, so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon in two years.
BBE_Original: And before all the people Hananiah said, The Lord has said, Even so will I let the yoke of the king of Babylon be broken off the necks of all the nations in the space of two years. Then the prophet Jeremiah went away.

ASV_Original: Then the word of Jehovah came unto Jeremiah, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
ASV_Paraphrased: when Hananiah the prophet broke the bar from the prophet Jeremiah, the word of God came to Jeremiah, after the prophet Hananiah had broken the bar.
BBE_Original: Then after the yoke had been broken off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah by Hananiah the prophet, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,

ASV_Original: Go, and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith Jehovah: Thou hast broken the bars of wood; but thou hast made in their stead bars of iron.
ASV_Paraphrased: so sayeth the Lord: Thou have broken the bars of wood; but thou have made them into iron.
BBE_Original: Go and say to Hananiah, This is what the Lord has said: Yokes of wood have been broken by you, but in their place I will make yokes of iron.

ASV_Original: For thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.
ASV_Paraphrased: I have put a yoke on all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they will serve him:
BBE_Original: For the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: I have put a yoke of iron on the necks of all these nations, making them servants to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon; and they are to be his servants: and in addition I have given him the beasts of the field.

ASV_Original: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah: Jehovah hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.
ASV_Paraphrased: the prophet Jeremiah Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the prophet Hananiah, the
BBE_Original: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, Give ear, now, Hananiah; the Lord has not sent you; but you are making this people put their faith in what is false.

ASV_Original: Therefore thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will send thee away from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast spoken rebellion against Jehovah.
ASV_Paraphrased: so sayeth Jehovah, this year you will die, because you have spoken against God's word.
BBE_Original: For this reason the Lord has said, See, I will send you away from off the face of the earth: this year death will overtake you, because you have said words against the Lord.

ASV_Original: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
ASV_Paraphrased: the prophet died in the seventh month of the seventh month.
BBE_Original: So death came to Hananiah the prophet the same year, in the seventh month.

ASV_Original: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hacaliah. Now it came to pass in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,
ASV_Paraphrased: in the month of Chislev, in the twentieth year, I was in Shushan, the palace of the Hacaliah.
BBE_Original: The history of Nehemiah, the son of Hacaliah. Now it came about, in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, when I was in Shushan, the king's town,

ASV_Original: that Hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and certain men out of Judah; and I asked them concerning the Jews that had escaped, that were left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.
ASV_Paraphrased: I asked about the Jews who had escaped, and about Jerusalem, and Hanani, one of my brothers, came.
BBE_Original: That Hanani, one of my brothers, came with certain men from Judah; and in answer to my request for news of the Jews who had been prisoners and had got away, and of Jerusalem,

ASV_Original: And they said unto me, The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and the gates thereof are burned with fire.
ASV_Paraphrased: they said, the remnant of the captives in the province are in great distress and shame: the walls of Jerusalem are broken down, and the gates are burned with fire.
BBE_Original: They said to me, The small band of Jews now living there in the land are in great trouble and shame: the wall of Jerusalem has been broken down, and its doorways burned with fire.

ASV_Original: And it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days; and I fasted and prayed before the God of heaven,
ASV_Paraphrased: when I heard those words, I sat down and wept, and I was crying for days, and I prayed to God.
BBE_Original: Then, after hearing these words, for some days I gave myself up to weeping and sorrow, seated on the earth; and taking no food I made prayer to the God of heaven,

ASV_Original: and said, I beseech thee, O Jehovah, the God of heaven, the great and terrible God, that keepeth covenant and lovingkindness with them that love him and keep his commandments:
ASV_Paraphrased: I beg you, God, the great and terrible God, who keeps his word and loves them, I beg you, God, the great and terrible God, that he will keep his word and love them:
BBE_Original: And said, O Lord, the God of heaven, the great God, greatly to be feared, keeping faith and mercy with those who have love for him and are true to his laws:
